loans.name: Thokozani

texts.en:
Thokozani is 21 years old. He was old born in Salima and moved to Lilongwe to look for better opportunities. He is the second born in a family of four. Thokozani describes himself as a focused and determined person. He is requesting for his first Kiva loan in order to start running his own Zoona Mobile Money transfer business. His business will provide financial services to people in his community and help him to provide for his siblings.

With this Kiva loan, Thokozani will be able to have the funds needed for him to serve customers on a daily basis. He will also be able to purchase a trading trolley where he will serve his customers and buy web-enabled phone and cash box.

Thokozani's dream is to grow his business so that he can continue his education and keep on helping his community by employing people. He explains that employment in Malawi is very hard to find.

loans.use: purchase a trading trolley, a web-enabled phone and a cash box to start running his own money transfer business

loans.name: María Santos

texts.es:
María, de 53 años de edad, es ama de casa, por la falta de recursos económicos estudió solamente hasta noveno grado, está acompañada y tuvo 2 hijos, ambos lucharon en el campo para criar a sus hijos para que fueran personas de bien, ahora son mayores de edad y están casados, viven cerca de donde María y son muy unidos, más sin embargo María, paso una experiencia muy dura cuando hace un año falleció su pareja, eso le ha afectado ya que lo quería mucho.

María, aparte de ser ama de casa, también se dedica a la agricultura y a la ganadería desde que tenia 16 años de edad, le enseñaron sus padres y luego su esposo también le enseñó, porque él también conocía mucho sobre este oficio, cultiva maíz en un terreno que ha alquilado cercano a su vivienda.

María, necesita el préstamo para comprar 2 novillos de repasto, para engordarlos y venderlos cuando se acerque la fecha de pago de su crédito, con la ganancia comprará insumos agrícolas para su cultivo.

El sueño de María, es comprar un terreno para construir una vivienda digna y propia ya que donde vive actualmente es de un familiar.
texts.en:
Maria is 53 years old and a housewife.  Due to lack of economic resources, she only studied up until the ninth grade.  She is in a relationship and had 2 children.  Both she and her husband worked hard in the fields to raise their children so that they would become good people.  Now, they are adults and they are married.  They live near Maria and they are very close.  However, they are even closer now since a year ago Maria went through a very hard time when her partner passed away.  This affected her a lot since she loved him very much. 

Maria, aside from being a housewife, has also worked in farming and cattle raising since she was 16 years old.  She was taught it by her parents, and later her husband also taught her since he also knew a lot about this trade.  She grows corn on land that she has rented near her house. 

Maria needs the loan to buy two grazing calves in order to fatten them up and then sell them when the date for paying her loan approaches.  With the earnings she will buy agricultural supplies for her crops.

Maria's dream is to buy land on which to build her own decent home since the one she lives in now belongs to a relative.

loans.use: to buy two calves for grazing

loans.name: Elvie

texts.en:
Elvie is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a repair shop business in the Philippines. She is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to purchase additional spare parts and pay for the laborers' salaries for her repair shop business.

Elvie has been in this business for three years. She also earns more income from raising pigs. She has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college in the future.

loans.use: to purchase additional spare parts and pay for the laborers' salaries for her repair shop.

loans.name: Kondwani

texts.en:
Kondwani 22, was raised by his uncle in Lilongwe who always told him to stay in school and work hard. He followed this advice even though it was tough to get through secondary school due to financial difficulties. Kondwani's biggest challenge is finance to start up a small business as getting a job in Malawi is very challenging. 

Today, Kondwani is delighted to have the opportunity to be connected to Kiva lenders so that he can get his first loan and have the opportunity to start running his own Zoona business.This will help Kindwani to reduce the poverty levels in his family by enabling him to provide basic needs for his family. 

Kondwani's business will deal in providing the service of  Mobile money transfers and bill payments. 
Once Kondwani gets the Kiva loan, he will be able to purchase a small trolley where he will serve his customers. He will also purchase a web-enabled mobile phone and a cash box. 

He thanks the Kiva lenders for helping him and his family.

loans.use: To start running his Zoona money transfer business

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Esther is 36 years old. She is a single mother of two children whose ages are 12 and 15. She provides for her family financially through her work as a police officer.

Esther started her own Zoona business in order to earn more income to support her children as well as to benefit her community. Ether’s Zoona business provides financial services that would otherwise not be available to her community. Before she started her business, people would travel long distances in order to access banks or other financial institutions.

Esther is requesting a loan in order to expand her business to other rural communities that lack access to these financial services. This will allow her to grow her business, provide further financial support for her family and serve other communities that are in need of these services.

loans.use: to expand her business to other rural communities that lack access to financial services.

loans.name: Joveline

texts.en:
Joveline is a hardworking, woman entrepreneur with one child. She earns a living by raising livestock in the Philippines. She is borrowing PHP 11,000 through NWTF to buy feed and other supplies to raise her pigs.

She supplements this income with earnings from her direct selling avon products. Joveline dreams that one day she will be able to save enough to build a house for her family.

loans.use: to buy feed and other supplies to raise her pigs.

loans.name: Aracelis Del Carmen

texts.es:
Aracelis, tiene una venta de ropa para poder tener recursos económicos y cumplir con todos sus compromisos, aprendió a desarrollar esta actividad cuando por un tiempo fue empelada de una venta de ropa, tiene muchos conocimientos al respecto y desde hace un año tiene su negocio propio; Aracelis vive con sus padres y hermanos en casa familiar, tiene 19 años de avitar en el lugar, es soltera y no tiene hijos.
Hace la solicitud de un financiamiento con el que comprara un perchero metálico para mantener en orden las prendas de vestir, pretende mostrar mejor la mercadería y atender con mayor rapidez a sus clientes.
Sus objetivos son aumentar las ganancias, cancelar la deuda y crecer junto a su negocio.
texts.en:
Aracelis has a business selling clothes to be able to have economic resources and meet all of her commitments. She learned to develop this activity when for a time she was employed in the sale of clothes. She has much knowledge about it and for a year she has had her own business. Aracelis lives with her parents and siblings in a family home and has been living there for 19 years. She is single and does not have children.

She is requesting financing with which she will purchase a metal rack in order to keep clothing, and is intended to better show the merchandise and and respond more quickly to her customers.

Her objective is to increase her earnings, cancel her debt and grow together with her business.

loans.use: to buy a metal rack to keep her clothing in order and to better display the merchandise and respond quickly to her customers.

loans.name: Gloria Stella

texts.es:
Gloria es una persona enérgica, entusiasta, una mujer que no se rinde, que no pone excusas, una a la cual le cerraron varias puertas cuando se encontraba buscando empleo, pero su determinación por ser alguien en la vida la llevo a tomar el camino del emprendimiento y fue en el año 2014 cuando inicio un pequeño proyecto de venta de comida.
Este proyecto aunque parece pequeño lleva consigo todas las esperanzas e ilusiones de Gloria, sueños como comprar una vivienda, ilusiones tales como mejorar su condición de vida y se siente motivada al saber que su negocio crece y le demanda que invierta en él, para dar abasto a su público.
Es por este motivo que Gloria quiere solicitar un préstamo para la compra de activos para su negocio, estufa, mesas, sillas, horno, insumos que le servirán para la preparación de alimentos y para atender cómodamente a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Gloria is an energetic and enthusiastic person. She is a women who doesn't give up, doesn't give excuses. Many times she has had the door close on her when she has looked for employment, but her determination to be someone in life took her on the road to be an entrepreneur. In 2014 she began a small project in food sales. 

This project, although it seems small, brings all the hope and inspiration for Gloria; hopes such as to buy a house, inspiration such as to improve her living conditions. She feels motivated knowing that her business grows and demands for further investment in order to supply groceries to her customers. It is for this reason that Gloria wants to request a loan to buy assets for her business, cooker, tables, chairs, oven, supplies that will serve to prepare food and to attend her customers comfortably.

loans.use: to buy assets for her business, such as cooker, tables, chairs, oven, supplies that will serve to prepare food.

loans.name: Sharon

texts.en:
Sharon is a 39-year-old mother of five. She got her first Kiva loan six months ago, and has grown her business by 100 percent. She is very happy to be expanding her business.

She is taking out her second Kiva loan so that she can set up her second Zoona mobile money transfer business in Lusaka, Zambia. She has found a good location to set up a trading kiosk so that people in that community can have easy access to financial services.

Sharon wanted to take this opportunity to thank the Kiva lenders for their support. With the first loan, she was able to purchase a trading booth which she uses to serve her customers.

Sharon believes her business has seen successful because she treats her customers with respect. She says running a business is not easy but if you treat people right, then they will always come back to transact with you. When asked what she would like to say to the Kiva lenders, Sharon says the assistance from her lenders has changed her business. By owning the booth, she saves on rental costs.

With her second loan, Sharon will be able to pay for her set-up costs to open a new outlet. These include buying a trading kiosk, a web-enabled phone and having the float needed to serve customers.

Sharon hopes to continue expanding her business by opening up new outlets throughout the country.

loans.use: to pay for her set-up costs to open a new outlet. These include buying a trading kiosk, a web-enabled phone and having the float needed to serve customers.

loans.name: Mohammad

texts.en:
Mohammad is an ambitious, 23-year-old young man, living with his family that consists of six members in Ramtha-Jordan. He is a university student majoring in law, and he is in the middle of his journey.

Mohammad is seeking to work in his field after getting his Bachelors’. Now he is applying for this loan to be able to pay for his upcoming semester fees, which he couldn’t pay because of the financial crisis his family has been facing.

loans.use: to pay for his upcoming semester fees, which he couldn’t pay because of the financial crisis his family has been facing.

loans.name: Chiwanza

texts.en:
31-year-old Chiwanza has been running her Zoona mobile money transfer business for two years now. She works hard to support her parents, as well as her siblings through school.

This is Chiwanza’s second loan from Kiva. She would like to thank her lenders for the first loan they gave her. The loan helped her increase her working capital which enabled her to serve more customers and earn more profits, because she has cash to transact.

Chiwanza has been saving most of her profits in order to open another shop. She is requesting a second Kiva loan, so that she can have enough funds needed for her to expand her business to another location. The money will be used to buy a trading kiosk and to serve customers at the new location.

Chiwanza says in the business of mobile money transfers, money is always moving and as such the more customers you have, the more money you need to satisfy them. Chiwanza anticipates that her new location will see a lot of customers coming and going since it is located very close to the main market. This has the potential to give Chiwanza a lot of customers.

Chiwanza is hopeful that she will be able to earn more profits once she opens her second outlet. With the increased profits, Chiwanza would like to go back to school part-time; she has been focusing on educating her siblings so that they can be independent.

loans.use: to grow her business by opening up a new mobile money transfer outlet so that more people can have access to financial services

loans.name: Constance

texts.en:
Constance is 22 years old. She is single and is paying her way through college. Constance has just completed training with Zoona to finally make her dream of running her own business come true. She needs a loan to make her dream a reality.

When Constance finished secondary school, she did not have anyone to pay for her to go to college, she got a job working as a teller for one of the Zoona mobile money transfer outlets so that she could support herself through college. Constance learned how the business works and with the support of her boss, Sandra, branched out to set up her own business.

Constance will use this loan to start up a business of mobile money transfers by purchasing a trading booth, which she can use to serve her customers. She will also use the money to buy a mobile phone which she will use to facilitate transactions. Part of the funds will also be used as float to serve her customers when they need to send or receive money.

Constance explains how running her own business will give her the opportunity to improve her standard of living. This prospect excites her and she cannot wait to begin operating her very own Zoona mobile money outlet. She thanks the Kiva lenders for their support.

loans.use: to start running her own Zoona mobile money transfer business in Kitwe, Zambia.

loans.name: Trinity

texts.en:
Trinity is now successfully running his own Zoona mobile money transfer business in Livingstone, thanks to the support from Kiva. He is 28 years old and lives in a rented house with his two sisters and brother.

Trinity used his first loan to boost his working capital so that he could serve more customer at his trading booth. The booth is doing very well, and Trinity is happy with the number of transactions that he does on a day-to-day basis. In addition, Trinity was able to expand his products and increase his profits by adding mobile airtime top ups.

He says he values the loan he obtained, as it has also improved his life and made it easier for him to run his business. He has also purchased a laptop and is very excited.

Trinity is requesting a new loan because he would like to expand his business by opening up at another location in the Livingstone market. He is taking out the loan so that he can buy a trading kiosk and have the funds needed for him to serve customer at the new kiosk.

By opening this new location, Trinity will serve more customers and therefore earn more commissions. He intends to use the profits to move to a bigger place.

loans.use: to grow his Zoona mobile money transfer business by opening his second outlet in his town of Livingstone.

loans.name: Kate

texts.en:
Kate is a single mother living in Kasungu, Malawi with her 5-year-old daughter. She struggles to provide basic needs for herself and her daughter. She is requesting for a Kiva loan so that she can start running her own Zoona mobile money transfer business in Kasungu.

Kate says her life became difficult when her father passed away during the period of her secondary school education. “I wanted to complete my education but didn’t have the financial means after my father died and had to drop out of school” she says. Kate is very hardworking, she got a job as a receptionist and worked for a year, from her job she learnt how to interact with people, these are skills that she says she will use to make her mobile money transfer business a success.
   
When Kate receives the loan, she will use it to set up her business by purchasing a Zoona branded trading trolley, a web-enabled phone and a cash-box. This loan will also help Kate to facilitate the transactions by having the float needed for her to serve people who need to access financial services. Kate will use the profits from her business to provide basic needs for her daughter and herself.  

Kate's dream to give her daughter a better life than the one she had. She also hopes to go back to school so that she can lead as an example to her daughter.

loans.use: to set up business by purchasing a trading trolley, a web-enabled phone and facilitate the transactions for a money transfer service

loans.name: Omar

texts.en:
Omar is a 25-year-old, single man from Dier Al-Balah City, which is located in the Gaza Strip. 

Omar works as an employee in the public sector, where he earns a low income. His income barely covers all of his family's needs, but he wants to make his family more comfortable and improve their standard of living.

So, Omar took a USD loan from FATEN, which will enable him to buy a solar system for heating water for his family's house. By taking this loan, he will be able to decrease their electricity expenses, while using a cleaner form of energy (rather than gas). 

Omar’s family will have an easier time heating water for showers, cooking, and also washing clothes and dishes. 

Omar appears in the photo above.

loans.use: to buy a solar system for heating water for his family's house.

loans.name: Francisca

texts.es:
Siempre con la alegría que la caracteriza sale todos los días la señora Francisca a repartir sonrisas y cocinar deliciosos platos para satisfacer a sus clientes, esta persona que logro convertir su carisma en una fuerte campaña publicitaria para atraer mayor público, quiere solicitar tu ayuda, para que la impulsen, la motive, a seguir con su sueño de progreso, de salir de la pobreza, de ser un ejemplo para su comunidad, de sacar a sus hijos adelante, y lo hará solicitando un monto para la remodelación de su negocio, atendiendo al dicho que dice “que la comida entra por los ojos”.
Tú préstamo permitirá que Francisca continúe con su sueño de ser un restaurante reconocido en la ciudad y un día dejar el negocio a sus hijos, uno que sea considerado como el restaurante más alegre  y de buena sazón.
texts.en:
Always with happiness is what characterizes her. Every day, Mrs. Francisca gives smiles and cooks delicious plates to satisfy her customers. This person, who was able to convert her charisma into a strong campaign, will publicize to attract a larger customer base. She wants to request your help to inspire and motivate her to keep going with her dreams of progress, to get out of poverty, to be an example for her community, and to help her children get ahead. She will do this by requesting a loan for remodeling her business, paying attention to the saying, "food enters through the eyes". 

Your loan will permit Francisca to continue her dream to be a well known restaurant in the city and to one day leave the business to her children, a business that will be considered to be the most happy and with good taste.

loans.use: to invest in the appearance of the restaurant to give a better impression to the public.

loans.name: Caesar

texts.en:
Caesar, now 25 years old and a father of one, has been running his Zoona money transfer business for one year. He got his first Kiva loan in January and is making good payments. The loan helped Caesar to purchase the trading kiosk he was using to serve customers. By owning his trading kiosk, Caesar was able to save on rental costs. Today, Caesar has employed two people working for him.

He is requesting a second loan, so that he can open his second mobile money transfer outlet in his hometown and continue to grow his Zoona mobile money transfer business. He says the Kiva loan will help him satisfy the demand from his customers. Caesar is one of the Zoona mobile money agents in Lusaka and this puts pressure on him to always have money to serve customers. He would like to open a second shop to meet the growing demand and reduce some of the congestion that has accumulated at his first outlet.

Caesar will use his Kiva loan to purchase a trading booth, hire one more person, purchase a web-enabled phone and add to his working capital. Caesar would like to thank his Kiva lenders for their assistance. As a young micro-entrepreneur in Zambia, he says working capital finance is very difficult to find, and therefore he has appreciated the opportunity to be linked to Kiva lenders. He is now sending more money to support his son.

loans.use: to grow his business by opening his second mobile money transfer outlet in Lusaka, Zambia.

loans.name: Funny

texts.en:
Funny is a 26-year-old single mother of one. Her son is 7 years old and he goes to primary school. Funny completed her high school education in 2013 and immediately got a job working as a shop assistant for one year. 

Today, Funny is excited to be connected to Kiva lenders so that she can access her first loan to enable her make her dream of running her own business a reality.Funny's business will provide financial services to people in her community. 

Once Funny starts running her own business, people in her community will be able to go to her shop to send and receive money. Funny needs a loan to get the business started. With this loan, she will be able to start running her own business by purchasing a trolley where she will serve her customers, a web-enabled phone which she will use to make the transactions and a small cash box where she will keep her cash. This loan will also help Funny to provide the cash needed to serve her customers.

Being a single mother, Funny faces the challenge of having to provide for herself and her son. She explains that school fees are expensive and one needs an income to be able to pay. Her Kiva loan gives her the opportunity to make a difference in her life and her community. Funny will earn a profit from the transactions that she will be making. This will then help her to provide for herself and her child. The Zoona business will help her community access financial services easily. Funny says with the income from the business she will earn enough to live on her own, continue her education and give her son a better education.

loans.use: to start running her own business by purchasing a trolley, a web-enabled phone, a cash box and have the funds to serve people who need to access financial services

loans.name: Libertina

texts.en:
A loan of 10,000,000 IDR helps Libertina to introduce simple, life-saving technologies to her community such as solar lamps, water filters and clean cookstoves.
 
Libertina was born on Sabu Island in Eastern Indonesia. Receiving only primary school education did not hinder her passion to become a successful entrepreneur. She moved to Kupang, the provincial capital, to increase her opportunities. She is married with 3 children.
 
Libertina is a tenacious entrepreneur with a strong passion to learn and improve her business. She opened a small shop selling everyday goods and homemade donuts. While the donuts were a success, business was a little slow in the highly competitive market of everyday goods.
 
To increase her income, Libertina joined Kopernik’s Tech Kiosk network to sell simple life-changing technologies. She will use the loan to buy stock and grow her business. She and her husband go to community meetings to educate people on the cost-savings and health benefits of these products.

One of her dreams is to provide better education for her children. The income from her sales will help her increase savings for their future education.

loans.use: to introduce simple, clean energy products to her community.

loans.name: Candelaria

texts.es:
Candelaria, nunca fue a la escuela, está soltera y vive con su madre y sus dos hijas las cuales están estudiando; ella cuida de su madre porque es una señora de edad avanzada.

Candelaria, posee un puesto de frutas y verduras desde ya hace 2 años, el cual administra ella sola; antes trabajaba junto a una amiga y ahí fue donde aprendio este negocio y decidió dedicarse a eso, ella viaja a unos 5 kilómetros desde su casa hasta el puesto y vende de Lunes a Sábado, desde las 7:00 a.m. hasta las 4:00 p.m.

Candelaria, necesita el préstamo para surtir con más frutas su negocio y comprar mayor cantidad de frutas y verduras para ofrecer más barato a sus clientes.

Candelaria, sueña con tener el mejor puesto de frutas y verduras y que sus dos hijas crezcan y lleguen a ser todas unas profesionales.
texts.en:
Candelaria never attended school.  She is single and lives with her mother and her two daughters who attend school.  She cares for her mother because she is elderly.

Candelaria has owned a fruit and vegetable stand for two years which she runs herself.  Before, she worked with a friend and learned the business and decided to do this work.  She travels five kilometers from her home to the stand and sells from Monday to Sunday from 7:00am until 4:00pm.

Candelaria needs this loan to stock her business with more fruits and to purchase a larger quantity of fruits and vegetables so she can sell them at a lower price to her customers.

Candelaria dreams of having the best fruit and vegetable stand and she hopes that her daughters grow up and become professionals.

loans.use: to stock her business with more fruits and purchase a larger quantity of fruits and vegetables.

loans.name: Stephanita

texts.en:
Stephanita is a married woman with 2 children, all of whom attend school. She lives at her own house that has neither electricity nor piped water.

Stephanita has been operating a retail shop business for the past 3 years, selling household consumables such as sugar and wheat and maize flours. She faces the major challenge transporting her goods to her place of operation.

With the loan Stephanita is requesting, she wants to purchase stock of sugar, rice, and maize and wheat flours. She decided to join Yehu Microfinance Trust in order to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase stock of sugar, rice, and maize and wheat flours.

loans.name: Chanda

texts.en:
Chanda, 28, lives in Kampong Cham Province, Cambodia. She has 2 children. 

To earn a living, Chanda prepares and sells Khmer soup. On average, she is able to make an income of 6.00 USD per day. So far, she has been in this business for 5 years. 

Chanda's business runs well, and she wants to expand her stall to serve a large number of clients. Because she is short of funds, she is applying for a Kiva loan to buy a plot of land where she can build a sizeable stall. 

This loan will make a great contribution towards improving her business. She is thankful to all lenders for their financial support. She is waiting for your kindness.

loans.use: to buy a plot of land to build a sizeable food stall

loans.name: Yojanis

texts.es:
Yojanis es una madre soltera cabeza de familia de 35 años de edad, tiene tres hijos de 8, 10, 12, vive en la ciudad de Sincelejo, una zona difícil de vivir, debido a sus condiciones de pobreza y falta de oportunidades de empleo.

Pero para Yojanis una mujer a cargo de tres hijos no es ninguna excusa, está determinada mujer monto un negocio, guiada por clases y capacitaciones a la que se sometió, de salón de belleza y con este ha ido solventando sus necesidades económicas.

Pero Yojanis no se capacito solo para generar ingresos para sobrevivir, ella aspira a grandes cosas, a darle el mejor futuro a su familia, de luchar porque sus muchachos estudien, por tener una vivienda digna y piensa lograrlo de la mano de su negocio.
Solicita un préstamo para la remodelación del salón de belleza, publicidad, pintura, estanterías, uniformes, surtido de productos, será en lo que invertirá.

Apoya a Yojanis, un préstamo le brindara herramientas para seguir proyectando su negocio hacia el éxito.
texts.en: Yojanis is a single mother, the head of the family. She is 35 years old and has three children, who are 8, 10 and 12 years old. She lives in the city of Sincelejo, a difficult area to live because of its poverty conditions and the lack of employment opportunities. But for Yojanis, a woman in charge of her three children, this is no excuse. This determined woman started a business guided by beauty salon classes and trainings she had, and with this business she has been able to pay for her financial needs. But Yojanis not only trained to generate income to survive; she wants bigger things: to give her family a better future, to struggle so that her boys study, to have a decent house, and she plans to achieve it with her business. She is requesting a loan to remodel her beauty salon, to pay for advertisement, paint, shelves, uniforms and an assortment of products. Support Yojanis. Your loan will give her the tools to keep on projecting her business towards success.

loans.use: to remodel her beauty salon and to invest in advertisement, paint, shelves, uniforms and an assortment of products.

loans.name: Meselemani

texts.en:
Meselemani is a single woman with four children, two of whom attend school. She owns a house that has neither piped water nor electricity. 

Meselemani has operated a coconut business, selling at the market to her local customers. She dreams of expanding her business in the future.

With the 30,000 KES, she wants to purchase sacks of coconuts for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of coconuts for resale

loans.name: Halima

texts.en:
Halima is a married woman and has three children, two of whom attend school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food.

For the past two years, she has operated a timber selling business from home, selling to local neighbours. She faces a major challenge of seasonality as a major challenge to her business. She dreams of establishing a poultry business.

With the 25,000 KES, she wants to purchase timber for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase timber for resale

loans.name: Mwanajuma

texts.en:
Mwanajuma is a married woman with four kids, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

Mwanajuma operates a grocery and vegetables selling stall. She sells at the market to town dwellers and neighbors. She faces a challenge of high cost of transportation to her place of operation. 

With the 20,000 KES, she wants to purchase green vegetables, two crates of tomatoes, and onions for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase green vegetables, two crates of tomatoes, and onions for resale

loans.name: Tabitha

texts.en:
Tabitha is a married woman and she has two children. She operates a retail business where she sells clothes. She has been involved in this business for two years. Her business is located in a busy area and her primary customers are loyal. She describes her biggest business challenge to be insufficient funds.

She will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy more stock of clothes. This is her first loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank.

loans.use: to buy more stock of clothes.

loans.name: Beatriz Elena

texts.es:
Beatriz es una empresaria artesa de 37 años de edad, dedicada a fabricar sorprendentes piezas en madera, diferentes a lo visto en el mercado, trabaja 12 horas 3 días a la semana.
Beatriz no es solo una empresaria, ella es madre cabeza de familia de un hogar conformado por 3 mujeres, para ella, sus hijas lo son todo, representa toda su fuerza moral y sus ganas de superarse día a día.
El principal inconveniente que presenta en su trabajo son, los altos costos de insumos, es por ello que comprar en cantidad le sale más económico, pero muy pocas veces puede hacerlo debido a la enorme responsabilidad que tiene en su hogar.
Otro inconveniente de mayor gravedad es que se averió su máquina esto si es delicado, es por este razón y con urgencia que solicita un préstamo para la compra de una máquina “sin fin”.
el beneficio del préstamo es enorme ya que le permitirá tener la maquinaria para seguir desarrollando su actividad.
texts.en: Beatriz is a 37 year old handicraft businesswoman who works making surprising wooden pieces, different to those seen in the market. She works 12 hours, 3 days a week. Beatriz is not only a businesswoman, she is a mother, head of a family of a household formed by 3 women. For her, her daughters are everything; they represent all her moral strength and her wishes to progress day by day. The main obstacle in her job are the high costs of inputs. Therefore, buying in large quantity is much cheaper, but very few times she can do it because of the huge responsibility she has in her home. Another more serious problem is that her machine broke. This is why she is requesting a loan to buy a band saw machine. The benefits of the loan will be huge because it will allow her to have the machine to continue developing her job.

loans.use: to buy a band saw machine.

loans.name: Ahmad

texts.en:
Ahmad is 25 years old and lives in Ajloun. He is studying finance in his fourth year, which means that he is close to graduate. He likes his major and he hopes to work in the same field. He is working hard to finish his education, and he is working beside his study, as a waiter.

Lately he is facing financial crisis; therefore, he has applied for an educational loan to help him pay for his university and achieve his dreams.

loans.use: to pay for his university.

loans.name: Rehema

texts.en:
Rehema is a married mother of four children, all of whom attend school. She lives at her own house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food. For the past three years, she has operated a clothes-selling business, selling from door-to-door to her neighbors and passersby. She faces a major challenge of high cost of transportation.

With the loan that she is requesting of KES 30,000 she wants to purchase bales of clothes to sell. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bales of clothes to sell.

loans.name: Alfoita

texts.en:
A loan of IDR 10,000,000 helps Afloita to introduce simple, life-saving technologies such as solar lamps, water filters, and clean cook stoves to her community. Afloita was born and raised in Ende on the island of Flores in Indonesia. She moved to the neighboring island of West Timor after getting married. She is a famous cook in her area, selling Timorese traditional food from a pop-up stall in her yard. She started this business to generate income to support her husband with household expenses.

To increase her income, Afloita has joined Kopernik’s Tech Kiosk network to sell simple life-changing technologies. She will use the loan to buy stock and grow her business. She is excited about Kopernik’s training program to improve her business skills. Afloita plans to use the additional income to look after the needs of her three children and improve their education prospects.

loans.use: to introduce simple, life-saving technologies such as solar lamps, water filters and clean cook stoves to her community.

loans.name: Tima

texts.en:
Tima is married and has four children, all of whom attend school. She lives at her own house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees. Tima has operated a food selling business, making dumplings and flat bread to sell. She sells from home to her neighbors and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business.

With the KES 30,000 she wants to purchase bundles of wheat flour, cooking fat, and sugar. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of wheat flour, cooking fat and sugar.

loans.name: Nyae

texts.en:
Nyae is a married man with five children, all of whom attend school. He owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. His monthly expenses are food and school fees. He has operated a business of servicing vehicles for the past 15 years from his home.

With the loan he is requesting, he wants to purchase more spare parts to use in his vehicle repair business. He decided to join Yehu to access loans and expand his business.

loans.use: to purchase more spare parts to use in his vehicle repair business.

loans.name: Halima

texts.en:
Halima is a married woman with four kids, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food for the family and school fees. Halima operates a grocery, vegetable selling stall. She sells at the market to town dwellers and neighbors. She faces a challenge of high cost of transportation to her place of operation.

With the KES 30,000 she wants to purchase crates of tomatoes, onions and potatoes to sell. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase crates of tomatoes, onions and potatoes to sell.

loans.name: Mercedes

texts.es:
Mercedes es una mujer de 42 años de edad, vive con su pareja, tiene 2 hijos de 15 y 17 años, y su negocio es la confección de sábanas.
Ella es buena madre, emprendedora, independiente, amable, paciente, responsable y muy trabajadora. Su negocio lo realiza en la zona Sur de la ciudad, caracterizada por una intensa actividad económica que generó el asentamiento de los mercados más grandes de innumerables galerías y locales comerciales. De clima cálido sub tropical con una temperatura que varía durante el día entre 21-35 grados centígrados.
Mercedes es de tez morena, ojos pardos, cabello negro corto, baja estatura, complexión física mediana, su lengua materna es el Guaraní que se habla en el lugar y habla español por cultura general y por el negocio que realiza. Su vida la comparte con su pareja que trabaja como empleado y con sus hijos que estudian en la escuela. Viven en un cuarto alquilado construida de ladrillo y cemento con techo de calamina y piso de cemento que cuenta con energía eléctrica, agua potable y alcantarillado. Su negocio es la confección de sabanas para la venta por mayor, ella se encarga de compra cortes de tela para la confección de sabanas, edredones, cubrecamas y otros, “confecciono sábanas y las vendo por mayor, mi deseo es abrir una tienda para vender mis propias confecciones…” comenta. La ventaja de su negocio es que las ventas son por mayor las desventaja es la falta de capital para la compra de cortes de tela. Su sueño es abrir una tienda de venta de sábanas, ella desea realizar la compra de tela por cortes para abrir una tienda. Esta es la 1 secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 30 años que se dedica a esta actividad.
Es por esos motivos que Mercedes solicita un préstamo para la compra de cortes de tela para la confección de sabanas para abrir una tienda.
texts.en:
Mercedes is a 42-year-old woman.  She lives with her partner, has two children of 15 and 17 years of age, and she is in the business of constructing sheets.  She is a good mother and an entrepreneur.  She is independent, kind, patient, responsible and very hard-working.  She conducts her business in the South zone of the city, characterized by intense economic activity that led to the establishment of the biggest markets and innumerable shopping centers and commercial premises.  The city's climate is warm subtropical with a temperature that varies between 21-35 degrees Celsius during the day.  

Mercedes has a medium complexion, grayish-brown eyes, short black hair, and a short, strong stature.  Her native language is Guarani, which she speaks at home, and she speaks Spanish with the general public and for her business.  She shares her life with her partner, who is employed, and her children, who attend school.  They live in a rented room built of brick and cement with a corrugated iron roof and cement floor.  Their home has electricity, drinkable water, and sewage plumbing.  Her business is the construction and wholesaling of sheets.  She is responsible for purchasing cuts of fabric to construct sheets, comforters, bedspreads, and more.  "I construct sheets and sell them wholesale.  My wish is to open a store to sell my own products," she remarks.  The advantage of her business is that the sales are wholesale; the disadvantage is the lack of capital for the purchase of cuts of fabric.  Her dream is to open a store selling sheets.  She wishes to be able to purchase cuts of fabric in order to open a store.  This is the first sequence of loans in 30 years with this institution dedicated to this business.  It is for these reasons that Mercedes is requesting a loan.

loans.use: to purchase cuts of fabric to construct sheets and open a store

loans.name: Adela

texts.es:
Adela es una mujer de 42 años, soltera, tiene 2 hijos de 15 y 18 años, y su negocio es la elaboración y venta de bisutería. 
Ella es buena madre, independiente, emprendedora, amable, comunicativa, responsable y muy trabajadora. Su negocio lo realiza en la zona Sur de la ciudad; que se  caracteriza por acoger a la población migrante del campo-ciudad, que genera una intensa actividad económica conformada por el comercio minorista e informal, de clima cálido sub tropical con una temperatura que varía durante el día entre 21-35 grados centígrados.
Adela es de tez morena, ojos pardos, cabello negro largo, baja estatura, complexión física robusta, su lengua materna es el Guaraní que se habla en el lugar y habla español por cultura general y por el negocio que realiza. Su vida la comparte con sus hijos que estudian en la escuela, viven en un cuarto alquilado construido de ladrillo y cemento con techo de calamina y piso de cemento que cuenta con energía eléctrica, agua potable y alcantarillado. Su negocio es la elaboración y venta de bisutería, “confecciono manillas, collares, aretes, todo lo que nos gusta a nosotras, las mujeres…” comenta. La ventaja de su negocio es que cuenta con una cartera de clientes continua, la desventaja es la falta de capital para la compra de materiales de bisutería, como; piedras, alambre, perlas, cerámicas, etc. Su sueño es abrir una tienda de venta de bisutería, ella desea realizar la compra de materiales de bisutería. Esta es la 1 secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 5 años que se dedica a esta actividad.
Es por esos motivos que Adela solicita un préstamo para la compra de materiales de bisutería para abrir una tienda y ayudar a sus hijos a terminar la escuela.
texts.en:
Adela is a single woman, 42 years old, with 2 children aged 15 and 18.  Her business is the making and selling of jewelry.

She is a good mother, independent, entrepreneurial, friendly, sociable, responsible and very hard-working.  Her business is carried out in the southern part of the city which is characterized by its acceptance of the migrant population from the countryside.  This generates intense economic activity made up of informal retail commerce. The climate is warm and subtropical, with temperatures varying throughout the day between 21 and 35 degrees Celsius. 

Adela is short, robust, and dark-complexioned with brown eyes and long black hair. Her mother tongue is Guaraní, which she speaks where she lives, and she speaks Spanish because of the general culture and for her business.  She shares her life with her children who are in school. They live in rented quarters built of brick and cement with a sheet-metal roof and a cement floor.  It has electricity, drinking water and a sewage system. 

Her business is the making and selling of jewelry.  “I make bracelets, necklaces, earrings, all of which we women like,” she says.  The advantage of her business is that it has a group of continual customers.  The disadvantage is the lack of capital to buy jewelry-making materials such as stones, wire, pearls, ceramics etc. Her dream is to open a jewelry store.  She wishes to buy jewelry-making materials.  This is her first loan cycle with this institution in the 5 years that she has been doing this business.

It is for these reasons that Adela is requesting a loan to buy materials for making jewelry in order to open a store and help her children finish school.

loans.use: To buy jewelry to open a shop and help her children finish school.

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en:
Fatuma is married with two school-going children. They live at their own house that has electricity, but not piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees. She has operated a Khanga (women’s wrap cloth) selling business, selling from home and door-to-door to her neighbors and passersby. She faces a major challenge of lack of capital to expand her business.

With the loan she is requesting, she wants to purchase bales of Khanga’s to sell. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bales of Khanga’s to sell.

loans.name: Christine

texts.en:
Christine is a married woman with three children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has electricity but no piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

She has operated a butcher business for the past three years, selling goat meat at the market to neighbors and passersby. She mentioned perishability as a major challenge in her business.

With the loan, she wants to purchase a freezer to keep her meat for resale. She decided to join Yehu to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase a freezer to keep her meat for resale.

loans.name: Georgina

texts.en:
Georgina is a married woman. She owns a house that has piped water and electricity. Her greatest monthly expense is food.

Georgina has operated a tailoring business for the past three years. She makes women's suits and men's suits. Her potential clients are ladies and gents. She dreams of establishing a boutique in the future. 

With this 25,000 Kenyan shilling loan, she wants to purchase cloth and sewing thread for her business. She decided to join Yehu to access financial support to improve her business.

loans.use: to purchase cloth and sewing thread for her tailoring business

loans.name: Florence

texts.en: Florence would like to apply for another loan, this time for Kes 30,000 to purchase more stock of green vegetables, tomatoes, and onions. The more items displayed at the store, the better. More items to sell will result in better profit. Her profits from the business will definitely help her to sustain her daily needs and the educational expenses of her children. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

loans.use: to purchase more stock of green vegetables, tomatoes, and onions

loans.name: Janet

texts.en:
Janet, age 38, is a married woman who has been blessed with four children. She owns a house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

For the past four years, Janet has operated a retail shop business selling household consumables, such as wheat flour, rice and cooking oil. She cites theft and competition as the major challenges in her business. 

Janet is requesting a 20,000 Kenyan shilling loan to purchase stock. She dreams of expanding to a wholesale shop in the near future.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, tea leaves, and cooking fat oil for her shop

loans.name: Maryann

texts.en:
Maryann is a married woman with three children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is school fees.

She has operated a nursery school business for the past four years. She mentioned low turn up of students as a major challenge in her business. With the loan, she wants to build two more classes for her nursery school. She decided to join Yehu to expand her business.

loans.use: to build two more classes for her nursery school

loans.name: Fikira

texts.en:
Fikira, 35 years old, is a married woman with three kids, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has electricity but no piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food for the family and school fees.

Fikira operates a grocery stall, selling vegetables. She sells at the market to town dwellers and neighbors. She faces a challenge of the high cost of transportation to her place of operation. She dreams of expanding and establishing a wholesale business in the future.

With the Kshs 30,000, she wants to purchase two crates of tomatoes, potatoes and onions for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business

loans.use: to purchase two crates of tomatoes, potatoes and onions for resale.

loans.name: Maggie

texts.en:
Maggie is a married woman with four children, all of whom attend school. She lives in her own house that has electricity and piped water.

She has operated a retail shop business for the past two years, selling household consumables like wheat flour, maize flour, and sugar. She faces a major challenge of transportation in her business.

With the loan, she is requesting, she wants to purchase stock of sugar, rice, maize flour and wheat flour. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase stock of sugar, rice, maize flour and wheat flour.

loans.name: Mariam

texts.en:
Mariam is a married woman and has been blessed with three kids who attend school. She lives in her own house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is school fees.

Mariam has operated a poultry-selling business, which has been operational for over five years. She mentioned disease outbreak causing losses as a challenge in the business. Mariam dreams of becoming a wholesaler of poultry in the future.

With the Kshs 10,000, she wants to purchase chicks and poultry feed. She joined Yehu to access loans to boost her business

loans.use: to purchase chicks and poultry feed.

loans.name: Faiza

texts.en:
Faiza is a married woman with four children, who all attend school. She lives in her own house that has neither electricity nor piped water.

Faiza is taking out a Kiva loan of 30,000 Kenyan shillings to invest in her farming business. With this loan, Faiza plans to purchase seeds and fertilizers. She decided to join Yehu to improve her farming business.

loans.use: to purchase seeds and fertilizers for her farm

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is a married mother of five children, all of whom attend school. She lives in a rental house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food.

For the past six years, she has operated a clothes-selling business, selling from door to door to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of the high cost of transportation.

With the loan that she is requesting of Kes 50,000, she wants to purchase bales of clothes for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bales of clothes for resale

loans.name: Angelica Maria

texts.es:
Un sueño de estudiar, las ganas de salir adelante, de devolverle algo de lo mucho que le ha brindado su madre son algunas de las razones que llevaron a la joven Angélica a emprender un proyecto de venta de sandalias.
Está joven que apenas está iniciando su vida empresarial y por ende no cuenta con historial crediticio, encontró en una entidad financiera como Interactuar un apoyo para incentivar su actividad, ya que puede solicitar un préstamo para la compra de surtido de sandalias,(calzado de mayor venta, debido a su economía y comodidad).
Lo que hace especial este préstamo es que, la persona que este dispuesta a prestar, presenciara el nacimiento de una nueva empresaria y aportara al emprendimiento de jóvenes en Colombia, jóvenes que luchan por demostrar de que están hechos, jóvenes que quieren sacar su familia adelante, anímate y apóyala.
texts.en:
A dream of education, the will to get ahead, and to return a little of how much her mother has offered her are some of the reasons that brought the young Angélica to begin a project of selling sandals.

This young woman, who has barely begun her entrepreneurial life and for that matter doesn't have a credit history, found in a financial entity such as Interactuar support to stimulate her business, since she can apply for a loan for the purchase of a stock of sandals (the footwear that she sells the most because it is economical and comfortable).

What makes this loan special is that the person who is prepared to lend will be present at the birth of a new enterprise and will support the business venture of youths in Colombia, youths who strive to show that they prepared, young people who want to advance their families.

Dare to dream and support her!

loans.use: to buy a stock of sandals, the footwear that she sells the most because it is economical and comfortable

loans.name: Djiguitougou 10 Group

texts.fr: Fatoumata est une femme âgée de 37 ans mariée mère de 3 enfants dont tous scolarisée. Elle exerce le commerce depuis 8 ans. Ce qui fait marcher son activité c’est son expérience, son accueil et le respect des clients aussi l’emplacement de l’activité au marché. Elle veut le prêt pour acheter des légumes, choux, tomate, oignon en qualité suffisante). L’utilité du prêt c’est d’approvisionner sa marchandise en quantité suffisante afin de satisfaire sa clientèle. Elle a déjà reçu 11 fois le prêt  et à rembourser aux dates prévues.
texts.en:
Fatoumata is a 37-year old woman, married and the mother of three children, all of whom attend school. She has been working as a vendor for eight years. Her business thrives thanks to her experience, her friendly and respectful welcome as well as the location of her sales stand at the market. 

Fatoumata would like to use this loan to buy vegetables such as cabbage, tomatoes and onions in  sufficient quantities. Thanks to this loan, she will replenish her stock volume and be able to meet customer demand. She already obtained 11 prior loans and repaid all of them on time.

loans.use: to  stock up on vegetables, such as cabbage, tomatoes, and onions.

loans.name: Florence

texts.en:
Florence is a single woman with five school-going children. They live in a rental house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

She has operated a khanga (women's wrap cloth) business, selling from home and door to door to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of a lack of capital to expand her business.

With the loan she is requesting, she wants to purchase bales of khangas for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bales of khangas for resale.

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en:
Agnes is a married mother of two children, both of whom attend school. She owns a house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are school fees and household consumables.

For over two years, she has operated an open air food-selling business, selling from home to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her place of business.

With the Kshs 40,000, she wants to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, tea leaves, and cooking fat. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, tea leaves, and cooking fat

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en:
Beatrice is a married woman and has been blessed with four kids who all attend school. She lives in her own house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is school fees.

Beatrice operates a poultry-selling business, which has been operational for over seven years. She mentioned disease outbreak causing losses as a challenge in the business. Beatrice dreams of becoming a wholesaler of poultry in the future.

With the Kshs 35,000, she wants to purchase chicks and poultry feed. She joined Yehu to access loans to boost her business

loans.use: to purchase chicks and poultry feed.

loans.name: Lozi

texts.en:
Lozi is married and has four children. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is school fees for the family.

For the past seven years, she has operated a fruit and coconuts selling business. She sells to her neighbours and passersby. Her major challenge is the high cost of transportation to her place of operation.

With the Kes 20,000, she wants to purchase sacks of fruit and coconuts for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business and improve her living standards

loans.use: to purchase sacks of fruit and coconuts for resale.

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es:
Rosa es una mujer de 53 años de edad, vive con su pareja, tiene un hijo de 23 años, y su negocio es la confección de mantas con lana de vicuña.
Ella es buena madre, sincera, paciente, amigable, responsable y muy trabajadora. Su negocio lo realiza en la zona ‘Nueva tilata’ área central caracterizada por conectar a varias zonas mediante desvíos y cruce de caminos, de clima frío y seco con una temperatura que varía durante el día entre 0-12 grados centígrados.
Rosa es de tez morena, ojos pardos, cabello negro largo lo usa trenzado, baja estatura, complexión física delgada, su forma de vestir es tradicional (sombrero, manta y pollera), su lengua materna es el Aymará que se habla en el lugar y habla español por cultura general y por el comercio que realiza. Su vida la comparte con su esposo que trabaja y con su hijo que estudia y trabaja, viven en una casa propia construida de ladrillo y cemento con techo de calamina y piso de madera que cuenta con agua potable, energía eléctrica, gas domiciliario y alcantarillado. Su negocio es la elaboración de mantas con lana de vicuña; su trabajo consiste en recorres largas distancias en el altiplano en busca de productores de lana de vicuña, la cual limpia para luego hilvanarla, una vez que tiene suficiente lana se dispone a tejerla en un telar. La actividad es netamente artesanal y cada manta lleva un promedio de 2 a 3 semanas en terminarla. “inicie mi negocio por la invitación de una comadre que trabaja en esto desde antes y porque conozco los productores de lana del lugar…” comenta. La ventaja de su negocio es que las mantas de esa calidad tienen gran demanda, la desventaja es la falta de capital para la compra de lana de vicuña por mayor. Su sueño es crear una pequeña empresa, ella desea realizar la compra de lana de vicuña por mayor para producir mayor cantidad y comprar otro telar. Esta es la 1 secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 2 años que se dedica a esta actividad.
Es por esos motivos que Rosa solicita un préstamo para la compra de lana de vicuña por mayor para confeccionar mantas y con los beneficios comprar otro telar.
texts.en:
Rosa is a woman of 53. She lives with her partner and has a 23-year-old son. Her business is making blankets with vicuña wool. 

She is a good mother, sincere, patient, friendly, responsible, and very hard-working. Her business is located in the Nueva Tilata zone, a central area that is characterized by connections to various zones through bypasses and crossroads. It has a cold, dry climate with a temperature that varies during the day between 0 and 12 degrees centigrade.

Rosa has a dark complexion, brown eyes, long black hair that she braids, short stature, and a thin build. Her form of dress is traditional (hat, blanket, and skirt). Her mother tongue is Aymará, which she speaks in her area, and she speaks Spanish because of general culture and for the business that she does. She shares her life with her husband, who works, and with her son, who goes to school and works. They live in their own house, which is made of blocks and cement, with a tile roof and a wood floor. It has potable water, electrical energy, and gas and sewer services. 

Her business is making blankets from vicuña wool. Her work requires traveling long distances in the altiplano in search of producers of vicuña wool, which she cleans in order to then spin. Once she has sufficient wool, she is ready to weave it on a loom. The business is genuinely artesanal, and every blanket takes an average of 2 to 3 weeks to finish. "I began my business because of the invitation of a close friend who worked in this before and because I knew the area wool producers," she comments. 

The good thing about her business is that the blankets of this quality have great demand. The problem is the lack of capital to buy vicuña wool wholesale. 

Her dream is to create a little business. She wants to make the purchase of vicuña wool wholesale in order to produce a greater quantity and to buy another loom. This is her first sequence of loans with the institution in the two years that she has had this business.

It is for these reasons that Rosa is applying for a loan for the purchase of vicuña wool wholesale to make blankets and buy another loom with the earnings.

loans.use: to buy vicuña wool wholesale to make blankets and with the earnings to buy another loom

loans.name: Ma. Merced

texts.en:
As a widowed mother of six children, Ma. Merced works hard to support her family.

She has a tricycle passenger business in the Philippines and also earns additional income from fish vending. Ma. Merced is borrowing 20,000 PHP through NWTF in order to buy wheels and spare parts for her tricycle passenger.

Ma. Merced has been sustaining her business activities through her past 10 loans from NWTF and more recently through Kiva. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy wheels and spare parts for her passenger tricycle.

loans.name: Asha

texts.en:
Asha is married and has three children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has electricity but no piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

For the past three years Asha has owned a food stall where she sells to her neighbors and town dwellers. Her main business challenge lies in the fluctuation of her customer base, which results in perishable food that spoils and must be discarded.

Asha has applied for a 20,000 KES loan through Kiva's field partner Yehu to buy ingredients for the food she makes such as sugar, rice, maize and wheat flours, and cooking oil. She dreams of expanding her business into a modern café.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for the food she makes to sell

loans.name: Hadija

texts.en:
Hadija is a single mother of two children, both of whom attend school. She lives in her own house that neither has electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food.

For the past three years Hadija has sold used clothing from door to door to her neighbors and passersby. Transportation is a major cost for her in this business.

Hadija decided to join Yehu to gain access to their business loans. She is applying for a 25,000 KES loan through Kiva's field partner Yehu to buy more bales of clothes to sell. She dreams of owning a boutique someday.

loans.use: to buy more bales of clothes to sell.

loans.name: Nyevu

texts.en:
Nyevu is a married woman who has no children. She lives in her own house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Nyevu mentioned that seasonality is a challenge in her business.

Nyevu is taking out a Kiva loan of Kshs 10,000 to invest in her farming business by purchasing seeds and fertilizers. She decided to join Yehu to access loans and boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase seeds and fertilizers for her farming business

loans.name: Claudio

texts.es:
Claudio continúa con su negocio de comercio de ganado vacuno. El préstamo anterior lo invirtió en la compra de ganado para engorde. El pago de sus cuotas fue puntual porque no tuvo problemas. Su actividad consiste en la compra de terneros para su cuidado y engorde, después de engordarlos y una vez crecidos, los oferta a mejor precio en las ferias de comunidades vecinas, “el cuidado de ganado es una actividad complaciente, más allá de ser una mercadería los animales tiene personalidad…” comenta. La ventaja de su negocio es que cuenta con clientes en lista de espera, la desventaja es la falta de capital para la compra de terneros vacunos para su engorde y comercio. Su sueño es mejorar su establo para que su ganado crezca mejor, él desea realizar la compra de terneros mejorados para su engorde para comercializarlos en verano. Esta es la 2 secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 10 años que se dedica a esta actividad.
Es por esos motivos que Claudio solicita un préstamo para compra de terneros mejorados para engordarlos y comercializarlos en verano.
texts.en: Claudio continues with his business selling cattle. He invested his previous loan in buying cattle for fattening. His loan payments were made on time because he didn't have any problems. His business consists of buying calves to care for and fatten. After he fattens them, and once they are grown, he offers them at the best price at fairs in neighboring communities. "The care of cattle is a pleasant business, in addition to being a business the animals have personality," he says. The advantage of his business is that he has a waiting list of customers, the disadvantage is that he is lacking capital to buy calves to fatten and sell. His dream is to improve his barn so that his cattle will grow better. He wants to buy calves to fatten and to sell over the summer. This is his second loan with this institution in the ten years that he has been in this business. For these reasons Claudio is requesting a loan to buy calves to fatten and sell in the summer.

loans.use: to buy calves to fatten.

loans.name: Walter

texts.en:
Walter is a married man and has five children. He describes himself as dedicated. Walter has been operating a motorcycle transport business for the past two years where he transports customers using his motorcycle. His business is located in a busy area and his primary customers are locals. Walter describes his biggest business challenge as insufficient funds. 

This is Walter's third loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. His previous loans have been successfully repaid. He will use the KES 50,000 loan to buy another motorcycle. In the future, he hopes that he will live a better life.

loans.use: to buy another motorcycle for his business

loans.name: Elsie

texts.en:
Elsie is a hard-working entrepreneur with six children, three of whom are in school. She runs a general store in the Philippines and industriously earns additional income through other business ventures such as buying and selling rice and dry goods.

Elsie has successfully repaid her previous loan, and  has now requested an additional loan to further build her business. She has requested a PHP 50,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stocks of household goods to sell.

Elsie dreams that one day she will be able to build and expand her business to secure her family's future.

loans.use: to purchase more stocks of household goods to sell

loans.name: Luzviminda

texts.en:
As a widowed parent of eight children, Luzviminda works hard to support her family.

Luzviminda has a tailoring business in the Philippines and she earns additional income from raising pigs. She is borrowing 12,000 PHP through NWTF to purchase additional supplies like cloth, thread, etc. for making dresses to sell through her tailoring business.

Luzviminda has been sustaining her business activities through her past 3 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional supplies like cloth, thread, etc. for making dresses to sell

loans.name: Tamer

texts.en:
Tamer is a 30-year-old university student, majoring in nursing, who is in his second year of studies. He is very ambitious and has always dreamed about completing his education and studying what he wants. Tamer is from a poor family and they could not afford to pay his university fees for him. Day after day, Tamer's dream grew bigger and he became more persistent. Therefore, he decided to complete his education whatever it cost and to achieve his dreams. 

Tamer is now applying for this education loan to pay his upcoming semester fees. Due to his family's financial problems, he doesn’t have enough money to pay his fees. After graduating, Tamer will seek work in his study field so he can support himself and help his father to improve his family's standard of living. With this loan, he is one step close to that.

loans.use: to pay his semester fees for his second-year nursing studies

loans.name: Candelaria De Dolores

texts.es:
Candelaria, con la ayuda del crédito anterior ha logrado que la tienda de productos varios y la carpintería mantengan su continuidad y además está atendiendo mayor cantidad de clientes, junto a su familia disfruta de mejores comodidades y ha ido cancelando su deuda.
Para ser responsable con las nuevas de mandas de sus productos ha decidido solicitar un nuevo crédito para comprar madera, clavos, barniz, entre otros materiales necesarios para equipar mejor la carpintería.
texts.en: With the help of a previous loan, Candelaria has been able to keep her shop where she sells various products and her carpentry shop going. She is also serving more customers. Together with her family she enjoys better amenities and has been paying off her debt. She has decided to request a new loan in order to be responsible with the new demands for her products. She is requesting a loan to buy wood, nails, varnish and other materials to better equip her carpentry shop.

loans.use: to buy wood, nail, varnish and other materials.

loans.name: Stevie

texts.en:
Life has been a mystery to Stevie. Growing up from a poor family and struggling to get a good education, Stevie never imagined he would get to where he is today. He has been working for years trying to make ends meet but to no avail. Even with his friends making fun of him, he persevered. With much excitement, Stevie says “I am starting my own business as a Zoona agent and I will use this opportunity to make something of myself".

Stevie is 21 years old. He is one of three children and lives in Mchinji where he is going to set up his own business as a Zoona mobile money transfer agent. This means that Stevie will provide mobile money and bill payment services for people in his community, thus earning profits from the transactions. He is very happy and excited to be able to start running his own business and needs a loan from Kiva to make this happen. 

With this loan, Stevie will be able to purchase the equipment he needs to start running his own business. He will purchase a trading trolley from which he will conduct his business. He will place the trolley at one of the busy farmers' shops in Mchinji. Stevie will also purchase a web-enabled mobile phone which he will use to make the transactions. He will also use the loan funds to purchase a cash box so he can serve people who need to access financial services.

Stevie says his community will benefit from his business by being able to send and receive money any time they need to. This will save community members time and money. He dreams of being the top Zoona agent in Malawi in 2020 and of employing other people like himself who also do not have the financial means to start a business. He thanks Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to buy a trading trolley, web-enabled mobile phone and cash box to start his own business, providing Zoona financial services to local people

loans.name: Rahaby

texts.en:
Rahaby and her three siblings were raised by a single mother. As a farmer, her mother was not able to provide Rahaby and her siblings with basic necessities and they would often rely on other people in the community to survive. Rahaby, now 21, says she is grateful to her mother and the people in the community for seeing her through secondary school. Today, she hopes to make them proud by starting her own Zoona mobile money transfer business.

Rahaby is setting up her business in Dedza and she will provide mobile money transfer services. People in the community will be able to go to her place of business to send and receive money. Rahaby is hopeful that once the business grows, she will open more outlets and create employment in her community. She is very optimistic and states that most people will be able to make money transactions. She sees the opportunity to run her own business as a way to end poverty in her family and give back to her community.

With this loan from Kiva, Rahaby will be able to buy a trading trolley, a mobile phone, and the necessary electronics to start running her business and help people send and receive money.

loans.use: to start running her own business by buying a trading trolley, a mobile phone and provide her with the electronic and cash needed for her to help people send and receive money.

loans.name: Juliet

texts.en:
Juliet is the 9th born of 10 children and lives in Lilongwe with her parents. She is 22 years old and is determined to successfully run her own business to help to alleviate poverty in the family.

Juliet has a secondary school certificate. Due to a lack of funds, she has not been able to pursue her dream of going to college to earn a degree in Business Management. Today, she is requesting a loan in order to start her own business. Juliet's business will deal in the sending and receiving of money. Juliet sees this as her breakthrough. With this loan, Juliet will be able to purchase a trading trolley, a web-enabled phone and have the funds needed to serve people who need to access financial services.

Juliet says she will use the profits from her business to buy basic necessities such as soap, sugar, and maize meal for her family. She thanks the Kiva lenders for their support.

loans.use: to purchase a trading trolley, a web-enabled phone and have the funds needed to serve people who need to access financial services

loans.name: Tapiwa

texts.en:
Tapiwa is 23 years old. She is single and lives with her mother, stepfather, and her 3 siblings. She has just completed training with Zoona to finally make her dream of running her own business come true. Tapiwa needs a loan to make her dream a reality.

When Tapiwa finished secondary school, she took a short course in Financial Accounting. Tapiwa describes herself as a hard worker who has been through a lot of ups and downs in her life. She says this makes her very strong and focused in whatever she applies herself to. 

Tapiwa will use this loan to start a mobile money transfer business.  She will purchase a trading trolley to serve her customers. She will also use the money to buy a mobile phone which she will use to facilitate transactions. Tapiwa believes that running her own business will give her the opportunity to take care of her family's basic needs. This prospect excites her and she cannot wait to begin operating her own Zoona mobile money outlet.

loans.use: to start a mobile money transfer business by purchasing a trading trolley and a web-enabled phone to facilitate the transactions

loans.name: Yury Estefania

texts.es:
Ella es Yury, es una joven de 25 años de edad que se dedica a vender productos de la canasta familiar, en un negocio que ha ido formando paso a paso. Ella es una persona carismática, responsable, protectora, madre de un pequeño de 4 años y con una ambición en su vida, la cual es pagar la educación de su muchacho y mejorar las condiciones de su vivienda.
Inicio su negocio a principios del año 2014, por necesidad económica y por gusto al trabajo independiente, la principal ventaja de tener un negocio ubicado en su hogar es la facilidad de atender a su hijo cuando lo requiere.
Yury con su negocio siempre ha buscado el progreso, no se conforma con solo generar lo suficiente para subsistir, ya que cuenta con amigos como Interactuar que no solo le prestan dinero, sino, que la asesoran y la acompañan para que crezca, es pro está razón que Yury quiere solicitar un préstamo para la compra de surtido de productos de la canasta familiar en general.
Con el préstamo espera mejorar sus ventas, aumentar sus clientes, incrementar su utilidad.
Se compromete a pagar su préstamo ya que es una manera de demostrar gratitud ante la confianza que puedan depositar en ella prestándole un pequeño monto de dinero.
texts.en:
This is Yury. She is a young 25 year old who makes a living selling basic family needs products, in a business that has been built up step-by-step. She is a charismatic, responsible, protective person and mother of a 4 year old child. She has a life ambition to pay the education of her son and to improve the conditions of her home. 

She began the business at the start of 2014, because of economic need and for the pleasure of self-employment. The main advantage of having a business located in her home is the ease of taking care of her son when he needs it. Yury has always looked for progress with her business, and she does not conform to only making enough to survive. She counts on friends like Interactuar that not only lend her money, but they also advise and accompany her so that she can grow. 

For this reason, Yury wants to ask for a loan to buy a supply of basic family needs products. With the loan, she hopes to improve her sales, increase her customers, and increase her utility. She promises to pay back the loan because it is a way of showing gratitude towards the confidence that they can have in her by loaning her a small amount of money.

loans.use: to buy a supply of basic family needs products.

loans.name: Rosa Ymelda

texts.es: Doña Rosa de 59 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposo, ella se dedica a la elaboración y venta de tortillas desde hace más de 20 años su negocio está ubicado en su lugar, tiene muchos clientes especialmente sus vecinos, ella está solicitando un crédito para la compra de maíz por quintales y cal para poder continuar con sus ventas y así tener mejores ingresos económicos.
texts.en:
Rosa is 59 years old and lives in her own home with her husband. She has made a living making and selling tortillas for more than 20 years. Her business is located in her home. She has many customers, especially her neighbors. 

She is asking for a loan to buy pounds of corn and lime to be able to continue with her sales and have better earnings.
