loans.use: to buy pounds of corn and lime.

loans.name: Miladis Maria

texts.es:
Miladis es una inteligente mujer de 47 años de edad, ella es residente de la zona de chigorodo y encontró en los amplios espacios de su hogar una manera de generar ingresos.
Miladis tomó el sitio, hizo divisiones y lo convirtió en un hotel, es un hogar de paso, no es nada de lujo, pero tiene los elementos esencial para disfrutar de una buena noche como lo son cama, ventilador, baño y una cocina.
Este negocio se ha convertido en el pilar económico de su familia, la cual al conforman su esposo y sus tres hijos, todos son muy colaborativos y apoyan en el negocio familiar.
Miladis sabe que al comodidad del cliente es su prioridad, es por ello, que desea realizar un gran esfuerzo y solicitara un préstamo el cual invertirá en la compra de ventiladores para tener todas las habitaciones dotadas, compra de televisores y compra de enseres para la cocina.
texts.en:
Miladis is an intelligent 47 year old woman She lives in the area of Chigorodo and found a way to make money in the large spaces in her home. Miladis took the place, make divisions and converted it into a hotel. It is a temporary home, nothing luxurious, but it has the necessary elements to enjoy a good night such as a bed, fan, bathroom and kitchen. This business has become the economic pillar of her family, which includes her husband and three children. They are all very collaborative and support the family business. 

Miladis knows that her customer's comfort is her priority. For this reason, she wants to make a big effort and ask for a loan to invest into buying fans for all of the guest rooms, buying televisions and buying kitchen goods.

loans.use: to buy fans to have in all of the guest rooms, to buy televisions and to buy kitchen goods.

loans.name: Juana

texts.es:
Juana, es la persona responsable de abastecer a sus seres querido de todo lo necesario para su subsistencia, vive con sus hijos y nietos, su esposo y una de sus hijas viven en el extranjero; su negocio es la crianza de cerdos y el cultivo de granos básicos, ella lleva las riendas de su hogar, tanto sus hijos como nietos colaboran en las actividades agrícolas.
Invertirá en los insumos agrícolas necesarios para sembrar maíz y frijol  en dos manzanas de terreno en la próxima siembra, la esperanza de Juana es que el clima sea más favorable para lograr cosechas más abundantes con las que tendrá alimento para su familia y más granos para vender.
Las aspiraciones que ella tiene son continuar trabajando, mejorar la economía familiar y tener un estilo de vida más confortable.
texts.en:
Juana is the person responsible for supplying her loved ones with all they need to survive. She lives with her children and grandchildren. Her husband and one of her daughters live overseas. Her business is raising pigs and growing basic grains. She carries the reins of the family and her children, as much as her grandchildren, collaborate in the agricultural jobs. 

She will invest in the necessary agricultural supplies to plant corn and beans in two blocks of land in the next sowing. Juana's hope is that the weather is more favorable to achieve more abundant harvests, with which she will have food for her family and more grains to sell. Her hopes are to continue working, to improve the family income and to have a more comfortable lifestyle.

loans.use: to invest in the necessary agricultural supplies to plant corn and beans in two blocks of land in the next sowing.

loans.name: Amada Victoria

texts.es:
Amada, está satisfecha por la experiencia que ha tenido con el uso de créditos, lo cual es una motivación para solicitar un nuevo financiamiento para comprar cosméticos, lociones, etc.,  así como también plátanos, aceite y gas propano para elaborar la venta de tostadas de plátano.
Con el crédito anterior logro mejorar el negocio y recuperar la inversión con mejores ingresos, su familia tiene un nivel de vida diferente y se encuentran saludables.
texts.en: Amada is satisfied by the experience that she has had using the loans. That is one motivation for asking for a new loan to buy cosmetics, lotions, etc., as well as bananas, oil and propane gas to sell banana toast. With the previous loan, she was able to improve the business and recuperate the investment with better earnings. Her family has a different standard of living and they are healthy.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics, lotions, etc., as well as bananas, oil, and propane gas to sell banana toast.

loans.name: Mphatso

texts.en:
Mphatso is from Lilongwe. She is 24 years old and lives with her parents. Mphatso is relocating to Mchinji, a border town located 109.9 km away from her hometown of Lilongwe, to start her own Zoona Mobile money transfer business. The prospect of running her own business is exciting to Mphatso.

Mphatso graduated from high school in 2013 and took a short accounting course. Her biggest challenge is that she does not currently have an income and is financially dependent on her struggling parents. Mphatso wants to be a productive member of the family and help alleviate the family poverty. She is happy at the prospect of starting her own Zoona business and believes it will give her the independence she has always dreamed of. Mphatso hopes that once her her business grows, she will contribute positively to the job market by helping to create employment. Mphatso believes that one day she will be as successful as her aunt, who has a PhD and has been a source of motivation. 

This loan will help Mphatso start running her own business by providing the working capital needed to serve her customers. She will use the money to purchase a trolley where she will serve her customers, a web-enabled mobile phone, and a cashbox to keep her money safe. She thanks the Kiva lenders for supporting her to get her business started.

loans.use: to start her own business by providing the working capital needed to serve her customers and purchase a trolley, a web-enabled mobile phone, and a cashbox

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en:
Joyce is a student studying towards a degree in Business Administration. She lives in Mchinji with her brother and his family. She has been living with her brother since their parents died when she was 6 years old. Although her brother has been doing his best to support her, life has been difficult as he has a family of his own. Joyce is motivated to start  her own business so that she can support herself. Joyce is requesting  a Kiva loan to start  her own business, providing financial services to people in her town of Mchinji.

Joyce will use the loan to purchase a trolley, a web-enabled phone to make transactions, and a cashbox. 

Joyce thanks the Kiva lenders for their support. Her Zoona business will give her the opportunity to support herself financially and provide a financial service to her community.

loans.use: to purchase a trolley, a web enabled phone and a cashbox.

loans.name: Hezbon

texts.en:
Hezbon is a single man who describes himself as ambitious. He has operated a barber shop for 2 years. His business is located in a busy area and his primary customers are local people. 

He is challenged by insufficient funds and requests 50,000 KES to buy barber shop items to enable him expand business. 

He hopes to increase his profits. This is his second loan with SMEP Microfinance bank. His previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy barber shop items.

loans.name: Euster

texts.en:
Euster is a housewife with two children. Euster lives with her husband in Lilongwe, Malawi where she has successfully completed training to start her own business as a Zoona Mobile Money transfer agent. She is requesting a loan from Kiva  to start  her business as a mobile money transfer agent.

Growing up wasn't easy for Euster as life became difficult after her mother passed away when she was 9 years old. Her father could not afford to pay for her education. She had five siblings and her father could not take them all to school. She learned how to read and write as an adult. She then studied Theology and learned the importance of helping others in need. 

Euster sees the opportunity to own a Zoona business as a way to provide her community with a much needed service to send and receive money in a safe and reliable way. She says that the business will empower her to take care of her children and ensure that they get a good education. She would like to build a house for her children and give them a better life.

She will use the loan to start her own business to provide mobile money transfers to people in her community and purchase a small trolley, a cell phone, and a cashbox. 

 Euster thanks the Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to start  her own business to provide mobile money transfers to people in her community.

loans.name: David

texts.en:
David is a 29-year-old man who is passionate about educating his children.   He dropped out of school when he was in grade 9. 

David will start his own business and use the profits to send his two children to better schools and move to a bigger house. 

David requests his first Kiva loan  to start  a Zoona mobile money transfer business in Petauke, Zambia. David runs a grocery store and sees the opportunity to grow his business by adding mobile money transfers. 

He is very excited as this service will bring in additional revenue; he needs a loan to purchase a trading kiosk to place outside of his small grocery shop.

He thanks the Kiva lenders for this opportunity.

loans.use: to purchase a trading kiosk.

loans.name: Sara Noemi

texts.es:
Sara, estudio hasta noveno grado, está casada, vive con su esposo y su madre, su esposo trabaja como vigilante y la madre le ayuda en el negocio que posee.

Sara, tiene un puesto de venta de frutas y verduras desde hace poco más de un año, fue la madre quien le enseño este labor fue de esa manera que decidió seguir los pasos de su madre y poner su propio negocio el puesto lo tiene en el mercado de la ciudad a 2 kilómetros de su casa, viaja todos los días desde las 7:00 a.m. hasta las 4:00 p.m.
	
Sara, necesita el préstamo para comprar más frutas y verduras, para su negocio, ella comprara las frutas y verduras en otro departamento para comprarla más barata y por mayor cantidad.

Sara, sueña con colocar otro negocio para que lo administre su madre y también muy pronto ser madre.
texts.en:
Sara has a ninth-grade education. She is married and lives with her husband and mother. Sara's husband is a security guard while her mother helps with Sara's business.

Sara has a stall where she has been selling fruits and vegetables for a little more than a year. Sara learned this trade from her mother and decided to follow in her footsteps by opening her own business. The stall is at the city market, two kilometres from her house. She travels every day to work from 7am to 4pm.

Sara needs this loan in order to buy more fruits and vegetables for her business. She will buy the products in another department so that they are cheaper and in bulk.

Sara dreams of opening another business for her mother to manage. She would also like to be a mother very soon.

loans.use: to buy more fruits and vegetables for her business.

loans.name: Sharon

texts.en:
Sharon is a 32-year-old entrepreneur who is divorced and has two young children. Her eldest is a boy doing his grade three and her youngest is a girl in pre-school. She describes herself as hardworking and friendly. 

She previously worked at an agro firm as an accountant for seven years. That job ended and she used her savings to open a shop to stock cooler boxes and other hardware supplies. She has  run this business for two years and says the biggest challenge  is lack of capital and she struggles to grow her business. Sharon is very excited to have the opportunity to diversify and add mobile money transfers to her business. She is hopeful that this will help her to earn more profit and provide her community with an easier and faster way for them to move their monies.

The loan will also assist her to but a trading kiosk to serve her customers who need access to financial services.
Sharon's dream is to continue growing her business so that one day she can own a piece of land and build a house for her two children.

loans.use: to purchase a Zoona branded trading kiosk.

loans.name: Wanna

texts.en:
Wanna is a 27-year-old single mother living with her parents in Chipata, Zambia. Her parents are subsistence farmers. Wanna describes herself as someone who genuinely works hard and has respect for her community.

Wanna completed her secondary school education in 2007. She wanted to start  her own business but could not obtain working capital. She applied for a loan but was declined as she did not own any property and the banks required her to have some collateral. Wanna has since been helping her parents at the farm. She explains that it has not been easy to meet her basic needs and those of her son.  Wanna is hopeful that with this loan, she will be able to start her own business as a Zoona mobile money transfer agent in her community.

Wanna has successfully completed training with Zoona to start  her own business. She has been trained how to run the business, manage her finances, and  take care of her customers; she is ready to start operating. Wanna needs a Kiva loan  to pay for her start up costs. Once she receives this loan, she will be able to purchase a double window trading kiosk and a web-enabled phone. The kiosk will be delivered to her location.

Wanna's appeal to the Kiva lenders is that they support her to start  her own business so that she can be in a position to help her parents financially and send her child to school.

loans.use: to purchase a Zoona branded kiosk and  a phone.

loans.name: Gift

texts.en:
Gift is a 38-year-old maarried man with three children ages 9, 6 and 3.  Gift also helps supports his 6 siblings.

Gift completed college and worked as a police officer.He left the academy to start his own  Zoona business in order to bring much needed financial services to his community. Before Gift started this business, people in the community had to travel far distances in order to access financial institutions. Gift  enjoys interacting and sharing ideas with his customers and wants to provide them with the best possible service.

Gift is requesting a loanto buy the kiosk that he is currently using to serve customers. This loan will also help Gift to increase the working capital of his Zoona businessto meet the demand for his services, and would mean he wouldn’t have to turn away customers. This loan would allow Gift to grow his business, which would in turn allow his to increase his income to provide for his family.

loans.use: to pay for a trading kiosk.

loans.name: Ahmad

texts.en:
Ahmad is a 30-year-old single man from the city of Jabalia, which is located in the Gaza Strip.  The city has power outages 12-16 hours a day. He lives with his family in a small house, is employed in the public sector,and  earns a low income.which barely covers the family's needs. 

Ahmad took a USD loan from FATEN to buy a solar system to heat water for the family's house.  Palestinians use water boilers that use either gas or gasoline to heat the water which can be dangerous, expensive, and inefficient.  This will help him to provide hot water without using electricity, which is much more expensive.

loans.use: tobuy a solar system.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is a married woman with 1 child. She describes herself as focused. She has operated a M-pesa business  for 2 years. 

She will use t80,000 KES to add M-pesa float. She hopes to open a supermarket in the future. This is her third loan with SMEP Microfinance bank. Her previous loan was successfully repaid.

loans.use: to support her business.

loans.name: Yesenia Yaneth

texts.es:
Yesenia, continua distribuyendo huevos para tener una fuente de ingresos y subsistir con su familia, negocio que continua funcionando gracias a los créditos que Padecomsm con la ayuda de Kiva le han otorgado, su familia se mantiene igual.
Con el nuevo préstamo tiene programado comprar mayor cantidad de huevos a un precio justo para luego revenderlos y tener ganancias con las que cumplirá con el pago de la nueva deuda y disminuirá las carencias de su hogar.
texts.en:
Yesenia continues to sell eggs in order to have a source of income and support her family. The business continues to run thanks to loans from Padecomsm and the help of Kiva; Yesenia's family is supported this same way.

Yesenia plans to use this loan to buy more eggs at a fair price to re-sell and earn a profit. Yesenia will use profits to repay her debt and buy items that are lacking in her household.

loans.use: to buy more eggs at a fair price to re-sell.

loans.name: Yeni

texts.en:
A loan of IDR 10,000,000  helps Yeni to introduce simple, life-saving technologies such as solar lamps, water filters, and clean cookstoves to the community.
 
Yeni was born and raised in the village called Soe in West Timor, Indonesia where the majority of people are farmers. Yeni and her husband,  an evangelist, visit remote villages in Soe on a weekly basis. During their visit to the villages without electricity, Yeni demonstrates a solar lamp to help people stop using dangerous and toxic kerosene lamps.
 
To increase her income, Yeni joined Kopernik’s Tech Kiosk network to sell simple life-changing technologies. She will use the loan to buy stock  items and grow her business. One of her dreams is to provide better education for her children. The income from selling technologies will help her increase savings for their future education.

loans.use: to introduce solar lamps, water filters, and clean cookstoves.

loans.name: Claudia Yamileth

texts.es:
Claudia utilizo el crédito anterior para tener el inventario del comedor surtido y de esa manera mejorar las ventas e ingresos.
Ha decido solicitar un nuevo crédito con el que comprara jugos, gaseosas, frijoles, arroz, condimentos, verduras entre otros productos para elaborar los diferentes platillos que vende en su comedor, su objetivo es mantenerse trabajando para salir adelante con su familia.
texts.en:
Claudia used the previous loan to increase her inventory and thus improve sales and profits.
She decided to ask for a new loan to buy juice, fizzy drinks, broad beans, rice, spices, and vegetables, among other items.
She will use the ingredients to cook the various dishes she sells at her food stall.
Her goal is to keep working to improve her family's lot in life.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food stall.

loans.name: Aida Alba

texts.es:
La ciudad de Manta es considerada el balneario más importante, popular y visitado del Ecuador, por sus hermosas y acogedoras playas, primer puerto de aguas profundas del Ecuador y sur América.
En este lugar vive la señora Aida, tiene 57 años de edad y  está separada,  tiene 1 hijo de 13 años el mismo que estudian en escuela. Vive en casa de su mamá.
Doña Aida  hace varios años empezó un negocio, ella tiene un pequeño comedor en su casa en el cual prepara deliciosos platos, trabaja sola de lunes a domingos desde las 06h00 hasta las  a las tres de la tarde. Tiene su comedor por 20 años y siempre le ha ido muy bien ya que sus clientes la prefieren por la sazón que le pone a sus platos.
Este crédito lo va utilizar en comprar plátanos, maní, queso,  carne, pescado y otros víveres para la preparación de los alimentos. Está en el Grupo De Crédito desde hace 4 años y le gusta porque los créditos son rápidos. Su sueño es darle una buena educación a su hijo y tener casa propia.
texts.en:
The city of Manta is considered to be the most important, popular and visited spa in Ecuador for its beautiful and friendly beaches, and for its rating as the number one deep-water port in Ecuador and South America.

This is where Aida, 57, lives.  She is divorced and has a 13-year-old son who attends school.  They live with her mother.

Aida started a business several years ago.  She has a small diner at home home where she prepares delicious food.  She works alone Monday through Sunday from 6:00 a.m. to 3:00 p.m.  Her diner has been active for 20 years and it always has gone well because her customers love the taste of her dishes.

This loan will be used to buy bananas, peanuts, cheese, meat, fish and other foods to perpare her meals.  She has been a member of the communal bank for four years and likes the fact that the loans are so quick.  

Her dream is to give her son a good education and to own her own home.

loans.use: To buy bananas, peanuts, cheese, meat, fish and other foods.

loans.name: Martha Isabel

texts.es: Martha es una joven universitaria de 19 años. Actualmente estudia la carrera de Administración de Empresas. Ella decidió estudiar esta carrera porque le gusta  planificar, organizar, dirigir y controlar un sector o a toda una compañía.Ademas de ser una joven muy aplicada en sus ratos libres le gusta jugar voley y ajedrez. Para obtener algún ingreso trabaja como asistente en una oficina. Ella solicito el préstamo para pagar sus pensiones de estudios universitarios. Ya se encuentra a 3 años de terminar su carrera. Se siente muy agradecida con las personas que le puedan ayudar a cumplir sus metas.
texts.en:
Martha, 19, is a young university student.
She is studying Management, a subject she chose because she would like to plan, organise, lead and manage a whole department or a whole company.
She is a very dedicated student who enjoys playing volley-ball and chess in her spare time.
She currently works as a secretary to earn a bit of money.
She asks for a loan to pay for her university fees.
Martha is three years away from graduation and is very grateful to people who help her accomplish her goals.

loans.use: to pay for university fees.

loans.name: Jose Antonio

texts.es: Don Jose de 55 años de edad vive en casa propia con su hija y sus dos nietos, el se dedica al cultivo de maicillo y maíz desde hace 30 años vende sus productos en los alrededores de la zona donde el reside, con lo que obtiene de sus ventas logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, el está solicitando un crédito para la compra de  formula, sulfato, semillas, abonos, etc. y mejorar el terreno que muestra la fotografía para poder continuar con su trabajo y así tener mejores ingresos.
texts.en:
José, 55, lives in a house of his own with his daughter and two grandchildren.
He has been growing maize and millet for thirty years.
He sells his produce in the area where he lives.
With the profits, he pays for part of the household expenses.
He asks for a loan to buy formula, sulphite, seeds, manure, etc.
His goal is to improve the field shown in the photograph, in order to keep on with his work and thus increase his income.

loans.use: to buy farm supplies to improve his land.

loans.name: Margarita Lissette

texts.es:
Margarita, vive en casa de su abuela, es casada y tiene un hijo; tiene una mini ferretería, negocio que aprendió con la ayuda de su madre, al formar su hogar se independizo, actualmente lo atiende sola.
Invertirá en cables, fusibles, desatornilladores, brochas, etc., además piensa comprar bolsos para ofrecer mejores opciones de compra y tener la facilidad  de aumentar sus ventas e ingresos.
Las aspiraciones de Margarita son que su negocio crezca, tener un mejor local y trabajar con capital propio.
texts.en:
Margarita lives at her grandmother's. She is married and has a son.
She owns a small hardware store, a trade she learned from her mother. When she married, she took over the shop.
Margarita will buy cables, fuses, screwdrivers, clamps, etc.
She also intends to buy bags in order to offer better purchasing options to her customers and increase her sales and income.
Margarita dreams of seeing her business grow, improving her locale and having enough working capital on her own.

loans.use: to buy more merchandise to sell.

loans.name: Biail

texts.es:
Biail, utilizo el crédito para comprar materia prima para elaborar la venta de tortillas, los resultados han sido positivos, ya que pudo instalar una pequeña tienda de artículos de primera necesidad, está progresando con el apoyo de créditos que le otorga Padecomsm y Kiva.
Requiere de más capital para comprar maíz, cal, aceite, jabón, detergentes, etc., fortalecerá sus actividades económicas y tendrá oportunidad de seguir atendiendo las demandas de sus clientes.
texts.en:
Biail used the loan to buy ingredients to make tortillas to sell.
Her food stall was so successful that she was able to expand into a small grocery shop.
Biail's business is growing thanks to the loans granted by Padecomsm and Kiva.
She needs more capital to buy maize, lime, cooking oil, soap, detergent, etc.
Thanks to this loan, Biail will strengthen her business and be able to keep meeting customer demand.

loans.use: to buy ingredients and supplies to keep her business growing.

loans.name: Mercedes Nathaly

texts.es:
La ciudad de Manta es considerada el balneario más importante, popular y visitado del Ecuador, por sus hermosas y acogedoras playas, primer puerto de aguas profundas del Ecuador y sur América.
En este lugar vive la señora Mercedes, tiene 30 años de edad, es madre soltera de 1 hijo de 2 años de edad. Ella vive en la casa de su mamá.
Doña Mercedes para salir adelante se dedica a la venta de ropa de todo tipo, su forma de  venta es puerta a puerta y también vende en su  casa donde tiene un pequeño local. Trabaja todos los días desde las 10h00 hasta las 12h00 o más tarde, deja a crédito a sus clientes  y cobra cada quince días. Su mercadería  la va a comprar a  Guayaquil cada quince días o al mes de acuerdo a lo que necesite. Tiene tres años a esta actividad y le va muy bien.
Este crédito lo va emplear en comprar más mercadería como: pantalones, blusas, camisetas y ropa de niños. Está en el Grupo De Crédito  y le gusta porque los créditos son rápidos. Su sueño es tener una casa propia.
texts.en:
The city of Manta is considered to be the most important, popular and visited spa in Ecuador for its beautiful and friendly beaches, and for its rating as the number one deep-water port in Ecuador and South America

This is where Mercedes, 30, lives.  She is single and has a two-year-old son.  She lives with her mother and earns a living selling all kinds of clothing.  She works door-to-door and also sells from home out of a small shop.  She works every day from 10:00 a.m. to 12:00 or later.  Her customers pay on a credit basis every 15 days.

Mercedes buys the merchandise she sells in Guayaquil where she travels every two weeks or once a month, depending on what she needs.  Her business has been running for three years and is going well.

This loan will be used to buy more goods such as pants, blouses, t-shirts and children's clothing.  She is in a communal bank and likes how fast the loans are granted.  

Her dream is to have her own house.

loans.use: To buy pants, blouses, t-shirts and children's clothing.

loans.name: Augusto Rafael

texts.es: Augusto de 48 años es un microempresario residente en el municipio de Soledad en donde funciona su Panadería y Refresquería, él durante muchos años fue empleado en un negocio de este mismo formato donde adquirió toda la experiencia necesaria para iniciar con unos ahorros su sueño de prosperidad.  De la mano de cónyuge, diariamente elaboran deliciosos productos de repostería como ponqués, galletas, pastelería francesa, panes y demás, así mismo comercializan jugos, pony, chichas, cervezas y algunos productos de consumo masivo.  Ha tenido éxito por su esfuerzo y dedicación, así mismo está aplicando a su primer credikiva por intermedio de la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo,  que invertirá en la compra de una amasadora y harina, huevos, queso, mantequilla y demás ingredientes para sus productos.  Con esta inversión responderá a la demanda del mercado y su negocio tendrá un surtido más amplio.  Su meta a futuro es comprar su vivienda.
texts.en:
Augusto, 48, is a small business owner in the town of Soledad where he runs a bakery and refreshment shop.  For several years he worked as an employee for a similar business where he acquired all the experience he needed to start his own activity with his savings.  His goal is to become prosperous.

Augusto and his wife work every day making delicious bakery goods like pancakes, cookies, French pastries, bread and other items.  They also sell juice, malt, chicha (corn-based drink), beer and other products for mass consumption.  He has been successful thanks to his effort and dedication, and is applying for his first CrediKiva loan through the Mario Santo Domingo Foundation.

The loan will be used to buy a dough mixing machine, flour, eggs, cheese, butter and other ingredients for his products.  With this investment he can meet market demand and offer a wider range of products.

His goal is to buy a house.

loans.use: To buy a dough mixing machine, flour, eggs, cheese, butter and other ingredients for his products.

loans.name: Pedro

texts.es:
Pedro es una persona muy amable, él tiene 44 años, viven junto a su hermosa familia en una comunidad de Sololá.
Pedro para generar sus ingresos económicos, se dedica a la agricultura el siembra papa, esta actividad lo realiza en la misma comunidad donde vive, Pedro por ser una persona responsable ha logrado prosperidad en la vida. Para Pedro la agricultura es buena ya que genera ganancias, pero esto no es suficiente para volver a sembrar, es por eso que él está buscando un préstamo de mil quinientos que lo estaría invirtiendo en la compra de insumos agrícolas para su próximo cultivo.
Los sueños de Pedro es generar más ingresos cada día para poder remodelar su casa y mejorar las condiciones de vida de su familia.
texts.en:
Pedro is a very friendly person. He is 44 years old and lives with his lovely family in a municipality in Sololá.

He is a farmer who makes his living from potato growing. He does this in the municipality where he lives. Because he is a responsible person, Pedro has achieved prosperity in life. For Pedro farming is good as it generates profit, although not enough to be able to sow more crops. This is why he is seeking a loan of $200 that he will invest in the purchase of agricultural consumables for his next crop.

Pedro's dream is to generate more income on a daily basis to be able to redesign his house and improve his family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy agricultural consumables for farming purposes.

loans.name: Diana Lucia

texts.es:
Diana es una joven trabajadora es soltera, tiene 22 años, tiene dos hijos, vive en casa familiar con sus padres y sus hermanos, Su primera hija tiene 6 años y estudia en una escuela fiscal, y su segundo hijo tiene 4 años el todavía aun no estudia. En su hogar hay buen ambiente familiar, se lleva muy bien con sus padres y sus hermanos, y sus padres le apoyan en el cuidado de sus hijos mientras ella vende sus productos en su negocio.
Se dedica a la venta de artesanías en madera, ella compra las artesanías en blanco como por ejemplo frutas, portarretratos, animales, velas, floreros, y otros, a los que los pinta y les da los acabados para después ponerlos a la venta. Se dedica a esta labor desde hace 4 años y tiene mucha experiencia en el negocio, en ocasiones ella hace los acabados a las artesanías, pero cuando ella no puede hacerlo le pide ayuda a su hermano, a quien paga por cada obra que termine.
Vive en San Antonio de Ibarra, en la zona las personas se dedican  a la escultura en madera y al comercio de todo tipo de artículos de madera, y es muy visitado por turistas por los productos que ofrecen, ya que tienen buenos acabados hechos a mano, en especial muebles de hogar.
El crédito lo va invertir en la compra de artesanías en blanco para poder incrementar su capital de trabajo, ella desea tener mejores ingresos y sacar adelante a sus hijos con su negocio. Agradece a fundación alternativa por la ayuda brindada.
texts.en:
Diana, 22, is a single, young working mother who has two children.  She lives with her parents and siblings.  Her eldest daughter is six and attends the fiscal school and her youngest is four and not in school yet.  There is a good family atmosphere at home because she gets along very well with her parents and siblings.  Her parents help care for the children while she sells her products.

Her line of business is wooden crafts which she paints and sells.  She buys unpainted artificial fruit, frames, animals, candles, vases and other items which she finishes herself and sells.  For four years she has been in business and has much experience in the trade.  When she is unable to finish the crafts her brother helps out and she pays him for his work.

Diana lives in San Antonio de Ibarra, an area where people work in wooden sculpture and sell wooden products.  The area receives many tourists because of the good handwork of its products, especially household furniture.

The loan will be used to buy unpainted crafts to increase her work capital.  She wants to earn more income and be able to support her children through her business.  She is grateful to Fundacion Alternativa for the support.

loans.use: To buy raw materials to increase her work capital so she can support her children.

loans.name: Nelly Cecilia

texts.es:
Nelly tiene 42 años es casada, vive una casa arrendando con su esposo Yuri, y sus 2 hijos el primero tiene 16 años y asiste al colegio y su segunda hija que tiene 12 años y asiste a la escuela.
Vive en Atuntaqui desde hace 9 años, en el lugar las personas se dedican a la confección de prendas de vestir, esta ciudad cuenta con un museo ubicado en la primera fábrica de Atuntaqui llamado Museo Fabrica Imbabura, a donde asisten turistas tanto para visitar el museo como también para degustar su gastronomía en la que sobresale la fritada.
Su esposo es inspector general en la unidad educativa Mileniun ubicada en la ciudad de Otavalo. Nelly ayuda a su padre con los acabados de los productos que vende, son productos en madera y los vende en San Antonio de Ibarra. Nelly tiene 16 años de experiencia en realizar acabados, ahora ha visto la necesidad de vender artesanías en madera ya que hay demanda y los turistas que asisten al negocio de su padre preguntan mucho por ese tipo de artículos, es por eso que solicita un crédito a fundación alternativa, para invertirlo en la compra de materia prima como son artesanías en blanco en madera, luego ella hará los acabados para poder ponerlos a la venta, su negocio estará ubicado en San Antonio junto al negocio de su padre.
Nelly agradece a KIVA por el apoyo brindado a que familias enteras salgan adelante emprendiendo sus sueños y creciendo en sus negocios.
texts.en:
Nelly, 42, is married and lives in a rented house with her husband, Yuri, and their two children.  The eldest son is 16 and attends high school and the youngest daughter, 12, attends grade school.

For nine years Nelly has lived in Atuntaqui, a place where people work mainly in dress-making.  The city's museum, Museo Fabrica Imabura, is the most important one in Atuntaqui.  Many tourists visit the museum and also enjoy the local gastronomy which is known for its fried food.

Nelly's husband is a general inspector at the Mileniun educational center in the city of Otavalo.  Nelly helps her father finish the goods he sells which are made of wood and sold in San Antonio de Ibarra.  For 16 years Nelly has been in the business of painting products and now she sees the high demand for painted crafts with all the tourists visiting her father's business and requesting this type of product.  

Therefore she is applying for a loan through Fundacion Alternativa to buy raw materials such as unpainted wooden crafts which she will paint and sell.  Her business is located in San Antonio next to her father's.

Nelly is grateful to KIVA for the support given to entire families trying to realize their dreams and expand their businesses.

loans.use: To buy raw materials and unpainted wooden crafts.

loans.name: Norma Floricenda

texts.es:
Norma es soltera de 25 años de edad, vive en una comunidad denominada Aldea Panimatzalam.
Norma es una joven que trabaja incansablemente, para mantener a su familia, ella para generar sus ingresos se dedica desde hace 10 años a la venta de abarrotes, con la amabilidad en que atiende a la gente y por los años de negocio es una tiendera muy conocida y visitada, Norma quiere sobresalir con la tienda, pero no cuenta con suficiente capital para su inversión, pues la salida más viable es buscar un préstamo para poder equipar su tienda comprando productos como; recitos, gaseosas, aceite, arroz, basándose de la demanda de sus compradores.
Norma sus metas para el futuro es ver su tienda más grande y con las ganancias, comprara un lote de terreno donde construirá su propia casita.
texts.en:
Norma is 25 years old and single. She lives in a community called Aldea Panimatzalam.

Norma is a young woman who works indefatigably to support her family. For ten years, Norma has earned an income by selling groceries. Serving customers in a friendly manner, after years since its opening, Norma is a well-known and much visited shopkeeper.

Norma wants to move forward with her shop but does not have enough money to invest in it. The most viable way forward is to take out a loan to stock up her shop by buying groceries such as snack foods, fizzy drinks, oil and rice. She is buying these products as they are in demand among customers.

Norma's goals for the future include seeing her shop expand and using profits to buy a plot of land where she can build her own little house.

loans.use: to buy groceries such as snack foods, fizzy drinks, oil and rice.

loans.name: Grupo Sector La Cumbre Group

texts.es:
Micaela es una mujer de 39 años de edad, ella vive junto a su familia en una comunidad de Sololá. Micaela tiene cuatro hijos de las edades entre 6 y 17 años.
Micaela (en la fotografía es una que aparece en medio de las tres mujeres) es una mujer que lucha cada día para apoyar a su familia, pues dese hace cinco años se dedica a la elaboración de ropa típica, le gusta hacer esta actividad ya que lo hace desde la comunidad de su hogar, y esto le permite también realizar los oficios de su casa y cuidar  de sus hijos con esta actividad ella contribuye con su esposo en complementar algunos gastos.
Micaela con el afán de seguir elaborando ropa típica, ella solicita un préstamo para invertir en su negocio, con este dinero ella estará comprado hilos de tipo, seda, alemán y lustrina y todo lo relacionado con la línea de tejido, Micaela tiene el sueño de comprar más terreno para que sus hijos cuenten donde construir sus casa.
texts.en:
Micaela is 39 years old and lives with her family in a community of Sololá. Micaela has four children, ages between 17 and 6 years old.

Micaela (in the middle in the photo) works hard every day to support her family. For five years, Micaela has made a living producing typical clothing. She likes this works as she can do it from home and can do her household chores and look after her children. This work allows Micaela to support her husband with some household expenses.

In order to continue producing typical clothes, Micaela is applying for a loan to invest in her business. Micaela use this loan to buy silk threads, German thread, silk cloth, and other items related to knitting.

Micaela's dream is to buy more land so that her children have a space to build their own houses.

loans.use: to buy silk threads, German thread, silk cloth, and other items related to knitting.

loans.name: Miryan Susana

texts.es: Miryan es  una ecuatoriana muy trabajadora y emprendedora, tiene 43 años de edad nación en la ciudad de Latacunga estudio gracias al esfuerzo y sacrificio de sus padres solamente hasta la primaria, tiene 3 hijos y ellos le ayudan económicamente, actualmente vive en San Juan barrio  ubicado en la ciudad de Latacunga, ella es un mujer humilde que toda su vida ha trabajado y ha sido un gran apoyo en su familia . A pesar del clima las personas se dedican a la crianza de animales como es el caso de Miryan  que posee animales como pollos, patos, cerdos, cuyes, entre otros lo que le ayuda en el sustento de su familia. Ella solicita el crédito ya que desea incrementar su negocio implementando pollos, un producto muy competitivo y que genera utilidad dentro del mercado. Miryan agradece a KIVA y Fundación Alternativa por ayudarle a mejorar su estilo de vida y permitirle incrementar su negocio.
texts.en:
Miryan is a very enterprising and hard-working Ecuadorian lady. She is 43 years old and was born in the city of Latacunga. She studied up to primary school thanks to the efforts and sacrifice of her parents. She has three children who help her financially. She currently lives in the district of San Juan in Latacunga. Miryan is a humble woman who has worked hard all her life and been a great support for her family.

In spite of the climate, people make a living raising animals; this is the case with Miryan, who owns chickens, ducks, pigs and guinea pigs, amongst others, which helps her to support her family. She is requesting a loan as she wants to increase the use of chickens in her business, as they are a competitive product that generates revenue in the market. Miryan is grateful to KIVA and Fundación Alternativa for helping her to improve her standard of living and allowing her to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy chicks to expand her business, and with this income improve her standard of living and grow as a microentrepreneur.

loans.name: Rosenda

texts.es:
Rosenda es una mujer que lucha cada día para llevar lo necesario a su familia, vive en una comunidad de Sololá, de 43 años.
Esta señora se dedica a la venta de mostacia, ella tiene experiencia sobre este trabajo, pero el problema que tenía era que no contaba con capital de trabajo, gracias a un préstamo que se le dio en Adicla pudo incrementar su venta, con el poco capital que él contaba, vendía muy poco, pero después del préstamo compro más mercadería de bisutería y elaboraba más mercadería para su venta, pero Rosenda ahora tiene la necesidad de poder remodelar su casa, es la razón por la que solicita un nuevo crédito para poder compra materiales como; cemento, cal, arena y hierro, Rosenda espera mejorar su casa, para que su querida familia tenga un hogar digno.

Otro de los sueños de Rosenda es generar ganancias  con su negocio de bisutería y seguir haciendo mejoras de su casa.
texts.en:
Rosenda is a woman who fights every day to give her family what they need. She lives in a community of Sololá, and is 43 years old.

This woman is earning a living by selling bead jewelry. She has experience in this kind of work, but had the problem of not having any working capital. Thanks to a loan she got from Adicla, she was able to increase her sales. With her small capital she sold very little, but with the loan she purchased more jewelry supplies and manufactured more merchandise to sell.

Now, Rosenda needs to renovate her house. For this reason she is requesting another loan to be able to buy materials such as cement, whitewash, sand and iron. Rosenda hopes to improve her house, so her beloved family has a decent home.

Rosenda's other goals are to generate income with her business of jewelry and continue to improve her house.

loans.use: to buy cement, whitewash, sand, and iron.

loans.name: Santos

texts.es:
Santos vive en una comunidad de Sololá, él tiene 30 años de edad, vive feliz mente con su familia.
Para la generación de ingreso Santos, se dedica al cultivo de una diversidad de verduras,  la experiencia de Santos lo ayuda a cultivar las mejores  verduras de su región, Santos previo al primer préstamo, solo sembraba poco, porque no contaba con suficiente capital de trabajo, ahora su siembra ha incrementado y con ello sus ganancias, para Santos los préstamos son muy buenos ya que solo así uno puede escalar en la vida y cubrir otras necesidades.
Ahora él quiere un nuevo préstamo que lo utilizara, para comprar fertilizantes y semilla de papa para poder cultivar y obtener una buena cosecha al final de la temporada.  El gran sueño de Santos es poder construir una casa de block para que su familia viva mucho mejor.
texts.en:
Santos lives in a community of Solola. He is 30 years old and lives happily with his family.
To generate an income, Santos works farming a variety of vegetables. Santos’ experience allows him to farm the best vegetables in his region. Before the first loan, Santos only farmed a little bit, because he didn’t have enough work capital. Now his yield has increased, and with that his profits. For Santos, the loans are very good, as this is the only way one can get ahead in life and cover other needs. 
Now he wants a new loan which he will use to buy fertilizer and potato seed to be able to farm and obtain a good yield at the end of the season. Santos’ dream is to be able to build a house of blocks so that his family can live much better.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and potato seed.

loans.name: Miguel

texts.es:
Miguel es una persona muy amable, él tiene 50 años, vive junto a su hermosa familia en una comunidad de Sololá.
Miguel para generar sus ingresos económicos, trabaja como jornalero, realizado una serie de actividades del campo con sus vecinos, Miguel por ser una persona responsable ha logrado prosperidad en la vida. Para Miguel trabajar en el campo es bueno, ya que le genera ganancias, sin embargo  esto no es suficiente para poder cultivar en esta temporada, por tal motivo solicita un préstamo que lo invertirá en la compra de fertilizantes para que su cultivo se a la mejor en esta temporada.
Miguel aparte de ser jornalero, él también cuenta con un negocio donde vende una variedad de productos, para Miguel contar con un solo ingreso es muy difícil mantener a la familia, porque para él es muy importante su familia. El sueño de Miguel es comprar suficiente terreno para que sus hijos tengan donde construir.
texts.en:
Miguel is a very pleasant person. He is 50 years old and lives with his lovely family in a community in Sololá.

Miguel works as a labourer in order to generate economic income, carrying out a range of tasks in the fields with his neighbours. Because he is a responsible person, Miguel has found prosperity in life. 

For Miguel, working in the fields is good, as it provides him with income; however, this isn't enough for him to be able to grow his crops this season. For this reason he is applying for a loan which he will invest in the purchase of fertilizers so that his crops are as good as possible this season.

Apart from being a labourer, Miguel also has a business where he sells a variety of products. It is difficult for Miguel to sustain his family, who are very important to him, on only one income. Miguel's dream is to buy enough land for his children to have a place to build on.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers for his crops.

loans.name: Evelyn Lissette

texts.es:
La ciudad de Manta es considerada el balneario más importante, popular y visitado del Ecuador, por sus hermosas y acogedoras playas, primer puerto de aguas profundas del Ecuador y sur América.
En este lugar  vive la señora Evelyn, tiene 20  años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tiene 2 hijos, uno de 4 años que estudia en la  escuela y un bebé de seis meses. Su esposo es pescador Viven en casa de su mamá. 
Doña Evelyn es un ama de casa que para obtener sus propios recursos se dedica a la venta de ropa por catálogo y productos de Yanbal y Avon (productos de belleza, cosméticos, perfumería y accesorios para damas). Trabaja todos los días de la semana de dos a tres horas al día, ella deja sus productos a crédito y cobra cada ocho días, también tiene una vitrina con mercadería en su casa que cuando ella no está el esposo hace la venta. Tiene un año que se dedica a esta actividad y le va muy bien, lo que más vende son los perfumes y cosméticos ya que son muy buenos.
Este crédito es para comprar ropa, desodorantes, cremas, cosméticos y perfumes. Este es el segundo ciclo en el Grupo De Crédito, le gusta el trabajo de la promotora y los pagos son fáciles de hacer. Sus sueños son tener una casa propia.
texts.en:
The city of Manta is considered the most important, most popular and most visited seaside resort of Ecuador because of its beautiful and welcoming beaches and the first deep-sea port of Ecuador and South America.

Evelyn lives in this place. She is 20 years old, married, and has two children from this relationship - one 4-year-old, who is going to school, and a baby of six months. Her husband is a fisherman. They live in her mother's house.

Evelyn is a housewife. To earn her own income she is selling clothes by catalog as well as Yanbal and Avon products (beauty products, cosmetics, perfumes, and lady's accessories). 

She is working for two to three hours everyday. She sells her products on credit and charges once every week. 
She also has a showcase with merchandise in her house because whenever she is not at home, her husband is making the sales.

She has been working like this for a year and it is going well for her. Her best selling products are the perfumes and and cosmetics because they are very good.

This loan is to buy clothes, deodorants, cremes, cosmetics, and perfumes. This is her second loan cycle in the credit group. She likes the work of the promoter and the payments are easy to do. Her goal is to have her own house.

loans.use: to buy clothes, deodorants, cremes, cosmetics, and perfumes.

loans.name: Virgen Del Paso Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado  está en su ciclo número 3 del programa de comité de mujeres integrado por 22 mujeres todos ellas vecinas, amigas de la ciudad de Villarrica.
Una persona que se destaca por su esfuerzo y sacrificio y por ser una persona muy trabajadora y luchadora, ella es la Sra. Juana quien tiene una despensa bien surtida y con la cual tiene los medios para poder ayudar a su familia. Ella comenta que gracias a las capacitaciones que ha recibido pudo mejorar bastante, por eso se siente muy contenta.
Pide este préstamo para poder comprar insumos varios para su despensa, como ser  verduras, carnes, panificados, lácteos y otros, de manera a poder seguir con sus ventas, cumpliendo con sus clientes como lo viene haciendo.
texts.en:
The group called Virgen de Paso is in its 3rd cycle of the women's committee. It is made up of 22 women, all of them neighbors and friends in the city of     Villarrica.

A person who stands out for her work and sacrifice and for being very hardworking and a fighter is Juana. She has a store with which she has the means to help her family. She remarks that thanks to the trainings she has received helped her improve a lot, and she feels very happy. 

She is asking for this loan to buy various items for her store, such as vegetables, meats, bakes goods, dairy products and more. This way, she can continue selling, serving her customers as she has been doing.

loans.use: to buy vegetables, meats, baked goods, dairy items and more.

loans.name: San Antonio Potrerito Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado “San Antonio Potrerito”  es un grupo nuevo que se encuentra en su primer ciclo, están dentro del programa de eliminación de la pobreza, cada una luchando para poder ayudar a sus seres queridos por medio del trabajo unido y a través de la encuesta de eliminación de la pobreza.
La Sra. De La Nieve es otra integrante que se dedica a la venta de hortalizas, y cría de vacas,  quien en su encuesta mostró un nivel de pobreza dentro del nivel uno, es decir en una pobreza extrema. A través del esfuerzo y el trabajo continuo y las aplicaciones de los comportamientos vitales de una mujer exitosa, ella se encuentra mejorando su situación de pobreza.
La Sra. De la Nieve Solicita de este préstamo para la compra de semillas y balanceados, lo que le ayudará  a la misma a obtener una mayor variedad a su  negocio y mas venta el cual le ayudará a mejorar sus ingresos.
texts.en:
The group called “San Antonio Potrerito”  is a new group that is in its first cycle. They are in the poverty elimination program. Each of them is fighting to help their loved ones through working together and through the poverty elimination survey.  

De La Nieve is another member who sells vegetables and raises cows. In the survey, she showed a level of poverty at a level one, which is extreme poverty. Through her efforts and continuous work and the behavior of a successful women, she is improving her poverty situation. De la Nieve  is asking for this loan to buy seeds and balanced feed, which will help her to obtain more variety for her business and improve her income.

loans.use: to buy seeds and balanced feed.

loans.name: Rosalba

texts.es:
Rosalba es estudiante Universitaria de la Carrera agronomía, está cursando el Tercer Año, vive con sus padres,.
Es una persona trabajadora, responsable y muy estudiosa. Su meta es de tener su título Universitario y así poder enseñar a otros jóvenes el conocimiento que ella adquirió estudiando esta carrera. 
Pide este préstamo para poder pagar sus cuotas y seguir con sus estudios de esa forma.
texts.en:
Rosalba is a college student majoring in agronomy. She is in her third year and she lives with her parents. She is a hardworking woman who is responsible and very studious. Her goal is to have her university degree and teach other young people the knowledge she has acquired in this major. 

She is asking for this loan to be able to pay for her tuition and conintue with her education.

loans.use: to pay for college tuition.

loans.name: Mujeres Unidas Group

texts.es:
El comité se denomina MUJERES UNIDAS, es un grupo que se formó en la ciudad de Santaní, integrada por 16 señoras, todas trabajadoras independientes, se encuentran muy entusiasmadas por ser parte del programa de Comité de Mujeres emprendedoras.
La Sra. Silvina es integrante de este comité, se la distingue por su gran espíritu emprendedor. Ella se desempeña como empleada doméstica en horas de la mañana, y por las tardes prepara y vende comidas en su casa. Es una mujer muy trabajadora y luchadora, que se esfuerza por poder salir adelante.
Pide este préstamo para poder comprar insumos para poder hacer comidas, como ser verduras, carne, condimentos, hortalizas, panificados y otros, y de esa forma poder seguir con sus ventas, luchando por poder mejorar cada día.
texts.en:
The committee called Mujeres Unidas [engl.: United Women] is a group founded in the city of Santaní. It consists of 16 women, all self-employed workers. They are very excited to be part of the Women's Committee program.

Silvina is a member of this committee. She stands out because of her great entrepreneurial spirit. In the mornings, she is working as a housemaid and in the afternoon she prepares and sells food from her house. She is a very hard-working woman, who makes an effort to improve her financial situation.

She is requesting this loan to be able to buy ingredients for preparing the food, such as vegetables, meat, spices, pastries, and so on. This way she is able to continue so sell and work hard to improve every day.

loans.use: to buy vegetables, meat, spices, pastries and so on.

loans.name: Kuña Guapa Group

texts.es:
El grupo “Kuña Guapa”   está dentro del programa de eliminación de la pobreza, cada una está luchando para poder mejorar sus condiciones de vida y la de sus seres queridos.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Maria quien tiene venta de ropas usadas y comenta que hoy día las prendas usadas cada vez más está en crecimiento. Ella es una mujer muy trabajadora que lucha por poder salir adelante, y por medio de su trabajo dar a sus seres queridos todo lo que ella no pudo tener.
Pide este préstamo para poder comprar prendas de segunda mano para la venta, como ser remeras, camisas, jeans, pantalones y otros, y de esa forma poder seguir luchando por salir adelante.
texts.en:
The “Kuña Guapa” group is in the poverty elimination program. Each of them is fighting to be abel to improve her and her lived ones' living conditions    

One of the members is Maria, who sells used clothing and says that today the used clothing business is growing more and more. She is a very hardworking woman who fights to get ahead and through her work give her loved ones everything that she wasn't able to have.

She is asking for this loan to buy second hand clothing to sell, such as t-shirts, shirts, jeans, pants and more. This way, she can keep fighting to get ahead.

loans.use: to buy second hand clothing to sell, such as t-shirts, shirts, jeans, pants and more.

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es:
Rosa es de la ciudad de Pilar, vive con sus padres, ellos son comerciantes, y Rosa comenta que ya se recibido como profesora de danza,.
Quiere seguir con sus estudios profesionales, es por eso que está siguiendo la carrera de contabilidad para poder crecer como profesional.
Ella pide este préstamo para poder pagar las cuotas de su carrera, y de esa forma poder seguir con sus estudios como lo viene haciendo. Agradece por esta oportunidad que recibe de crecer.
texts.en:
Rosa is from the city of Pilar. She lives with her parents, who are merchants. Rosa says that she has already been accepted as a dance teacher.  

She wants to continue studying her profession. That is why she is studying accounting so she can grow as a professional. She is asking for this loan to be bale to pay for college tuition. This is the way she can continue with her education as she has been doing. She is grateful for this opportunity she is receiving to grow.

loans.use: to pay for college tuition.

loans.name: Aldo

texts.es:
Aldo es de la ciudad de Concepción, es una persona con muchas metas y objetivos, que para poder cumplirlos está estudiando la carrera analista de sistemas.
Aldo quiere abrirse camino al mundo laboral y por eso esta estudiando para salir adelante.
Pide este préstamo para poder pagar las cuotas de su carrera, y de esa forma poder seguir con sus estudios.
texts.en:
Aldo is from the city of Concepción. He is a person with many goal and objectives. To achieve them, he is studying to become a Systems Analyst. 

Aldo wants to have a career in the working world and this is why he is studying to get ahead.

He is requesting this loan to be able to pay his course fees and thus be able to continue to study.

loans.use: to pay university fees.

loans.name: Bett

texts.en:
Bett comes from a remote village found in the Bomet area of Kenya. He practices dairy, poultry and crop farming to make a living and uses most of his income to meet his family’s basic needs.

Bett is married and has three children. He is determined to grow his business and improve his family’s income.

Bett is seeking a loan to buy poultry to produce eggs, chicks, and meat for consumption and sale. He intends to use this loan to buy traditional breeds of chicken because they are well-adapted to local conditions. With your loan investment into his business, Bett will make the best out of the increased demand for poultry products in the market. This economic opportunity, once seized, will improve his livelihood and generate more income for his family.

loans.use: to buy poultry.

loans.name: Asociacion Ybycui Group

texts.es:
En total son 17 mujeres inspiradas que se esfuerzan día a día para solventar los gastos diarios y por sobre todo aumentar sus ingresos. Forman parte del comité con el fundamento de ayudarse y más bien consideran una oportunidad de suma importancia para ellas para trabajar y obtener sus propios ingresos. El grupo está conformado por mujeres que poseen habilidades en trabajar para poder salir adelante. Todas ellas son artesanas que quieren salir adelante.
La Sra. Jacinta es integrante del grupo ella se dedica a la elaboración de frazadas y encajes, es una artesana muy buena en lo que hace, y de esa forma se gana la vida de una vida honesta y digna.
Ella pide este préstamo para poder comprar hilos, bastidores y otros productos, de manera a poder seguir con su trabajo como lo viene haciendo. Ella agradece por la oportunidad que recibe de mejorar sus condiciones de vida.
texts.en:
In all, these are 17 inspired women who work hard day by day to cover their daily costs and, above all, to increase their income. They are part of the committee with the purpose of helping themselves and also consider it a very important opportunity for them to work and earn their own income. The group is made up of women who have skills in working in order to get ahead. They are all artisans who want to get ahead.

Jacinta is a member of the group. She works making blankets and lace. She is a very skilled artisan in what she does, and in this way she earns her living honestly and with dignity.

She asks for this loan to purchase thread, stretcher frames and other products, so to be able to continue with her work as she has been doing. She is thankful for the opportunity that she is getting to improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase thread, stretcher frames and other products.

loans.name: Mao

texts.en:
Mao, 55, lives in Kompong Cham Province of Cambodia. He has three children.

To make a living, he manages and operates a farming business, primarily growing rice and cucumber. He sells his agricultural products to local dealers.

He has been in this type of business for around 20 years. On average, he is able to make an income of 2.50 USD a day.

In this farming season, he is lacking money to buy some farm supplies. To continue his farming, he is borrowing some money from KIiva now to buy farm supplies like fertilizers, seeds and insecticides. He is thankful to lenders for the financial support. He is awaiting your kindness.

loans.use: to buy farm supplies like fertilizers, seeds and insecticides.

loans.name: Ibraheem

texts.en:
Ibraheem is a 46-year-old married man from Rafah city, which is located in the Gaza Strip and suffers from power outages 12-16 hours a day regularly.

He lives with his wife and six children in a small house. As an employee in the public sector, he earns a low income. This income barely covers all the family's needs.

Because he is not able to save enough money, Ibraheem took a USD loan from FATEN. With this loan, he will buy a solar system and filter for heating water for the family house.

Palestinians use water boilers that use either gas or gasoline to heat the water before a shower, which can be dangerous, expensive and inefficient. This will help him to provide hot water without using electricity.

loans.use: to buy a solar system for heating water for the family house.

loans.name: Nancy

texts.es:
Nancy,  es nuevo cliente  de la fundación paraguaya, vive con sus padres en la ciudad de Curuguaty. Estudia, y está cursando el segundo  año   de la carrera de Contabilidad.  Nancy está luchando para poder crecer y ser alguien en la vida. Pide este préstamo para poder comprar libros, y de esa forma poder seguir estudiando como lo viene haciendo.
Agradece por esta oportunidad que recibe de poder crecer y salir adelante.
texts.en:
Nancy is a new customer of Fundacion Paraguaya.

She lives with her parents in the city fo Curuguaty. She is studying in her second year in an Accountancy course. Nancy is working hard to grow and be someone in live. She is requesting this loan to be able to buy text book, and this way be able to continue to study the way she is doing.

She is thankful for the opportunity she is given to grow  and move forward.

loans.use: to buy text books for university.

loans.name: Francis

texts.en:
Francis is a married man. He has four children. He describes himself as determined.

He operates a retail business where he sells auto spares. He has been involved in this business for 20 years. His business is located in a busy area and his primary customers are of all types.

He describes his biggest business challenge as low stock. He will use the KES 80,000 loan to buy more stock of auto spares. His business goal is to expand within five years.

He hopes that in the future, he will have better living standards. This is his third loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. His previous loans were repaid successfully.

loans.use: buy more stock of auto spares.

loans.name: Samuel

texts.en:
Samuel is a married man. He has three children. He describes himself to be visionary. He operates a retail business where he sells auto spare parts. He has been involved in this business for 15 years. His business is located in a busy area and his primary customers are car owners and mechanics. He describes his biggest business challenge to be low stock.

He will use the Kes 120,000 loan to buy more stock of auto spare parts.

His business goal is to be a supplier of spare parts to all garages in the town within five years. He hopes that in the future, he will have good living conditions.

This is his fourth loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. The previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy more stock of auto spare parts.

loans.name: Santa Lucia Group

texts.es:
El grupo Santa Lucia  está en su ciclo número 1° del programa de comité de mujeres, son de la Ciudad de Itá, donde todas trabajan y se ayudan por salir adelante. Una de las señoras integrantes es Agripina, entre el trabajo que ella realiza es la elaboración y venta de cigarros, teniendo su propio ingreso, y por medio de su humilde trabajo ayuda a su familia, también se debe destacar el trabajo de la fundación paraguaya, quien hace un seguimiento permanente de capacitaciones y verificaciones.
La Sra. Agripina solicita de este crédito para la compra de la materia prima para elaborar sus cigarros, el cual es tabaco. Agradecen todas por la oportunidad que reciben de poder crecer y mejorar.
texts.en:
The group Santa Lucia is in its loan cycle number 1 of the women's committee program. They are from the city of Itá where they all work and help each other to get ahead. One of the members is Agripina, and among the work she does is making and selling cigarettes, having her own income and through her humble work she helps her family. The work of Fundación Paraguaya also stands out, which follows up continuously with training and verification.

Agripina asks for this loan to purchase raw material to make her cigarettes, which is tobacco. They are all grateful for the opportunity that they get to be able to grow and improve.

loans.use: to purchase tobacco to make cigarettes.

loans.name: Union Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado “Union ” esta dentro del programa de eliminación de la pobreza, son mujeres muy trabajadoras y luchadoras que quieren dar a sus seres queridos todo lo que ellas no pudieron tener.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Francisca, quien es la presidenta de este grupo, ella es una mujer muy trabajadora y emprendedora que quiere salir adelante por medio de su trabajo y con lo cual quiere poder ayudar a su familia.  Ella se dedica a la venta de cosméticos, y por medio de sus ventas se gana la vida de una manera digna y honesta.
Pide este préstamo para poder comprar cosméticos variados, para poder cumplir con sus clientes, y de esa forma poder seguir con sus ventas.
texts.en:
The group called Union is in the poverty elimination program. They are hard-working and determined women who want to give their loved ones everything they were not able to have.

One of the members is Francisca, who is the president of this group. She is a very hard-working and enterprising woman who wants to get ahead through her work and with which she wants to help her family. She works selling cosmetics and, through her sales, she earns a living in a dignified and honest way.

She asks for this loan to be able to purchase a variety of cosmetics to be able to satisfy her customers and, in this way, be able to continue with her sales.

loans.use: to purchase cosmetics to sell.

loans.name: Winfred

texts.en:
Winfred is 39 years old. She is married and they have two children. She operates a boutique as well as does farming. She has been in the business for one year.

This is her first loan from VisionFund Kenya. She will use the loan to buy fertilizer and seeds for her farming business. She will use profits from the expanded business to educate her children.

Her hope and dream for the future is to grow her business to be an international business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and seedlings.

loans.name: Hussein

texts.en:
Hussein is a 47-year-old married man from Rafah city, which is located in the Gaza Strip and suffers from power outages 12-16 hours a day regularly. He lives with his family in a small house. As an employee in the public sector, he earns a low income. This income barely covers all the family's needs.

Because he is not able to save enough money, Hussein took a USD loan from FATEN. With this loan, he will buy a solar system for heating water for the family house.

Palestinians use water boilers that use either gas or gasoline to heat the water before a shower; these which can be dangerous, expensive and inefficient. This will help him to provide hot water without using electricity, which is much more expensive.

loans.use: to buy a solar system for heating water for the family house.

loans.name: Naftali

texts.en:
Naftali is a married man. He has three children. He describes himself as honest.

He operates a carpentry shop where he makes furniture. He has been involved in this business for six years. His business is located in a busy area and his primary customers are of all types. He describes his biggest business challenge to be lack of efficient machinery.

He will use the KES 80,000 loan to buy a carpentry machine to enable him to work efficiently. He hopes that in the future, he will have good living standards.

This is his third loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. Previous loans were repaid successfully.

loans.use: buy a carpentry machine.

loans.name: Twifatanye Group

texts.en:
Twifatanye is a group led by Apronie, who is 42 years old. The group name means “Support each other” in English. She is married and has one child who is 5 years old.

She sells food and has been doing this business for the past five years. The group members sell different items but they have the same idea for changing their lives.

With the loan, she would like to buy more maize, beans and rice to sell. The profits from the business will be used to improve her standard of living and renovate her house.

loans.use: to buy more maize, beans and rice to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy a new car for transport.

loans.name: Abanyamugisha Group

texts.en:
Clemantine is a group leader; aged 53 years. She is married, with 8 children aged between 10 and 27 years. Five of them go to school.

The group is called ABANYAMUGISHA, which means “the blessed people” in English. They sell different products and they wish to expand their businesses to change their lives for the better.

She has a shop and has been running in a business for six years.

With the loan, she would like to buy more rice, Colgate, biscuits and juice to sell.

The profits from the business will be used to pay school fees of her children and to pay for medical insurance.

loans.use: to buy more rice, Colgate, biscuits and juice to sell.

loans.name: Laline

texts.en:
Laline is from Phnomsrok, a village in the northwestern part of Cambodia. She is 39 years old. She lives in a wooden house. Her family owns four hectars of rice fields and one hectar of casava field.

In 2011, she was trained by Soieries du Mékong, a social enterprise which fights against rural exodus and for empowerment of women by training them and offering them sustainable work in the village. Laline makes scarves which are sold in Cambodia and Europe.

She uses her weaving income to pay for her family expenses and to buy fertilizer for the field.

Thanks to the loan, she will buy the silk and pay for the dyeing and preparation of the loom.

Please support her so she can keep making beautiful traditional hand woven scarves!

loans.use: To buy silk and pay for loom preparation related fees

loans.name: Liz

texts.es:
Liz es de la ciudad de Curuguaty, Estudia, y está cursando el segundo  año   de la carrera de Ingeniería Zootecnia.  
Ella quiere abrirse camino al mundo laboral para poder ayudar a sus seres queridos por medio de su trabajo. Ella está luchando y esforzándose por su meta.
Pide este préstamo para la compra de una notebook y compras de útiles para poder seguir con sus estudios.
texts.en: Liz is from the city of Curuguaty, is a student, and is in her second year of a degree in animal husbandry engineering. She wants to make her way in the work world to be able to help her loved ones through her work. She is struggling and working hard for her goal. She asks for this loan to purchase a laptop and supplies to be able to continue with her education.

loans.use: to purchase a laptop and office supplies.

loans.name: Maria

texts.es:
Maria esta estudiando la carrera de administración de empresas, por medio de su carrera quiere poder mejorar su negocio y poder agrandarlo cada vez mas, ella busca por poder crecer y mejorar, para poder ser útil, no solo a si misma, sino tambien a los demás. Comenta que su préstamo anterior lo uso en pagar las cuotas de su carrera, lo cual le fue muy útil.
Pide este nuevo préstamo para poder comprar libros, y también pagar las cuotas de su carrera y de esa forma poder seguir estudiando.
texts.en:
Maria is studying for a degree in business administration. Through her degree, she wants to be able to improve her business and to be able to continue to grow it. She is seeking to be able to grow and improve, to be able to be useful, not only for herself but also to others. She says that she used the previous loan to pay the tuition for her program, which was very useful.

She asks for this new loan to be able to purchase books and also to pay the tuition for her program and, in this way, be able to continue studying.

loans.use: to purchase books and pay tuition.

loans.name: Ry

texts.en:
Ry, 63, is a married woman who lives in a small community of Kampong Cham Province, Cambodia. She has only one child.

To make a living and support her family, she manages and operates a farming business on a small farmland which is located near her house. On her farmland, she grows rice and cassava and sells her agricultural product to the local dealers. She has been in this business for around 30 years. On average, she can generate an earning of USD 2.50 per day.

The current farmland that she owns is small and it can provide small benefit to her. She wants to enlarge her farmland area, but she cannot afford it. Therefore, now she would like to get a Kiva loan to buy a plot of farmland for growing cassava. She hopes this additional farmland will help to improve her living conditions. She is thankful to all lenders for their financial support.

loans.use: to buy a plot of farmland for growing cassava.

loans.name: Muhammmad

texts.en:
Muhammad is a 26-year-old single man from Rafah city, which is located in the Gaza Strip and suffers from power outages 12-16 hours a day regularly. He lives with his family in a small house.

As an employee in the public sector, he earns a low income. This income barely covers all the family's needs.

Because he is not able to save enough money, Muhammad took a USD loan from FATEN. With this loan, he will buy a solar system for heating water for the family house.

Palestinians use water boilers that use either gas or gasoline to heat the water before a shower, which can be dangerous, expensive and inefficient. This will help him to provide hot water without using electricity.

loans.use: to buy a solar system for heating water for the family house.

loans.name: Calle Amarilla Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado Calle Amarilla se formó con la unión de 15 mujeres muy trabajadoras y luchadoras que quieren salir adelante por medio del trabajo unido y sacrificado de todas ellas. Cada una quiere ayudar a sus seres queridos por medio de su unión.
La Sra. Gladys es una de las que integra este grupo, ella es la presidenta de este grupo, es una mujer muy sacrificada que con sacrificio está saliendo adelante para poder crecer. Gladys se dedica a hacer comidas todas los días desde muy tempranas horas del día, y luego sale a vender de manera ambulante.
Pide este préstamo para poder invertirlo en la compra de insumos varios para poder hacer sus comidas, como ser verduras, carnes, condimentos, y otros, y de esa forma poder seguir luchando por su familia y sus seres queridos.
texts.en:
The group Calle Amarilla formed with the union of 15 very hardworking women and fighters who want to succeed through united work and sacrifice from all of them. Each one wants to help their loved ones through their union.

Gladys is one of the members of this group. She is the president of the group, and is a woman who is self-sacrificing who is moving forward with sacrifice in order to be able to grow. Gladys makes a living preparing meals every day starting in the very early hours of the morning, and later she leaves to sell as a street vendor.

She is requesting this loan to be able to invest in the purchase various inputs to make her meals, such as vegetables, meats, seasonings, and other, and in this way be able to continue fighting for her family and her loved ones.

loans.use: to buy vegetables, meats, seasonings, and others to make meals.

loans.name: Leticia

texts.es:
La Sra. Leticia le ayuda a su tía en su despensa y por  la noche estudia la carrera de laboratorio clínico, para el próximo año tiene proyectado en trabajar en su profesión.
Es una persona muy responsable y dedicada a sus estudios y a su familia, aspira a ser un buen profesional y seguir estudiando y servir a las personas.
Pide este préstamo para poder pagar si tesis, y de esa forma poder seguir con sus estudios como lo viene haciendo.
texts.en:
Leticia helps her aunt in her store and at night is studying for a degree in clinical laboratory and next year she plans to work in her profession.

She is a very responsible person, dedicated to her education and her family. She aspires to be a good professional and to continue studying and serving people.

She asks for this loan to pay for her thesis, and in this way be able to continue with her education as she has been doing.

loans.use: to pay the cost of her thesis.

loans.name: Gina

texts.en:
Gina, 40, lives in General Santos City, South Cotabato. She is married to Benjamin, a self-employed worker, and they have children who are still in the elementary level. In addition to paying the fees for her children in school, Gina works hard to support and maintain the household’s daily expenses.

Gina operates a “sari-sari” store, a type of small convenience store in the Philippines. There she sells fresh, dry and packaged commodities, with almost all of her products being essential household items and food. She buys these goods at wholesale prices, then sells them by the piece to her neighbors and the local community. This type of store is very common in the Philippines, and expectedly, the competition is stiff. Somehow she tries to compete by adding charcoal to her inventory and by retailing cellphone load.

To enhance her variety store and make it more competitive, Gina is applying for a PhP 20,000 loan which she will use to buy additional grocery items such as canned goods, instant noodles, sachets and packs of toiletries, and many other things. Part of it will be used to buy load wallet for her cellphone e-loading. This supplementary capital will make her business more stable and will give her higher income.
