In due time, she plans to add another income generating venture, something that can contribute to food production in her community, maybe a farm or animal raising endeavor.

She wants her children to get a college education to bring them better opportunities in life. She thanks God and you in advance for this financial assistance, for it will surely bring supplementary income for the family.

All CCT community clients such as Gina are organized into fellowship groups of 15 to 30 members who meet on a weekly basis. There they share stories of their work, repay microfinance loans and draw strength and inspiration from their study of the Word of God.

loans.use: to buy addtional grocery items for her variety store

loans.name: Jostina

texts.en:
Jostina is 57 years old. She is married and they have eight children. She does farming and has been farming for 15 years. This is her second loan from VisionFund Kenya.

She will use the loan to buy fertilizer and seedlings.

She will use profits from the expanded business to buy a water tank. Her hope and dream for the future is to have a happy family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and seeds.

loans.name: Aproniano

texts.en:
Aproniano is from San Miguel, Bohol. He is 43 years old, married, and has six children. His oldest child is 21 years old and his youngest child is 11 years old.

Aproniano is doing rice farming to earn a living. He has been doing this business for 20 years and earns about PHP3,000 per month. He works hard to provide the needs of his family.

He is requesting a loan of PHP10,000 to buy fertilizer, medicines and pesticides, and also to pay laborers for their farm.

In the future, Aproniano wants to send all his children to school to have a better living. He also wants to have enough capital to run his business.

loans.use: to buy to buy fertilizer, medicines or pesticides, and also to pay laborers

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy more shirts and dresses for sale.

loans.name: Edwin

texts.en:
At the age of 38, Edwin, is still single and he is longing for a child. However, his long time girlfriend is working abroad for a better chance to earn higher income. He’s been waiting for her for several years, and to reduce his loneliness, he focuses his attention on his motorcycle livelihood. He uses his income to support his parents and siblings, nieces and nephews; it’s expected from a single person in the Philippines. He’s also trying to save enough money to buy another unit of motorcycle which he can rent out to his friend. With this, he can double his income and perhaps his girlfriend can stay in the country to nurture a family with him.

As a further step towards his dream, he needs additional capital of PhP 20,000 partly to buy spare parts for his motorcycle and partly to pay the downpayment for another motorcycle unit. He is praying that you would be one of God’s instruments to help him. He would really appreciate your kind assistance.

Edwin is committed to CCT Credit Cooperative’s vision to alleviate poverty, and he regularly meets with his co-fellowship* members every week to share stories of his life and business and to draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God. *All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to buy spare parts for his motorcycle and for a downpayment for another motorcycle unit.

loans.name: Christian

texts.es:
El Sr. Christian es estudiante de la carrera de Administración de Empresas, es empleado de una empresa de seguridad, el mismo se ve ejerciendo como profesional de aquí en seis años.
Desea culminar su carrera para crecer como profesional y mejorar sus ingresos para poder ayudar a su familia.
Pide este préstamo para poder pagar las cuotas de su carrera y de esa forma poder continuar con sus estudios como lo viene haciendo.
texts.en:
Christian is a student in the business administration program. He is an employee in a security business, and has been working there as a professional for six years.

He wants to finish his program to grow as a professional and increase his income to be able to help his family.

He asks for this loan to be able to pay the tuition for his program and in this way to be able to continue with his education as he has been doing.

loans.use: to pay university tuition.

loans.name: Estelvina

texts.es:
Estelvina estudia la carrera de Fisioterapia  y Kinesiología para así poder ayudar a mucha gente incapacitada de movilidad y poder superarse ella misma a través de estos trabajos.
Le motivan los niños de escasos recursos que necesitan especial atención y no tienen la posibilidad de acceder a ello.
Pide este préstamo para poder pagar sus cuotas de la universidad y de esa forma poder continuar con sus estudios como lo viene haciendo.
texts.en:
Estelvina is studying physical therapy and kinesiology to be able to help many who have a mobility impairment and to be able to improve herself through this work.  

She is motivated by children of limited resources who need special attention and don't have the possibility of getting it.

She asks for this loan to be able to pay her university tuition and in this way to be able to continue with her studies as she has been doing.

loans.use: to pay university tuition.

loans.name: Lidia

texts.es: Lidia esta esforzándose para poder cumplir con sus metas de ser una buena radiologa, ella es una mujer muy emprendedora que lucha por poder salir adelante y cumplir por medio de sus estudios, todos sus anhelos. Comenta que su préstamo anterior le ha sido de mucha ayuda, y pide este nuevo préstamo para poder pagar las cuotas de su carrera y de esa forma poder seguir con sus estudios como lo viene haciendo.
texts.en: Lidia is striving to meet her goals of being a radiologist. She is a very entrepreneurial woman who fights to get by and enforced through her studies, all of her desires. She says that her previous loan was very helpful, and requests this new loan to be able to pay the fees of her career and thus be able to continue with her studies as she has been.

loans.use: to pay university fees.

loans.name: Fredy

texts.es:
Fredy es de la ciudad de Encarnación, a la vez que estudia también está trabajando para poder costear un poco de los gastos que implican sus estudios.
Él es una persona que quiere salir adelante, y lo quiere lograr por medio de sus estudios. Comenta que está estudiando la carrera de comercio internacional y por medio de sus estudios quiere abrirse camino.
 Pide este préstamo para poder pagar las cuotas de su carrera, y de esa forma poder seguir con sus estudios.
texts.en: Fredy is from the city of Encarnación, while studying he is also working to be able to fund some of the expenses of his studies. He is a person who wants to succeed, and what he wants to achieve through his studies. He says that he is studying the career of international trade and through his studies wants to open his way. He is requesting this loan to be abel to pay the feeds of his career, and thus be able to continue with his studies.

loans.use: to pay university fees.

loans.name: Carlos

texts.es:
Carlos tiene 27 años,  está estudiando la carrera de enfermería, por medio de su carrera quiere poder ayudar a las demás personas y de esa forma poder ganarse la vida de una manera digna.
Él es una persona muy sacrificada que pone todo de sí para poder crecer y salir adelante.
Pide este préstamo para poder pagar las cuotas de su carrera, y de esa forma poder seguir con sus estudios como lo viene haciendo.
texts.en:
Carlos is 27 years old, he is studying for a degree in nursing and through his degree he wants to be able to help other people and in this way be able to earn a living in a dignified way.

He is a very self-sacrificing person who puts his all into being able to grow and get ahead.

He asks for this loan to be able to pay his program tuition and in this way to be able to continue with his studies as he has been doing.

loans.use: to pay university tuition.

loans.name: Shukrullo

texts.ru:
Шукрулло человек праздник. Он веселый и всегда рассмешит любого человека. Не один человек не уйдет от него с плохим настроением. Шукрулло женат и имеет годовалую дочку. 
  У Шукрулло есть мечта, он хочет стать знаменитым человеком. Шукрулло верит, что благодаря проекту KIVA о нем и его работе узнает весь мир. Шукрулло на рынке занимается продажей шинкованной моркови. Это очень удобный продукт для приготовления пищи в столовых, кафе и для тех, кто устраивает большие мероприятия. Во всех мероприятиях и больших праздников таджики готовят плов, где основным блюдом является рис, морковь и мясо. Немного людей занимаются таким родом деятельности. Но Шукрулло любит свою работу и своих коллег, которые дают ему хорошее настроение и он в ответ отдает еще больше позитива. Шукрулло решил расшить бизнес и также с морковью продавать специи. Сейчас у его 5 тазиков со специями и он хочет увеличить ассортимент и привези разных других видов специй. В том числе с такой целью он обратился за помощью. Поддержите веселого человека из маленького городка Куляб.
texts.en:
Shukrullo is a man who enjoys life. He is cheerful and always makes people laugh. No person ever leaves him in a bad mood. He is married and has a one-year-old daughter.

Shukrullo has a dream of becoming a well-known person. He believes that thanks to Kiva, the whole world will know about him and his work. He sells shredded carrots at the market. This product is very useful for making food in cafeterias and cafes and for those putting on big events. Tajiks make plov for all big parties and events, a dish whose primary ingredients are rice, carrots and meat. Only a few people sell this product. But Shukrullo loves his work and his colleagues, who put him in a good mood and to whom he responds with even greater positivity.

Shukrullo has decided to expand his business and to sell spices as well as carrots. Right now he has five spice bins and he wants to increase his inventory and bring in a wider variety of spices. For this reason he is looking for help. Support this cheerful man from the small city of Kulob.

loans.use: to purchase spices to sell at his food stall

loans.name: Muhammad

texts.en:
Muhammad is a 45-year-old married man from Rafah city, which is located in the Gaza Strip and suffers from power outages 12-16 hours a day regularly. He lives with his family in a small house. As an employee in the public sector, he earns a low income. This income barely covers all the family's needs.

Because he is not able to save enough money, Muhammad took a USD loan from FATEN. With this loan, he will buy a solar system for heating water for the family house.

Palestinians use water boilers that use either gas or gasoline to heat the water before a shower; this can be dangerous, expensive and inefficient. This will help him to provide hot water without using electricity, which is much more expensive.

loans.use: to buy a solar system for heating water for the family house.

loans.name: Janeffer

texts.en:
Janeffer is 46 years old. She is married and they have four children.

She does farming and has been farming for 20 years. This is her second loan from VisionFund Kenya.

She will use the loan to buy fertilizer and seeds. She will use profits from the expanded business to pay school fees for her husband who is gone to college.

Her hopes and dreams for the future are to have a successful business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and seeds.

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Margaret is 33 years old. She is married and they have two children. She operates a beauty salon and has been in business for 15 years. 

This is her second loan from VisionFund Kenya. She will use the loan to buy shampoos, lotions, soap and treatment chemicals. 

She will use profits from the expanded business to open a shop.  Her hopes and dreams for the future are to have a successful business.

loans.use: to buy shampoos, lotions, soap and treatment chemicals.

loans.name: Muhammad

texts.en:
Muhammad is a 38-year-old married man from Rafah city, which is located in the Gaza Strip and suffers from power outages 12-16 hours a day regularly. He lives with his family in a small house. As an employee in the public sector, he earns a low income. This income barely covers all the family's needs.

Because he is not able to save enough money, Muhammad took a USD loan from FATEN. With this loan, he will buy a solar system for heating water for the family house.

Palestinians use water boilers that use either gas or gasoline to heat the water before a shower, which can be dangerous, expensive and inefficient. This will help him to provide hot water without using electricity, which is much more expensive.

loans.use: to buy a solar system for heating water for the family house.

loans.name: Guillerma

texts.en:
Guillerma is a sari-sari store owner from San Miquel, Bohol. She is a 60-year-old woman and has a 22-year-old daughter. She has been doing a sari-sari store business for 10 years. Aside from this business, Guillerma and her husband own a farm. She supports her husband, who is a farmer, to run their rice farm business.

She is asking a loan to buy grocery items such as soft drinks, drinking liquor, chips, candies, coffee, powdered milk and chocolate drink, sugar, bread, biscuits and toiletries. She also buys fertilizer and pays laborers for their farm.

In the future Guillerma plans to build a new house for a comfortable living.

loans.use: to buy soft drinks, drinking liquor, chips, candies, coffee, powdered milk and chocolate drink, sugar, bread, biscuits, toiletries, fertilizer and pay laborers

loans.name: Alicia

texts.en:
Native products or native crafts in the Philippines do not only give profits to local manufacturers, but it also showcases Filipinos’ ingenuity and gives value to indigenous people’s arts and culture. Alicia knows of its importance; that is why she chose to venture in this kind of business. She buys native products, particularly woven baskets, then sells them in a temporary space in one of the markets in Tigbauan, Iloilo. She’s yearning to have a permanent space so she can also sell other native items created from coconut shells or husks, rattan, sea shells, bamboo, dried leaves and stems, woven ethnic threads, and many others. These hand-made objects are very attractive to foreigners and local tourists who usually visit the area.

Alicia is married to Desiderio, a farmer, who is always supportive of her and her business. Now Alicia would like to add more selection of bamboo products that will surely entice the buyers. She is in need of Php 15,000 additional capital to procure these. Part of it will be utilized to buy fertilizer for their farm. Hope you are willing to help her so she can increase her profit, sustain their everyday needs, and boost her savings.

She’s praying for good health and long life. She meets with her co-fellowship* members every week to share stories of her life and business and to draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God. *All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to buy more bamboo products

loans.name: Martin

texts.es:
Martin es una persona que esta esforzándose por poder salir adelante, y por medio de su carrera poder abrirse camino, y cambien poder ayudar a su familia. Comenta que con su anterior préstamo compro una computadora y con la cual esta cumpliendo sus tareas.
Hoy pide este nuevo préstamo para poder pagar sus gastos de titulacion, y de esa forma poder cubrir ese gasto que tiene y poder terminar sus estudios.
texts.en:
Martin is a person who works hard to be able to get ahead and through his degree to be able to make his way and, for a change, to be able to help his family.

He says that with his previous loan he purchased a computer with which he is doing his work. 

Today he is asking for another loan to be able to pay the costs of registering his degree and in this way to be able to cover this expense that he has and be able to finish his studies.

loans.use: to pay the costs of registering his degree.

loans.name: Martha Irene

texts.es:
La ciudad de Manta es considerada el balneario más importante, popular y visitado del Ecuador, por sus hermosas y acogedoras playas, primer puerto de aguas profundas del Ecuador y sur América.
En este lugar vive la señora Martha, tiene 56  años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tiene 4 hijos mayores de edad e independientes. Su esposo es pescador. Viven en casa propia.
Doña Martha para ayudarle a su esposo con los gastos del hogar se dedica a la venta de materiales de pesca en su casa, vende anzuelos, nylon, redes, entre otros,  también vende productos de Avon hace 10 meses, se dedica 2 días a la semana a  vender puerta a puerta estos productos, deja a crédito y  cobra cada ocho días, quincena y fin de mes.
Este crédito lo va utilizar en comprar materiales de pesca. Está en el Grupo De Crédito desde hace12 años  y le gusta porque es muy unido el grupo y le han ayudado a incrementar su negocio. Su sueño es que sus negocios crezcan.
texts.en:
The city of Manta is considered to be the most important, popular, and visited seaside resort in Ecuador for its beautiful and inviting beaches. It also has the first deep-water port in Ecuador and South America. This is the place where Martha lives, who is 56 years old. She is married and has four grown children who live independently. Her husband is a fisherman. They live in their own home.

To help her husband with the household expenses, Martha works at selling fishing supplies from her home. She sells fish hooks, fishing line, and nets, among other things. She has also been selling Avon products for ten months, going door to door two days a week. She leaves her products on credit and collects every week, two weeks, and at the end of the month.

She will use this loan to buy fishing supplies. She has been a member of her credit group for twelve years, and she likes it because it is a very united group that has helped her increase her business. Her dream is to see her businesses grow.

loans.use: to buy fishing supplies.

loans.name: Sevinc

texts.en:
Sevinc is 43 year old, married and mother of 3 kids. Her husband doesn’t work. She is an IDP (internally displaced person) and lives with family in the Bilasuvar region and is a dairy farmer. She has started keeping dairy cows 5 years ago and Sevinc has started this business with an amount of small capital. She is also very socially oriented person and knows that nowadays people have become health-conscious and very caring about their family’s health. 

Therefore Sevinc wants to take her first step and she believes she can make different products (cheese, yoghurt) from her cow’s milk. In this way Sevinc would develop her business. 

So she needs some money to buy cows and sheep. Please help her to reach this aim.

loans.use: to buy cows and sheep for increased milk and then cheese/yoghurt production

loans.name: Jehan

texts.en:
Jehan is 19 years old and is studying for a degree in the English language. She lives in Ramtha with her family where she is a one of 5 siblings.  She is working really hard to get ahead and to grow.

Jehan dreams of having a good job, so that she could help to pay for her daily expenses and help her family in their household expenses.

She has requested this loan to pay for her educational expenses so that she can continue her education, and achieve her dreams.

loans.use: to pay for her university fees, to obtain her BA in English

loans.name: Ammar

texts.en:
Ammar is a 24 years old and lives in a sector in Jordan called Irbid.

Ammar is an ambitious man and a good example of an inquisitive person, as he likes to know and understand everything to help him recognize the requirement of dealing with people or to know the community requirements. 

He is studying Finance in his third year and hopes to find good work in this field.  Ammar is working hard to complete his education.  Right now he is working in one of the large malls with low income but the job is helping him to insure his daily expenses and help his retired father in the household expenses.

 Ammar could not cover this semester fees because of that, so he is applying for an educational loan to help him pay for his university fees

loans.use: to help him pay his third year university fees for a BA in Finance

loans.name: Thủy

texts.en:
Mrs Thủy is 27 years old and she is married. She has worked in agriculture raising poultry for 4 years.
Thủy lives in Thieu Hoa district, a  rural town in Thanh Hoa province.

Her family is a low-income household in village, moreover the market need is low in this region.
 
One of the most critical difficulties that concerns her is the latrine is not hygienic. She is requesting a loan to purchase sand, cement, brick and equipment to build a toilet.

In 2015, Thủy joined Thanh Hoa microfinance institution to improve her  business. Thủy has successfully repaid 3 loans from Thanh Hoa microfinance institution.
With her business profit, Thủy hopes for her business to do well, to make enough money to provide for her kids, and to be able to buy more supplies and equipment for her business.

loans.use: to purchase sand, cement, brick and equipment to build a toilet.

loans.name: Camal

texts.en:
Camal is 39 year old, a farmer and a married man .Camal is IDP (internally displaced person) and lives with his family in Bilasuvar region. Camal doesn’t earn enough money, as he is the only one who works in his family.  Recently life has become difficult for his family and he wants everyone to have good living conditions

In the future. Camal wants to grow more fruit to improve his own business. His dream is to sow more seeds. From this he will have more delicious natural fruits and he will make fruit juice. 

His plan is to sell this juice product of his in his local bazaar. For all this he needs Kiva Lenders support.

loans.use: to sow more seeds to produce fruits for healthy juices to be sold locally

loans.name: Kilonzo

texts.en:
Kilonzo is a married man with 3 children. He operates a retail business where he sells meat. He has been involved in this business for 18 years. His business is located in a good  place for business and his primary customers are regular. 

He describes his biggest business challenge to be price fluctuations. 

He will use the Kes 80,000 loan to buy goats. He hopes that in the future, he will be a supplier of meat to other retailers. This is his second loan with SMEP Microfinance bank. His previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy goats for selling the meat

loans.name: Mubariz

texts.en:
Mubariz is 37 year old, married and a refugee. He has 2 daughters. He is a farmer and doesn’t earn a good income as his wife doesn’t work.

He is a hardworking and respected person. Mubariz has had 4 years experience on his small land and he wants to expand it and sow new fruit and vegetable seeds. 

Mubariz is very grateful to Kiva lenders for their support

loans.use: to expand his farming and sow new fruit and vegetable seeds.

loans.name: Mustafa

texts.en:
Mustafa is 46, married and has 4 children. He has a small fattening project in which his wife helps him by making cheese and butter for domestic use and for sale in the local market. 

Mustafa previously requested a 5000 EGP loan from TADE and successfully repaid it on due dates. He is requesting an 8000 EGP loan to buy a head of cattle to increase his income for his family.

loans.use: To buy a head of cattle so his wife may make more butter and cheese for sale

loans.name: Rahmah

texts.en:
Rahmah is 20 years old, lives in Salt and she is studying foreign languages. She is very ambitious and patient lady she is working hard to graduate to find good work with good salary to help her family in the household expenses and her siblings in their education.


She comes from a very simple family and their income level is very low, so she had to apply for an educational loan to help her cover her university fees and achieving her dreams.

loans.use: to help her cover her fees for a BA in Foreign Languages

loans.name: Anastasia

texts.es:
Anastasia es una mujer casada de 38 años de edad, ella vive junto a su familia en una comunidad de Sololá, Anastasia tiene seis hijos de las edades entre 15 y 8 años.
Anastasia es una mujer que lucha cada día para apoyar a su familia, pues desde hace 12 años se dedica a la elaboración de ropa típica, le gusta hacer esta actividad ya que lo hace desde la comunidad de su casa, y esto le permite realizar los oficios de su casa y cuidar de sus hijos con esta actividad ella contribuye con su esposo en complementar algunos gastos.
Anastasia con el afán de seguir elaborando ropa típica, ella solicita un préstamo para invertir en su elaboración de ropa, con este dinero ella estará comprando hilos de tipo seda, alemán, lustrina y todo lo relacionado con la línea de tejido. Anastasia tiene el sueño de poder construir su casa de block y brindarle a su familia una mejor vida.
texts.en:
Anastasia is a 38-year-old married woman. She lives with her family in a community in Solola, Anastasia has six children between the ages of 8 and 15. 
Anastasia is a woman who works hard every day to support her family; for the past twelve years she has made traditional clothing. She likes this work since she can do it from the comfort of her home, and that allows her to tend to household tasks and take care of her children. With this work she is helping her husband to cover some expenses. 
Wanting to continue making traditional clothing, she is requesting a loan to invest in her sewing work. With this money she will purchase thread of silk, alpaca thread and everything related to her sewing. Anastasia's dream is to be able to build a brick house and be able to give her family a better life.

loans.use: to buy silk thread, alpaca thread and others for  her sewing

loans.name: Jihad

texts.en:
Jihad is a 45-year-old married man from Rafah city, which is located in the Gaza Strip and suffers from power outages 12-16 hours a day regularly. He lives with his family in a small house. As an employee in the public sector, he earns a low income. This income barely covers all the family's needs.

Because he is not able to save enough money, Jihad took a USD loan from FATEN. With this loan, he will buy a solar system for heating water for the family house.

Palestinians use water boilers that use either gas or gasoline to heat the water before a shower, which can be dangerous, expensive and inefficient. This will help him to provide hot water without using electricity, which is much more expensive.

loans.use: buy a solar system for heating water for the family house

loans.name: Mariam

texts.en:
Mariam is a married woman with five children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

For the past five years, she has operated a soft drink fruit juice selling business, selling from home to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a challenge of seasonality and the high cost of transporting raw materials.

With the Kshs 50,000, she wants to purchase sacks of fruits, mangoes and passion fruits for making fruit juice to sell.

She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of fruits, mangoes and passion fruits for making fruit juice to sell.

loans.name: Nyamvula

texts.en:
Nyamvula is a married woman; she has four children, all of whom attend school. Nyamvula owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

Nyamvula has operated a charcoal selling business, selling from home to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a stiff competition from other firewood operators in her business.

With the Kshs 50,000, she wants to purchase sacks of charcoal to sell.

She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of charcoal to sell.

loans.name: Delia

texts.en:
Delia is 52 years old and has four children.

Delia is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. Delia requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed, vitamins and other supplies to raise her livestock.

Delia has been in this business for five years now, and has borrowed eight times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Delia would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy feeds, vitamins and other supplies to raise her livestock.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is a married woman and has been blessed with three children, all of whom attend school. Together with her husband, they live at their own house that has neither electricity nor piped water.

She has operated a fish-selling business for over 10 years, selling from home to restaurant operators and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality and perishability leading to losses.

With the Kshs 50,000, she wants to purchase bundles of fish to sell.

She dreams of expanding her business and establishing another business in the near future.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of fish to sell.

loans.name: Catarina

texts.es:
Catarina es una señorita de 31 años de edad, ella vive en una comunidad de San Antonio junto a sus padres y hermanos.
Catarina es una mujer amable, por ser una mujer sin compromisos ella está en toda la disponibilidad de trabajar en beneficio de su familia, Catarina con el apoyo de sus padres y hermanos, trabaja muy duro para obtener sus ingresos y satisfacer las necesidades de su familia.  A Dios gracias con el préstamo anterior le fue muy bien, porque ahora ya construyo un cuarto  y se encuentra muy satisfecha por este logro. Catarina es una muchacha muy carismática que ha logrado retener a muchos clientes con su negocio de venta de frutas y con el paso de los años, su negocio tiene mucha demanda, es por ello que solicita otro préstamo para realizar una nueva inversión comprando una variedad de frutas para poder embolsarlos y venderlos.
Catarina además de trabajar  vendiendo frutas, en sus horas libres ella se dedica a la elaboración de ropa típica y esta es otra fuente de ingresos que ella tiene. Catarina está muy segura en conseguir su préstamo para la nueva inversión y seguir construyendo una mejor casa para su familia.
texts.en:
Catarina, age 31, lives with her parents and siblings in a community in San Antonio. Catarina is a kind woman. Because she does not have a romantic committment, she is available to work for the benefit of her family. With the support of her parents and siblings, she works very hard in order to get earnings and meet the family's needs.

Thanks to God, the previous loan went very well for her. She built a room, and she is very happy with this accomplishment.

Catarina is a very charismatic girl, who has managed to retain a lot of customers with her business of selling fruit. As the years pass her business has a lot of demand. That is why she is requesting another loan to make a new investment by purchasing a variety of fruit to be able to bag and sell.

In addition to working selling fruit, she makes typical clothing in her free time. This is another source of income that she has.

Catarina is quite sure about getting the new loan to invest and continuing to build a better house for her family.

loans.use: to buy fruit.

loans.name: Esteban

texts.es:
Esteban es un hombre que lucha cada día para llevar lo necesario a su familia, vive en una comunidad de Sololá, de 44 años de edad.

Este señor es agricultor, él tiene experiencia sobre este trabajo, pero el problema que tenía era que no contaba con capital de trabajo, gracias a los préstamos que se le ha dado en ADICLA ha logrado incrementar su cultivo, con el poco capital que contaba el cultiva muy poco, pero después de los préstamos cultiva mucho más y a Dios gracias a logrado venderlos en el mercado regional, pero él no está convencido con el avance que ha tenido, él está ahora buscando otro préstamo para comprar sus semillas de cebolla y abono químico para poder cultivar en esta temporada.
El gran sueño de Esteban es poder comprar más terrenos para seguir incrementado su cultivo y con ello sus ingresos.
texts.en:
Esteban struggles every day to bring his family the necessities. He lives in a community in Sololá. He is 44 years old, and he is a farmer. He has experience in this work.

However, the problem that he had was that he did not have working capital. Thanks to the loans from ADICLA, he has managed to increase his crop. With the little money he had he grew very little. However, after the loans he now grows much more. Thank God he has managed to sell the crops at the regional market.

However, he is not satisfied with the progress he has made. He is now seeking another loan to buy onion seeds and chemical fertilizer to be able to cultivate this season. Esteban's big dream is to be able to buy more land in order to continue increasing his crops and, with that, his income.

loans.use: to buy onion seeds and chemical fertilizer.

loans.name: Kahonzi

texts.en:
Kahonzi is a married woman with four children whom all attend school. She owns a house that neither has electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food and school fees.
She has operated a cafe business for the past six years selling food to the neighbours. She mentioned seasonality in her place of operation. With the loan she is requesting she wants to purchase tables,chairs and new utensils for her business. She decided to join yehu to access loans and boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase tables,chairs and new utensils for her business

loans.name: Caroline

texts.en:
Caroline is 23 years old, married to John and supporting three children aged four, two, and four months old. She runs a retail shop in Kamatargui village and has been in this business for over two years earning a monthly income of KES.26,000.

She is borrowing a loan of KES.30,000 from Vision and as her first loan she intends to purchase sugar, bar soaps, salt and rice for her shop.

She plans to use the anticipated profits from her business to save and repay her loan on time. Her dreams are to lead a sustainable healthy life.

loans.use: to purchase sugar, bar soaps, salt and rice for her shop.

loans.name: Gichuru

texts.en:
Gichuru is a married man with three children, all of whom attends school. He lives at his own house that neither has electricity nor piped water.

He has operated a retail shop business for the past seven years, selling household consumables like wheat flour, maize flour, and sugar. He faces a major challenge of creditors staying for long to repay for goods taken on credit.

With the loan he wants to purchase stock of sugar, rice, maize flour and wheat flour. He decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost his business.

loans.use: to purchase stock of sugar, rice, maize flour and wheat flour.

loans.name: Santos

texts.es:
Santos es un hombre de 39 años de edad, es soltero y vive muy feliz mente con su querida familia en una comunidad de Sololá.
Santos es un agricultor con muchos años de experiencia y a Dios gracias con esta labor ha logrado sacar adelante a su familia, el antes no contaba con el capital suficiente para poder cultivar un poco más, pero afortunadamente con el préstamo anterior  le fue muy  bien porque logro una muy buena cosecha por lo que pudo venderlo a un bonito precio en su mercado regional, con esta superación él no está conforme, es el motivo por el cual solicita un nuevo préstamo para poder comprar semillas y abono químico, orgánico para poder incrementar su cultivo.
El gran sueño de Santos es poder comprar más terreno para incrementar el volumen de su cultivo y con ello darle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Santos, age 39, is single. He lives happily with his dear family in a community in Sololá. Santos is a farmer with many years of experience. He has managed to get his family ahead with this work, thank God. He previously did not have enough money to be able to grow a little more. Fortunately, the previous loan went very well for him. He managed to get a good harvest that he was able to sell for a nice price at the regional market.

He is not satisfied with this improvement. That is the reason that he is requesting a new loan to be able to buy seeds and chemical and organic fertilizer to be able to increase his crops. Santos's big dream is to be able to buy more land in order to increase the volume of his crops. With this he will give his family a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy seeds and chemical fertilizer for his crops.

loans.name: Arlene

texts.en:
Arlene is 44 years old and married with seven children. With three children in school, Arlene works very hard to provide for them.

Arlene runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like bread, dried fish, home product care, and other groceries.

Arlene has been in this business for 14 years.

In the future, Arlene would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like bread, dried fish, home product care, and other groceries

loans.name: Ruby

texts.en:
Ruby is 38 years old and married with two children. With two children in school, Ruby works very hard to provide for them.

Ruby runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 14,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like beverages, bread, canned goods, and other groceries.

Ruby has been in this business for 10 years now.

In the future, Ruby would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like beverages, bread, canned goods, and other groceries

loans.name: Tsogjavkhlan

texts.en:
Mrs. Tsogjavkhlan, 47 years old, lives with her son in Ulaanbaatar, capital city of Mongolia. She has been working as sales manager at a private company since 2011. Her son is second year student at university. Using her previous loan, she has paid her son's tuition fee so that her son can study hard without worrying. 

This time she is requesting a loan of 4000000 MNT to buy insulation materials such as foam, fiberglass and vacuum insulated windows in order to insulate her house's walls and doors. By doing so will allow she and her son to live in comfortable and warm place where less coal is burned, releasing less pollutant into air.

loans.use: to insulate her house's walls and doors

loans.name: Purity

texts.en: Purity is a single woman with no children. She lives in a rental house that has electricity but no piped water. She has operated a retail shop business for the past three years, selling household consumables like wheat flour, maize flour, and sugar. She faces a major challenge of creditors staying for long to repay for goods taken on credit. With the loan, she wants to purchase stocks of sugar, rice, maize flour, and wheat flour. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase stocks of sugar, rice, maize flour, and wheat flour.

loans.name: Abadahemukirana Sub Group

texts.en: Beatha is a 31-year-old group leader. She is married with two children between two and eight years old. Both of them go to school. The group is called ABADAHEMUKIRANA, which means, “The important people”, in English. They sell different products and they wish to expand their business in order to create a better future for themselves. She is a tailor and has been working in the business for nine years. With the loan, she would like to buy more clothes for tailoring. The profits from the business will be used to pay her children's school fees and to pay medical insurance.

loans.use: to buy more clothes for tailoring

loans.name: Rowelyn

texts.en:
Rowelyn is 31 years old and has two children. Rowelyn is married and her two children are in school.

Rowelyn is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. Rowelyn requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed, vitamins, and other supplies to raise her livestock.

Rowelyn has been in this business for five years now, and she has borrowed nine times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Rowelyn would like to save enough money so that she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed, vitamins, and other supplies to raise her livestock

loans.name: Primitiva

texts.en:
Primitiva is 62 years old with four children. With one child in school, Primitiva works very hard to provide for them.

Primitiva runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell such as rice, condiments, beverages, home care products and groceries.

Primitiva has been in this business for three years. 

In the future, Primitiva would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like rice, condiments, beverages, home care products and groceries

loans.name: Alma

texts.en:
Alma is a married woman with five children. Alma is 41 years old and three of her children are in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur.

Alma has a peanut business in the Philippines. Alma requested a PHP 5,000 loan through NWTF to buy more peanuts and ingredients for her food production business.

Alma has been in this business for eight years. In the future, Alma would like to save enough money so that she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more peanuts and ingredients for her food production business

loans.name: Sulaiman

texts.en:
Sulaiman is a 37-year-old married man from Rafah city, which is located in the Gaza Strip and suffers from power outages 12-16 hours a day regularly. He lives with his family in a small house. As an employee in the public sector, he earns a low income. This income barely covers all the family's needs.

Because he is not able to save enough money, Sulaiman took a USD loan from FATEN. With this loan, he will buy a solar system for heating water for the family house. Palestinians use water boilers that use either gas or gasoline to heat the water before a shower, which can be dangerous, expensive and inefficient. This will help him to provide hot water without using electricity, which is much more expensive

loans.use: he will buy a solar system for heating water for the family house.

loans.name: Nader

texts.en:
Nader is a 21-years-old single man from Rafah city. He lives with his family in a simple house. Nader works as an employee in a local company where he gets a low income. He would like to improve the family living conditions and buy some necessary things.

Nader took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to buy a water purification machine for the family house. by taking this loan, Nader will be able to provide clean water for his family.
Nader appears in the photo

loans.use: to buy a water purification machine for the family house.

loans.name: Dolores

texts.en:
For twenty years now, Dolores shows her dedication as member of CCT Credit Cooperative in Tigbauan, Iloilo. In fact she is the current Fellowship* Coordinator who is responsible in gathering her co-fellowship members and ensuring that their savings and loan payments are collected on time.  This is where she gets some tips on how to manage her dressmaking shop and variety store business. She produces various clothes such as school and office uniforms, blouses, skirts and dresses. At the same time, her store sells usual commodities such as toiletries, canned goods, snack items, repacked condiments, and many more. She works hard in order to supplement their lacking financial resources because her husband’s irregular income as driver doesn’t suffice for their growing expenses. 

She aims to expand her dressmaking shop by procuring additional cloths and fabrics, threads, and accessories like buttons, hooks, zippers and others. She will also buy more supplies of groceries and beverages for her store. She is requesting for PhP 25,000 loan to address this need.

She gives importance to happiness and peace among her family members. She regularly meets with her co-fellowship members every week to share stories of her life and business and to draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God.

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to buy additional cloths and fabrics, threads, and accessories like buttons, hooks, zippers and others

loans.name: Twekulakulanye Nakasero Group

texts.en:
Moses is a motorcycle(boda boda) cyclist who ferries his clients to and from the city center for a fee. He is currently facing challenges of the motorcycle breaking down often, which affects his work schedule, since he spends a lot of time in the garage each time it breaks down. 

He has applied for a loan of ugx500,00 to service his motorcycle, as this will help to increase his efficiency and effectiveness.

Moses is very grateful for the support Ugafode microfinance and Kiva lenders offered since he is now able to fund his business.
The first lady on the extreme left is the UGAFODE credit staff in charge of the group.

loans.use: to service his bodaboda (motorcycle taxi)

loans.name: Amina

texts.en:
Amina is a married woman and a mother of one child who attends school. She owns a house that neither has electricity nor piped water.

She sells fruits and green vegetables. She always struggles to improve her grocery stall, trying to sell more and save money in order to have a more formal establishment. She faces a major challenge of seasonality and transportation in her business.

Amina is requesting a loan to purchase sacks of fruits and green vegetables for resale.She decided to join Yehu to access loan and boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of fruits and green vegetables for resale

loans.name: Freedom 1 Group

texts.en:
The Freedom 1 Group will start its ninth cycle with ID Ghana as a part of the branch loan system. This group is made up of six members and is led by Gladys. The members of this group are in charge of various types of businesses. Among them are firewood, drinks, rubber bowls, silver products, soaps, and smoked-fish businesses.

The loan that they will take out will benefit small micro-enterprises of which Gladys is a member. She mentions that she joined ID Ghana by invitation from a friend, who is a client of the institution. 

Currently, Gladys has a business selling firewood. She started this business 30 years ago and has been doing it until now. The loan that she will take out is to increase capital. She will buy more firewood from the wholesalers in the city of Accra and she will sell it to her customers. This kind of job allows her to generate the necessary resources to support herself economically since she is single and all of her children are grown up. This is her second loan from Kiva.

When asked if she likes ID Ghana, she responded that she likes the training that the institution provides.

loans.use: To buy more firewood from the wholesalers in the city of Accra which she will sell to her customers.

loans.name: Mjeni

texts.en:
Mjeni is married woman with three children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees. 

For the past three years, she has operated a cereals-shop business, selling to her neighbours and passersby. She mentioned seasonality and theft as her major challenges. Mjeni dreams of establishing a wholesale shop in the future.

With the KES 30,000, she wants to purchase maize flour, rice, beans, and cooking fat oil. 

She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase maize flour, rice, beans, and cooking fat oil

loans.name: Muhibjon

texts.ru: Мухибчон житель города Душанбе. Он шустрый и заботливый парень. Мухибчону 23 лет и он женат. После окончание средней школы из-за финансовых проблем он не смог поступить в университет и решил помочь родителям. Он получил водительские права и начал работать таксистом. Он улучшил жизненные условии семьи и помог родителям. К тому же Мухибчон отремонтировал свой дом. Все это благодаря его работе. К сожалению, в данный момент его машина нуждается в ремонте и у Мухибчона не хватает денег на покупку запасных частей автомобиля. Мухибчон просит ему помочь, чтобы не потерять источник своего дохода. Он надеется, что ему не откажут.
texts.en:
Muhibjon is a resident of Dushanbe. He is an active and caring young man. He is 23 years old, married. Because of his family's financial situation, he couldn't enter the university after high school. Instead, he decided to help his parents.

Muhibjon got his driver's license and started working as a taxi driverwhich also enabled him to renovate his house. Unfortunately, Muhibjon's car is in need of repairs, but he doesn't have enough money to buy the spare parts. Muhibjon is asking for help not to lose his source of income. He is hoping, you won't let him down.

loans.use: To buy the spare parts for his car

loans.name: Carolyn

texts.en:
Carolyn is from Tawi-Tawi, Aloran-Oroquieta City, Misamis Occidental. She is 48 years of age and has 3 school-age kids. She joined Paglaum MPC and she appreciates the programs and services of the said co-op. 

From her desire to help the family, she engaged in selling fish in different barangays in municipality of Tawi-Tawi, Aloran-Oroquieta City, Misamis Occidental. Only the motorcycle of her husband was used as her source of transportation to reached the different barangays and sell fish. Her source of income existed for 13 years now. 

In need of additional working capital, she requested a financial assistance from Paglaum MPC an amount of Php 10,000.00 to purchase more stocks of fish. Through this, she hopes to increase and/or has more income for she is able to provide for the daily needs of her family and also she is happy she can support the education of her children which is her main priority of her hardship.

loans.use: to purchase more stocks of fish for selling

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane has started her small time business and became a boss with her sari-sari store. She has manage to have enough inventories and rolls up her capital to gain more profit. Everyday she made good sales since she is the only store in their barangay.

 Recently she approached Paglaum for her much needed capital to restock store with basic commodities. In the future, she hopes to have a decent home for the family.

loans.use: to restock her store with basic commodities like canned goods, oil, soy sauce

loans.name: Gina

texts.en:
Gina  is engaged in running a mini-grocery store. She has been operating her business for 5 years and earns a monthly net income of 10,500 PHP. Edena is 48 years old, married and has 2 school-aged kids. She is from Tudela, Misamis Occidental. In 2011, Gina joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Gina has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used for personal purposes. 

Gina is requesting her 9th loan of 14,900 PHP to purchase rice seeds will have good results in healthier, heavier, and potentially higher-yielding seedlings.

loans.use: to purchase rice seeds will have good results in healthier, heavier, and potentially higher-yielding seedlings

loans.name: Gunadi

texts.en:
Gunadi is an artisan from Indonesia who specializes in wood batik centerpieces and ornaments. He would like to invest in a purchase of raw materials, including batik cloth and carved wood.

Gunadi has been selling through NOVICA since 2012. This is his story:

"I was born in 1981 in a village near Yogyakarta, a city which is rich in art and culture. In Java, arts and crafts are typically used in custom events and batik art is closely associated with traditional ceremonies. My parents taught me about working hard to follow my dreams and to always think positive, to be wise and help others. The spirit of an entrepreneur grew within me, and I decided to resign from the company where I worked. The wood batik artisans in my village were unemployed, as the company where they worked was closed. Most of them are women, and I began organizing them. Now, they can work at home and have more time for their families. We work on wood with manual tools for the batik process which is time-consuming. We craft wood batik ornaments, accessories and decor with the best quality we can, and incorporate our traditional batik culture into our designs. I hope people around the world will know better about us and our Javanese batik culture"

"Right now I need some capital to increase my inventory. I hand paint batik on wood using wax and a coloring process that requires time and patience. Your support will help to sustain our craft."

Use the link below to view Gunadi's wood batik centerpieces and ornaments on the NOVICA site:
<a href="http://www.novica.com/kiva/8787">http://www.novica.com/kiva/8787

loans.use: to invest in a purchase of raw materials

loans.name: Zamukamunyarwanda Group

texts.en:
Felecite is a group leader; aged 56 years.She is married with 6 children aged between 22 and 30 years. The group is called ZAMUKAMUNYARWANDA means “Raise up ” in English. They sell different products and they wish to expand their business for changing their better future. 

She has a shop and has been running in a business for 15 years. With the loan, she would like to buy more rice, sugar, biscuits and juice for sale. The profits from the business will be used to improve her standards of living and to pay school fees of her children.

loans.use: to buy more rice, sugar, biscuits and juice for sale.

loans.name: Abdulsamadu

texts.en:
Abdulsamadu is a Babban Gona maize farmer from Barau Village. Abdulsamadu joined Babban Gona to improve the lives of his family and children. Since joining Babban Gona, he no longer has to worry about having inadequate income to purchase better inputs to improve his yields. Through Babban Gona’s input loan, Abdulsamadu will have access to high quality farm inputs such as fertilizers, herbicides and improved seeds that will help him earn yields of up to 30 bags of maize/ hectare, double the national average of 14 bags/hectare. 

This year, Abdulsamadu has set high goals of harvesting 40 bags of maize. With increased yields and incomes, Abdulsamadu has made it his ultimate goal to provide employment to members of his community through his farm.

loans.use: : To purchase improved farm inputs that will increase farmer’s yields

loans.name: Armando

texts.en:
Armando is a business owner who lives in Puebla with his partner. Armando recently invested money to have his own food stall where he sells seafood and fish. He believes this is a great opportunity and works hard everyday to make it a successful business. Armando wanted to create something of his own to be able to provide to his family in the years to come. Today his children are young, but soon they will grow and he wishes to give them opportunities he never had. 

Armando and his partner have saved and built what today they call their home. There are still many things that need to be done to provide a proper and safe home. What is most important is building a proper roof that will help them keep the house cooler in summer and warmer in winter. The tin roof they have today is made of old materials that are rusty and present some serious health threats to all the family. 

Armando is asking for a loan to buy the materials needed. He has no access to credit from other organizations given the informality of his job and the low income he gains. Armando will receive supervision from certified technicians that will help oversee the construction and certifies it meets safety and quality standards. Armando is thankful and excited about this great opportunity.

loans.use: to replace the tin roof with a proper roof and provide a safe home for his family

loans.name: Alba Nelly

texts.es: Alba es una señora muy trabajadora, ella se dedica a la crianza de chanchos desde hace 20 años atrás, Alba tiene 38 años de edad, vive con su esposo que trabaja de guardia y con sus 3 hijos de 11, 16 y 18 años de edad que se encuentran estudiando, Alba va a invertir el crédito en la compra de chanchos para incrementar en sus chancheras, Alba aspira que su negocio progrese para mejorar sus ingresos y cubrir los gastos de educación de sus hijos y que en un futuro lleguen a tener un título universitario.
texts.en: Alba is a very hard-working woman. She has worked raising pigs for 20 years. Alba is 38 years old and lives with her husband who works as a guard and her three children aged 11, 16 and 18 years old who are studying. Alba will invest the loan in the purchase of pigs to expand her pig business. Alba hopes her business progresses in order to improve her income and cover the costs of her children's education so that in the future they can obtain a university degree.

loans.use: to buy pigs.

loans.name: Antonio

texts.en:
Antonio works as a farmer in Puebla. He has been doing the same job for the past 41 years. He is very proud of his work and the opportunities he has been able to give to his kids, especially education. Antonio was taken at out school in third grade so he could go to the fields to help his dad. He worked hard to provide for his family and to help them to avoid similar situations, and managed to give his children an opportunity to study all through high school. Now, his children have their own land and families. 

Although now Antonio lives only with his wife, he wants to replace the broken tile roof that they have with a proper cement roof. This is mainly because his wife has come down with a respiratory illness and the wind gusts and cold wind do not help with her condition. Antonio wants to do this as a way to thank his life partner for everything she has worked and sacrificed for her family. Due to the informality of his job and age, Antonio is not able to get a credit from other institutions. 

Antonio will receive supervision from certified technicians who will make sure the construction meets all quality and safety standards.

loans.use: to put a proper roof on his home in order to help his wife with her recovery from a respiratory illness.

loans.name: Alicia

texts.en:
With the previous loan, Alicia built the foundations and the first steps for her new house. She chose to invest in that work so that whatever she builds on top will last a lifetime. With this loan, she wishes to continue with the construction of the house, specifically building the walls and columns for the home. This will help bring structure to the house and provide a temporary shelter. 

Alicia knows there are still more stages ahead until she can complete the house, but she is excited about moving towards this second step.

loans.use: to buy materials for building the walls of her new house.

loans.name: Monica Alexandra

texts.es: Mónica es soltera y tiene una hija de 6 años de edad que se encuentra asistiendo a la escuela, Mónica tiene 25 años de edad, vive con su hija y con sus padres, cuenta Mónica que sus padres se dedican a la ganadería y que es de ahí que a ella le inculcaron a dedicarse a esta actividad, el crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de una vaca para cuidarla y obtener ingresos de la leche, Mónica dice que aspira trabajar duro para bienestar de su hija.
texts.en: Mónica is single and has a 6 year old daughter who goes to school. Mónica is 25 years old and lives with her daughter and her parents. Mónica says that her parents work raising livestock and this is how she learned to work in this business. The loan will be used to buy a cow to raise and obtain money from the milk. Mónica says that she aspires to work hard for the well-being of her daughter.

loans.use: to buy a cow.

loans.name: Adom Wood Carvers Group

texts.en:
Veronica is 39 years of age. She is from Ajumako in the Ajumako District of the Central Region of Ghana.Veronica is the leader and group representative of Adom Wood Carvers. She is married with 3 children. All the 3 children are in school. Their ages are 4, 10 and 22. 

Veronica is a wood carver with 15years of working experience. She sells her wood artifacts in the local market. She is aiming to expand her business by possessing a wholesale shop of wood artifact in the next 5 years. Veronica also grows plantain, maize and cassava as other source of income to support the family. She has been with the field partner for 2 years and has a good repayment records. 

Veronica needs micro loan support to buy more wood for carving and polish for finishing. This will enable her meet the demand from tourist and local customers. Veronica planned to use part of the income generated from sales to support the husband to cater for their children and the remaining will be reinvested into her business. She thanks all her Kiva lenders for their kind financial support.

loans.use: To buy wood for carving and polish for finishing.

loans.name: Pedro

texts.en:
Pedro is an artisan from Guatemala who specializes in silver and gemstone jewelry. He would like to invest in a bulk purchase of silver.

Pedro has been selling through NOVICA since 2011. This is his story:

"When I was 20, I began working in a silver workshop and my passion for making handcrafted jewelry was born. I specialized in engraving silver and have had my own workshop since 1980; it's a simple place, but I have all the tools and space I need to work. We am very grateful for this wonderful opportunity for me and my artisan community in Guatemala."

"Many thanks to everyone who supports me through this microcredit and allows me to continue creating.

Use the link below to view Pedro's silver and gemstone jewelry on the NOVICA site:
<a href="http://www.novica.com/kiva/8193">http://www.novica.com/kiva/8193

loans.use: to invest in a bulk purchase of silver

loans.name: Abadahemukirana Group

texts.en:
ABADAHEMUKIRANA a group led by Didacienne who is 27 years old. The group name means “the Important” in English. She is married with 1 child aged 5 years. She sells clothes and has been doing in a business for the past 4 years. 

The group members sell different items and they have same idea for changing their life. With the loan, she would like to buy more shirts and shorts for selling. The profits from the business will be used to renovate her house and make savings.

loans.use: to buy more shirts and shorts for selling

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en:
Victoria is a married woman with one child which attends school. She lives in a rental house that has electricity but no piped water. Her monthly expense is food
She has operated a printing business for the past five years operating as a retail outlet .She mentioned her machine breaking down as a major challenge in her business.
With the loan she is requesting she wants to purchase a new printer to use in her business.She decided to join Yehu to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase a new printer to use in her business

loans.name: Adamu

texts.en:
Adamu is a Babban Gona maize farmer from Wambai Village. Adamu joined Babban Gona to create a better life for his children.  In the past, Adamu suffered from poor yields that crippled his ability to feed his family and children. Now that he has joined Babban Gona, Adamu has the chance to attain yields of up to 30 bags of maize/hectare, double the national average in Nigeria and earn an income of up to $2,000/hectare. 

Through Babban Gona’s input loan, he will have access to high-quality farm inputs such as fertilizers, herbicides, and improved seeds that will increase his yields and income considerably. Thanks to the support of Babban Gona, Adamu can now ensure that his children get a post secondary school education.

loans.use: To purchase improved farm inputs that will increase farmer’s yields

loans.name: Javzandulam

texts.en:
Mrs. Javzandulam is one of our institution's most trustworthy clients and used her previous loan for repairing the truck her husband uses for transportation. She works as cook at restaurant. She and her husband have two children both studying at university. 

This time, she is requesting a loan of 4000000 MNT to build a greenhouse on her land in order to grow vegetables such as carrots, cucumbers and potatoes. By doing so her family will save money on vegetables from supermarket and even sell the surplus at low price to local people. 

The borrower is very hardworking woman who strives for a better future.

loans.use: to build a greenhouse in order to grow vegetables

loans.name: Leonardo

texts.en:
Leonardo is a happy married man and he lives in his parents' house.

Leonardo is a good sewer and he makes jackets. Leonardo is 44 years old and now he is working for the city hall making some uniforms.

Leonardo needs a loan to buy fabrics because he needs to increase the production of the uniforms for the city hall. This is a great chance for him, so he hopes you can help him again. He is healthy and his family is ok.

loans.use: to buy fabrics

loans.name: Fazil

texts.en:
Fazil is 46 year old, married with 3 children and is a refugee. Fazil is a farmer.  He doesn’t earn enough money as his wife doesn’t work. 

He is really a hardworking and skilled person. Fazil has 5 years of experience on his farm.

He needs to buy new equipment and natural herbal fertilizers. He wants to grow more seeds and improve his own business. For all this he needs Kiva Lenders support.

loans.use: to buy new equipment and natural herbal fertilizers

loans.name: Gulchehra

texts.ru: Гулчехра 47-летняя замужняя женщина. Она проживает в районе Рудаки и занимается шитьем женских платьев. В этой сфере она имеет 20 лет опыта работы. К тому же она, научив своих дочерей этому ремеслу, они стараются помогать и поддерживать её. Гулчехра имеет хороший доход, однако в данный момент этого не недостаточно, так как ей срочно нужно купить дочке приданное и сыграть свадьбу. Гулчехра видит единственный выход в получении кредита. Она надеется, что ее поддержат в нужную минуту и обещает, что будет выплачивать кредит во время. Гулчехра заранее благодарит Вас.
texts.en:
Gulchehra is a 47-year-old woman living in the Rudaki district. She is sewing women's clothes for a living. She has an experience of 20 years in this field. She also taught her daughters to sew and now they are trying to support Gulchehra with this work. 

Gulchehra makes a decent living from sewing, but at the moment her earnings are not enough to buy dowry for her daughter and pay the wedding expenses. The only way out, to Gulchehra's mind, is requesting a loan. She is hoping for your support at this difficult time and promises to repay the loan on time. She is grateful in advance!

loans.use: to buy dowry for her daughter and organize the wedding

loans.name: Esperanza

texts.en:
Esperanza is 46 years old.  She is married, has 3 kids and she is living at her parents' house. Her husband is working in another country.

Esperanza sells vegetables such as carrots and lettuce. She goes to many places and markets to sell her production. She is a good farmer and she learned with her mother.

She needs a loan to buy seeds for her business. Esperanza is healthy, she works hard and she would like to have her own house and to be with her husband in the future.

loans.use: to buy seeds

loans.name: Nuria Aracely

texts.es: Nuria es una mujer trabajadora de 38 años de edad que vive en casa de su propiedad, en compañía de su hija de 15 años de edad a la que ha logrado sacar adelante como madre soltera. Nuria cada día muestra su tenacidad, ya que desde hace varios años se dedica a prestar sus servicios en una finca aledaña, en la cual realiza trabajos de limpieza en sembradíos, poda de árboles, siembra entre otros. En la vivienda en la que Nuria habita cada invierno ingresa la lluvia debido a lo deteriorado de su techo, es por ello que ella solicita un crédito a FUSAI para comprar: lámina galvanizada, madera y clavos para mejorar el techo y proteger a su hija que es lo más importante para ella.
texts.en:
Nuria is a hard working 38 year old woman. She lives in a house that she owns with her 15 year old daughter who she has manged to raise as a single mother. Nuria demonstrates her tenacity every day as for a number of years she has worked on a neighboring farm where she cleans the fields, prunes trees, plants seeds amongst others.

In the house where Nuria lives water comes in during the winter because of the poor condition of the roof. So she is requesting a loan from FUSAI to buy galvanized laminate, wood and nails to improve her roof and protect her daughter which is what is most important for her.

loans.use: to buy galvanized laminate, wood and nails to improve her roof and protect her daughter which is what is most important for her.

loans.name: Anwar

texts.en:
Anwar is a 42-years-old married man from Rafah city. He lives with his wife and four kids in a simple house. Anwar works as an employee in a local company where he gets a low income. This is the only source of income to the family. He would like to improve the family living conditions and buy some necessary things.

Anwar took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to buy a water purification machine for the family house. by taking this loan, Anwar will be able to provide clean water especially for his kids.
Anwar appears in the photo

loans.use: to buy a water purification machine for the family house.

loans.name: Vannak

texts.en:
Vannak, 31, is originally from Kampong Cham Province, Cambodia. She has four children. To make a living, she manages and operates a farming business in a small farmland, primarily grows rice and sells her agricultural product to local dealers and customer at the market. She has been in this type of business for around ten years. On average, she is able to make an earning of USD 3.00 a day. 

She is residing a little bit far from the water source so it is hard and time consuming for her to get water. Due to this reason, she is applying for a Kiva loan to dig a well for household use.  With the supporting of this loan, she hopes that she can get the water to use easier and spent shorter time that before. She is thankful for the lenders for their financial support towards poor people.

loans.use: to dig a well

loans.name: Nenita

texts.en: Nenita thought she was in the right place when she joined the microfinance group PMPC. She decided to give it a try after she learned that she can avail financial assistance for her chosen business. Nenita has maintained her membership in good standing without records of default up to this day. She has taken several loans and all were paid in a timely manner. Recently, she availed a loan to purchase farm inputs and fertilizers for her farming business. Nenita wishes to continuously manage her business more effectively with the support of her family.

loans.use: to purchase farm inputs and fertilizer

loans.name: Mari Jime

texts.en:
Mari Jime is 38 years old, married, and lives in Tudela, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. In order to earn a living, she takes in and raises pigs from her neighborhood. The piglets' owners share in the profits upon the sale of the piglets, which is divided 60/40 or 70/30 depending on their agreement.  

With a desire to earn more, she decided to raise pigs on her own as well. Through PMPC, she obtained the capital to purchase her own piglets and feed. Now, she requests a loan of 2,000 PHP to buy additional feed. She really hopes and prays that her business will grow and benefit her family, in addition to the income of her husband. Someday, she wants to build a concrete pig cage to easily keep them in more sanitary conditions.

loans.use: to buy additional bags of feed

loans.name: Mueni

texts.en:
Mueni is a married woman with 6 children. She operates a retail business where she sells eggs. She has been involved in this business for 6 years. Her business is located in an area with potential and her primary customers are locals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be transportation. 
She will use the Kes 40,000 loan to buy more stocks of eggs. She hopes that in the future, she will educate her children. 

This is her fifth loan with SMEP Microfinance bank. Previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: buy more stock of eggs

loans.name: Yasser

texts.en: Yasser is 27 years old, married, and has one child. He has a small electric devices business. He previously requested a 5000 EGP loan from Together Association for Development and Environment and successfully repaid it on the due dates. He is requesting a 10,000 EGP loan to buy more electronic devices such as LCDs, kitchen appliances, and irons to generate more income for his family.

loans.use: To buy electronic devices such as LCDs, kitchen appliances, and irons.

loans.name: Catalina

texts.en:
Catalina lives in Puebla with her husband and one daughter. Catalina and his family have lived in this house for around 23 years. What they have today is the product of their hard work and years of building.

Catalina wants to build a proper roof for her house. They currently have a tin roof which makes the house extremely hot in summer and really cold in winter. These roof also allows wind and rain to come into the house. She is worried about the health of her grandson and thus is asking for a credit to buy the materials needed to build a proper roof. 

Catalina works selling Mexican food at a stall at the local market. Due to the informality of her job, her age and her low income she is not able to get a credit from other organization or institution. Catalina is excited about this opportunity because this means she can provide safety to her daughter and grandson during the next rainy season.

loans.use: to build a roof on her house that will provide safety and better conditions for her family, especially her grandson

loans.name: Rosell

texts.en:
Rosell is a married woman with seven children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Rosell is 43 years old and has five children who are in school.

Rosell has a general store business in the Philippines. Rosell requested a PHP 15,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell.

Rosell has been in this business for 16 years. In the future, Rosell would like to save enough money to expand her business and continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Ali

texts.en: Ali, 53, is married with seven sons. He has a small business raising cattle, which is the only source of income to the family. He is requesting a 10,000 EGP loan to buy a head of cattle to allow his wife and daughter to make more cheese and butter for domestic use and for sale in the local market. He believes the income from the business will enable him to help his sons with their marriage expenses.

loans.use: To buy a head of cattle.

loans.name: Abdelazim

texts.en: Abdelazim, 27, is married and has three children. He owns a small store selling toilets, sinks, and bathtubs. He takes care of his aging parents, who have no source of income. Abdelazim previously requested a 5000 EGP loan and successfully repaid it on the due dates. He is requesting a 10,000 EGP loan to buy modern sinks, toilets, and bathtubs to sell in his store to generate more income for his family.

loans.use: To buy modern sinks, toilets and bathtubs to sell.

loans.name: Fely

texts.en: Fely learned about PMPC and the financial assistance it gives. As a farmer in Tambulig-Molave, Zamboanga del Sur, she tried her luck and borrowed a loan to jump start her corn production. After several months, she was able to return her borrowed capital. To this day, Fely feels she owes her good fortune to PMPC for having trusted her with the money she used in her business. Recently, she availed a loan to purchase farm inputs and fertilizer for the next cropping season. Fely wishes to sustain her business and be able to supply corn in the neighboring towns.

loans.use: to purchase farm inputs and fertilizer

loans.name: Gregoria

texts.en:
Gregoria is engaged in running a grocery store. She has been operating her business for five years and earns a monthly net income of 5,200 PHP. Gregoria is 62 years old, married, and has three adult-aged children. 

Gregoria has successfully repaid a previous loan of 2,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used for personal purposes. Gregoria is requesting her eighth loan of 3,000 PHP, which will be used for her rice production business. She wants to purchase rice seeds that will result in healthier, heavier, and potentially higher-yielding seedlings.

loans.use: to purchase rice seeds

loans.name: Oscar

texts.en:
Oscar is a 24-year-old man. He is single and has no children. He makes a living working as a supervisor for a bank call center, and he has been working there since 2011.

Oscar is asking for 25,000 MXN to change the roof on his house. He wants to change the material to avoid leaks.

loans.use: To make improvements to the roof on his house.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy materials for the kindergarten where she works.

loans.name: Nhung's Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Nhung, is the Thai ethnic woman, has been joining in the program of M7-MFI since January 2013. She is one of the youngest members of her group and she lives with her husband, her son and her daughter in Mai Son district, Son La province.

Her family’s main income is from her civil servant salary, so the income is just enough to cover food for the family and saved a small amount. 

She is studying at a university in the evening. In the next term of studying, she has to pay for the education’s fee but the saved amount is not enough. Therefore, she wants to borrow a loan for this purpose.

She hopes that the loan amount will help her have better condition for studying, then when she graduates, she will have a stable income.

loans.use: to pay for her university fees

loans.name: Diego

texts.en: Diego is 32-year-old man who is married and has one son. Diego makes a living from selling roasted chicken at his own business. He owns two establishments and he is planning to open a new one, but the new establishment needs some improvements. He is asking for a 10,000 MXN loan in order to continue making improvements in order to open the new establishment.

loans.use: to open a new establishment.

loans.name: Lai

texts.en:
