Mrs. Lai is 34 years old, married and has three children, all of them are in school. She works very hard to feed & educate her children. She would like to improve her family’s living standard, especially her children but lack of capital. 

The loan can help her to build a sanitatary latrine and with support from her husband, she is able to repay the loan from her small business.

loans.use: To build a new latrine to improve the health of her family

loans.name: Ihsan

texts.en:
Ihsan is 34 years old, married to a farmer and has one son and baby daughter. She has a small fattening project that she started by a 5,000 EGP loan from TADE which she successfully repaid.

She is requesting a 10,000 EGP loan to buy a head of cattle to get more milk for making cheese and butter for sale in the local market and for domestic use.

loans.use: to buy a head of cattle

loans.name: Lupe

texts.en:
Lupe is a married woman and she is the mother of six children. She has her own house.

Lupe is successful being a landlord at the place where she lives, because she rents some rooms. Lupe is 67 years old and she needs another loan to finish the construction at the place where she lives because the process takes a lot of time and Lupe has to interrupt the work when she doesn't have the money to pay the workers. 

She hopes you can help her again. You can see in the picture the room when she needs the construction work to be done.

loans.use: to finish the construction at the place where she lives.

loans.name: Jose

texts.en:
Jose is 47 years old he is single; he doesn't have children, He lives at a home that belongs to his parents. 

Jose is a shoe maker. He is a good artisan. He works from 8:30 am until 9:00 pm. Jose goes to many fairs to sell the shoes. 

He offers new shoes to his customers and he needs a loan to buy leather that he will use to make men's shoes. Jose hopes you can help him. He works hard and travels to the fairs every weekend.

loans.use: to buy leather that he will use to make men's shoes.

loans.name: Catalina

texts.en:
Catalina is a married woman. She has two children and is still living at her parents-in-law's house because she doesn't have enough savings to move to another place.

Catalina is still selling candy and soft drinks to earn some money. This time, she needs a loan to buy candy and soft drinks for her business. Catalina hopes you can help her again. She has been in this business for a very long time so she knows what to do.

loans.use: to buy candy and soft drinks for resale.

loans.name: The

texts.en:
Mrs. The is a hardworking woman, 29 years old . She lives with her husband and three children in a small house and without a hygienic latrine. Her family’s income is mainly from small business. 

She would like to borrow the loan to build a latrine, which can help to improve the health of her family’s member. With support from her husband, she is able to repay the loan monthly.

loans.use: To build a new latrine to improve the health of her family

loans.name: Eva

texts.en:
Eva landed at a right place for her needed capital when she joined PMPC. She knew this would be her last chance to get back on her feet when went broke after her first business went bad. PMPC to Eva came as a rescue for lending her money when she needed it the most. 

Now, she availed another loan for the next cropping season. She loaned an amount for land and seedbed preparation.  Eva perseveres and always believe to reach her goals to continuously provide for her family.

loans.use: to pay for land and seedbed preparation

loans.name: Harley

texts.en:
Harley has always the enthusiasm of farming. He has cultivated their rice land in Mahayag-Molave, Zamboanga del Sur and has yield good earnings doing this type of work. 

Recently, he applied a loan to pay for land and seedbed preparations. This will ensure that the rice field is ready for planting. Harley knew that he has to get things right to yield more income for this cropping season. In the future, Harley hopes to buy hauling truck for easy transport of produce.

loans.use: to pay for land and seedbed preparations

loans.name: Tuyet

texts.en:
Mrs. Tuyet is a married mother of three children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. She is 25 years old, and all of her children are currently in school. She can cover family’s daily cost and education from husbandry and small business. 

With this loan, she is able to build a hygienic latrine to improve the health of her family’s member, especially the kids.  She has daily income from gardening such as vegetable, chicken and a pig.

loans.use: To build a new latrine to improve the health of her family

loans.name: Solidaria Mujer Bananito Sur Group

texts.es: Solidaria Mujer es un grupo que se organizó para tener financiamiento a travéz de la Fundación en la comunidad rural de Bananito. Lo componen cinco señoras, todas vecinas y se conocen muy bien. Trabajadoras y con muchos deseos de superación personal. Algunas buscan crecer en sus actividades productivas y una de ellas va a iniciar su emprendimiento, con el objetivo de obtener ingresos, asi tener independencia económica y ayudar un poco en su hogar para mejorar la calidad de vida. Ellas salen a vender en su comunidad y en las bananeras la cual es la principal fuente de empleo del lugar. Katerine es una joven con 25 años de edad, madre de tres hijos y vive en unión libre con el padre de ellos. Inició su negocio con la finalidad de ayudar en su hogar, debido a que el salario que percibe su compañero es poco. Es una mujer que se dedica al comercio de productos de catálogos Tupperware, los cuales tiene buena salida y son de excelente calidad, por eso le va muy bien. Además del buen trato y facilidad de pago que le brinda a sus clientes a la hora de entregar y cobrar su mercadería. Sus clientes son la comunidad, maestros, profesores y empleados de bananeras, también familiares. Junto con Katerine hay cuatro socias más que van a invertir su crédito en mercadería por catálogos.
texts.en:
Solidaria Mujer is a group that was organized in the rural community of Bananito, in order to have financing through the Foundation. It comprises five ladies, all of whom are neighbors who know each other very well. They are hardworking, with a great desire to succeed. 

Some of them want to grow their productive activities, and one of them is going to start her business venture, so that she can have economic independence and help a little at home in order to improve the quality of life. They go out to make sales in their community and on the banana plantations that are the principal source of income in the area. 

Katerine, age 25, is the mother of three children. She lives with their father, who is her common-law-husband.  She started her business in order to help at home because her husband's salary is small.

She sells Tupperware products by catalog, which are popular and are of excellent quality, so her business is going very well for her. In addition, she gives her customers good service and easy payment options when she delivers and collects for her merchandise. Her customers are members of the community: teachers, professors, employees of the banana plantations, and also relatives. 

Along with Katerine, there are four more members who are going to invest their loans in catalog merchandise.

loans.use: to purchase Tupperware products.

loans.name: María Guadalupe

texts.es: María tiene 58 años de edad, es madre soltera de dos hijos y vive en el Estado de México. Ella es una profesora jubilada que ante la necesidad de mantener a sus hijos decidió emprender para obtener sus propios ingresos. María se dedica a la venta de materias primas y dulces, ella quiere ampliar su local ofreciendo nuevos productos y más variedad como: refrescos, papas y botanas. . Con un préstamo de MXN 6,000 María podrá ofrecer estos nuevos productos además de poder surtir completamente su negocio. María además de ser una mujer emprendedora también es una persona que se preocupa por el equilibrio en su vida, ella practica zumba y yoga, algo nuevo que le gustaría aprender seria computación, ella sueña con que su negocio le otorgue libertad financiera y pueda vivir tranquila. Ella está muy orgullosa de ser tenaz y persistente, agradece a todas las personas que van a colaborar para ampliar su negocio y asegura que no los defraudara, trabajará con más empeño y está muy comprometida para realizar los pagos en tiempo y forma.
texts.en:
María is 58 years old. She is the single mother of two children and lives in the State of Mexico. She is a retired teacher who given the need to support her children decided to work in business to obtain her own income. María works selling raw materials and sweets. She wants to expand her stand offering new products and more variety such as soft drinks, potatoes and snacks. With a loan of 6,000 MXN María can offer these new products plus stock her business completely.

María besides being an enterprising woman is also a person who is concerned about having balance in her life. She practices zumba dancing and yoga. Something new she wants to learn is using computers.

She dreams that her business will give her financial freedom so that she can live peacefully. She is very proud of being tenacious and persistent. She thanks all the people who are going to help expand her business and assures them that she will not let them down. She will work with more determination and is very committed to making her loan payments on time.

loans.use: to buy soft drinks, potatoes and snacks.

loans.name: Thoi's Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Thoi, 32 years old, is the Thai ethnic woman. Her family consists of four members, including her husband, her daughter and her son. Her family is living in Mai Son district, Son La province.

Her family’s main income is from cultivation and breeding of ducks. Her family has about 8000 square meters of cultivated land for coffee, so the total income from cultivation and breeding after deducting costs is just enough to cover the living expense of the family and saved a small amount. She intends to raise ducks but the saved amount is not enough for her to invest in the breeding. Therefore, she wants to borrow a loan for this purpose.

She hopes that the loan amount will help her family invest in raising ducks effectively. She will work hard to get money to repay the loan for M7-MFI on time.

loans.use: to invest in breeding ducks

loans.name: Vidal

texts.es: Vidal de 40 años de edad que habita en vivienda propia junto a su compañera de vida y sus dos hijos de 12 y 16 años de edad. Él es un hombre muy trabajador que brinda sus servicios como empleado de seguridad en una empresa, es así como genera sus ingresos con los que brinda todos los insumos necesarios a su familia. Vidal utilizo su anterior crédito para reparar una parte de su techo deteriorado de su vivienda además construyo una pila para resguardar el agua a la que le dio prioridad. El desea terminar de cambiar las láminas del techo de su vivienda  que quedo pendiente, porque están un poco deteriorados así poderles brindar más comodidad a su familia, es por eso que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: láminas, tornillos, polines, etc., para mejorar su vivienda.
texts.en:
Vidal is 40 years old. He lives in his own house with his life companion and his two children aged 12 and 16 years old. He is a very hard-working man who works as a security guard in a company. This is how he generates the income to provide the necessities for his family.

Vidal used his last loan to repair part of the deteriorated roof on his house as well as constructing a water basin/washtub to store water which was a priority. He wants to finish changing the laminate sheeting on his roof that still need to be done as they are somewhat deteriorated. Doing this he can provide more comfort to his family. For this reason he is requesting a loan from FUSAI to invest in galvanized laminate, screws, beams and bolts to improve his house.

loans.use: to invest in galvanized laminate, screws, beams and bolts to finish improving his roof and protect his family.

loans.name: Jean Bosco

texts.en:
Jean Bosco is a 23-year-old married father with one child. He has operated a neighborhood market for the past two years. He works everyday from 8 a.m. until 6 p.m. with three other employees. While the work is tough and the hours are long, Jean Bosco is committed to his business so that his child may have good future. Jean Bosco hopes to find further success with his business not only for himself and his family, but also for the families of his employees. 

Jean Bosco has requested a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company to buy various products like: fanta, stationary, sugar, juice, eggs, etc. He hopes that the expanded offerings at his shop will increase his marketability and provide additional foot traffic among his neighbors. With this loan, he will earn more profits which will allow him to keep reinvesting for better financial stability, as well as pay his child's medical insurance and hopefully a plot of land. Over the next five years, as his business continues to grow, Jean Bosco hopes to earn enough money to have a big store.

loans.use: To purchase new inventory and offerings, such as sugar, stationary, fanta etc. for his general store.

loans.name: Dusasirane Group

texts.en: Gaudelive is 44 years old and is married with four children. For the past five years, she has owned and operated a business selling sorghum, maize and beans business. Due to the success of her business and her experience paying back loans with VFC, Gaudelive has been nominated as the leader of DUSASIRANE group. In the picture of the group, Gaudelive is the individual holding paper. A typical day for Gaudelive begins at 6 am, when she opens her store front. She remains there until she sells her daily inventory. If business is not good on a particular day, she will close her storefront at 5 pm. Her business and marketing plan are well organized as she has received business training from VFC over the past several years. Gaudelive has requested a loan from Kiva lenders through Vision Finance Company in order to purchase additional inventory for her business, including maize, beans and sorghum. With the profits from this loan, she will be able to get medical insurance for her family, pay school fees for her children, get enough food for her family and save for her future.

loans.use: To buy sorghum, maize and beans to sell to consumers in her village.

loans.name: Duterintambwe Group

texts.en: Rita is 43 years old and is married with children. Due to her experience and background, Rita was nominated as the group leader for DUTERINTAMBWE. Rita is the first person on the right side, wearing a brown dress and glasses, holding a hand bag. Rita has owned and operated a corner market for the past 5 years. Like many of those in the group, her business is well organized and requires that she work from 6am to 5pm every day. Despite the long days, Rita is determined to operate a successful business in order to provide a better life for her children.  Rita has requested a loan from Kiva through Vision Finance Company in order to buy inventory like: soap, sugar, juice, tea, oil etc. With the profits from this loan, she will be able to reinvest in her business, pay school fees for her children, and save for her future.

loans.use: To buy inventory for her general store, such as soap, sugar and oil in an effort to increase profits.

loans.name: Elisee

texts.en:
Elisee is a 54-year-old married mother of ten. She works hard to support her family and provide them with a better life. For the past 15 years Elisee has sold charcoal, which is used by the local community to cook their meals and heat their homes. Every morning Elisee opens her shop at 7 am and works tirelessly until her daily supply is sold. While she has built up a local clientele, the profits from her business are not enough to cover the cost of living for her husband, a school teacher, and their children. 

Elisee is requesting her 5th loan from Vision Finance Company, and her first via Kiva. She has used the previous loans from VFC to increase her inventory and make repairs to her shop. With this loan, Elisee hopes to expand her business in several ways.  She would like to continue to increase her charcoal inventory, as well as build a supply shed for inventory storage. She hopes this will allow her to increase her profits, eventually leading her towards sustainability. 

With the profits earned from this loan, Elisee hopes to pay for the school fees for her two remaining school-bound children as well as provide her family with clothes and household items. In the long-term, she hopes to expand her business to other areas of the city, as well as provide other products to her clients.

loans.use: To buy additional charcoal inventory and purchase storage space for her existing and expected stockpile.

loans.name: Hanh's Group

texts.en:
Mrs Hanh, born in 1977, is a Thai ethnic woman and leader of Hanh's Group. She has been in the program of M7 Microfinance Institution's (M7 MFI) forerunner since January 1999. She was one of the earliest members of the organization. She is currently living with her husband and her two daughters in Mai Son district, Son La province.

Her family’s main income is from cultivation. Her family has about 8,000 square meters of cultivated land for coffee, so the income, after deducting costs, is just enough to cover the living expense of the family and to save a small amount. 

Because she has to pay for her daughters' education fees since her eldest daughter is studying at a college and her second daughter is in eighth grade, the saved amount is insufficient. Therefore, she wants to borrow a loan to pay for her daughters' education fees and invest more on their education.

Hanh hopes that the loan will help her children have better conditions for studying and learning in order to have a bright future. She will work hard to get money to repay the loan from M7 MFI on-time.

loans.use: to pay for her daughters' education fees.

loans.name: Vestine

texts.en:
Vestine is a 31-year-old married mother with two children. She has operated a tailoring business for the past year and a half. She works everyday from 8 a.m. until 6 p.m., with only one other person to assist. While the work is tough and the hours are long, Vestine is committed to her business so that her children may prosper. 

Vestine has requested a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company to buy more materials and machines to use in her tailoring business. With this loan, she will earn more profits which will allow her to keep reinvesting for better financial stability, as well as pay her child's school fees and medical insurance. Over the next five years, as her business continues to grow, Vestine hopes to earn enough money to purchase a house for her and her family.

loans.use: To buy more materials and machines to use in her tailoring business.

loans.name: Ma. Luisa

texts.en:
Ma. Luisa is a 53-year-old married woman with six children, three of whom are in school. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur.

Ma. Luisa has a fish-vending business in the Philippines. Ma. Luisa requested a PHP 29,500 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy more fish to sell in her food stall.

Ma. Luisa has been in this business for 16 years. In the future, Ma. Luisa would like to save enough money so she can continue to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell in her food stall.

loans.name: Glorylin

texts.en:
Glorylin is a 34-year-old married woman with two children, one of whom is in school. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur.

Glorylin has a general (sari-sari) store business in the Philippines. Glorylin requested a PHP 15,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy items like canned goods, personal care products, etc., to sell in her sari-sari store.

Glorylin has been in this business for eight years. In the future, Glorylin would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items like canned goods, personal care products, etc., to sell in her sari-sari store.

loans.name: Julita

texts.en:
Julita is a 58-year-old married mother of six children, one in school. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur.

Julita has a general store business in the Philippines. Julita requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional groceries to sell.

Julita has been in this business for 13 years. In the future, Julita would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional groceries to sell.

loans.name: Helen

texts.en:
Helen is 47 years old and married with four children.

She earns a living by having a pig fattening business in the Philippines. Helen is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to purchase feed and other supplies to raise her pigs.

Helen has been in pig fattening for five years and earns additional income from a general store.

She is working tirelessly towards the attainment of her dream: to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase feed and other supplies to raise her pigs

loans.name: Dolores

texts.en:
As a married mother of 11 children, Dolores works hard to support her family.

She has a general store business in the Philippines. Dolores is borrowing PHP 16,000 through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell.

Dolores has been sustaining her business activities through her past 15 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business and repair her family's home.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Lanie

texts.en:
Lanie is 53 years old and married with seven children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. 

Lanie has a fishing business in the Philippines. Lanie requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy fishing gear and other equipment.

Lanie has been in this business for 12 years. In the future, Lanie would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fishing gear and other equipment.

loans.name: Salvacion

texts.en:
Salvacion is 64 years old, widowed and has six children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. 

Salvacion has a general store business in the Philippines. Salvacion requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell.

Salvacion has been in this business for 10 years. In the future, Salvacion would like to save enough money to expand her business and repair her family's home.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Gemma

texts.en:
Gemma is a 44-year-old married mother of six children, three in school. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. 

Gemma has a general store business in the Philippines. Gemma requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell.

Gemma has been in this business for five years. In the future, Gemma would like to save enough money so she can continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Anita

texts.en:
Anita is 74 years old and married with eight children. She works very hard to provide for her family.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like shampoo, soap, milk, sugar, noodles, and spices.

Anita has been in this business for 10 years. 

In the future, Anita would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like shampoo, soap, milk, sugar, noodles, and spices

loans.name: Shabnam

texts.ru: Шабнам усидчивая женщина. Она из города Куляб, замужем  и мать троих детей. Её муж мастер по ремонту домов, но в данный момент не работает. Они получают доход только благодаря швейной работе Шабнам. Шабнам общительная женщина. Она легко общается и понимает желания заказчиков. Сейчас Шабнам с огромной надеждой обратилась за кредитом, чтобы купить стройматериалы для ремонта своего дома, который очень старый. Шабнам чувствует неловкость, когда принимает клиенток у себя дома. Она очень надеется на ваше понимание.
texts.en: Shabnam is a diligent woman. She is from the city of Kulob, married, and has three children. Her husband renovates houses but isn't currently working. Their only income is from Shabnam's sewing services. Shabnam is a sociable woman who talks to her customers and understands their needs. Shabnam applied for a loan with high hopes. She wants to buy building materials to renovate her home because it is very old. Shabnam feels uncomfortable having clients in her home. She hopes very much for your understanding.

loans.use: to buy building materials to renovate her home

loans.name: Yeng

texts.en:
Yeng, 35, lives in the community of Kampong Cham Province, Cambodia. She has four children.

To make a living and support the family, Yeng works for a private pot factory and earns, on average, USD 5.00 per day. So far, she has been in this career for two years.

Beside this, Yeng is also involved with a farming business, primarily growing rice. She sells her agricultural products to local dealers and customers in the market.

In this farming season, Yeng is lacking money to buy some farm supplies. To continue her farming, she is borrowing some money from Kiva now to buy farm supplies like fertilizers, seeds and insecticides.

Yeng is thankful to lenders for the financial support. She is awaiting your kindness.

loans.use: to buy farm supplies like fertilizers, seeds and insecticides

loans.name: Leonora

texts.en:
Leonora is 62 years old and widowed. She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a loan of 20,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) through NWTF to buy additional items such as coffee, snack foods, detergent soap, soft drinks, candies, and biscuits to sell.

Leonora has borrowed and repaid 25 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 13 years and also earns an income from selling nipa roofing. She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

Leonora aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional items such as coffee, snack foods, detergent soap, soft drinks, candies, and biscuits to sell

loans.name: Anecita

texts.en:
Anecita is 53 years old and married with one child.

Anecita works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell in her general store.

Anecita has borrowed and repaid three loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for one year and also earns an income from farming root-crops and sugarcane and buying and selling school supplies.

Anecita aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell in her general store

loans.name: Vanchoi Group

texts.en:
“I once raised the biggest pig in my village. Many people wanted to buy that pig, and that was my most proud moment being in this business,” narrates Chonghoineng, a 40-year-old woman. She is the featured borrower of the group “Vanchoi”. She is pictured with her hand raised among the group members. She lives with her husband and children in their village.

Other than raising pigs for profit, Chonghoineng sells rice and eatables like local chips prepared by her for income generation. Her husband is a daily labourer, and their income can hardly meet their needs, as their family expenses are high.

Chonghoineng raises her pigs in the backyard of their home compound. She normally raises one or two pigs at a time. She now aspires to raise more pigs in the hope to make more profit. With the Kiva loan, she will buy five piglets to raise at her pig sty.

Her favorite part of raising pigs is to feed the hungry pigs on time so that they grow healthy and big. “The uncertainty about this business is that when the pig suddenly dies, your investment is lost.”

She will sell the pigs for profit after one year. The profit will help her family to pay for the children’s education cost and meet their required basic necessities. She also aspires to buy a solar home lighting system in the near future if her present business becomes successful. She is very happy to get the loan.

The rest of the group members will use the loan to help their businesses. They are very excited to get the loan. They all strive for financial freedom.

loans.use: to buy five piglets to raise for profit and to pay for her children’s education cost.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy more sofa case material to increase her orders

loans.name: Marvelyn

texts.en:
Marvelyn is 41 years old, is married, and has four children, one of whom is currently in school.

Marvelyn works in agriculture, raising pigs in the Philippines. She requested a loan of 9,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) through NWTF to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs. She has been raising pigs for 1 year now and has borrowed 3 times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

Marvelyn would like to build and expand her business to secure her family's future.

loans.use: to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
As a married parent of four children, Mary works hard to support her family. She has a business buying and selling peanuts in the Philippines and earns additional income from raising chickens. Mary is borrowing 10,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) through NWTF to purchase additional sacks of peanuts to sell to her customers for her peanut business.

Mary has been sustaining her business activities through her past 3 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough money to afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional sacks of peanuts to sell to her customers

loans.name: Julio

texts.es:
Julio tiene una familia hermosa, tengo una meta que ser Ingeniero Agrónomo, se ve también siendo un empresario.
Tengo muchas aspiraciones para poder ser un buen profesional y abrirse camino por medio de sus estudios.
Pide este préstamo para poder pagar su matrícula y otros gastos que tiene.
texts.en:
Julio has a beautiful family. His goal is to be an agronomic engineer, and he is also an entrepreneur.

He has many aspirations of being able to be a good professional, and of carving a path forward by means of his studies. He is requesting this loan so that he can pay for his tuition and other expenses.

loans.use: to pay for tuition and other expenses.

loans.name: Alba Dalila

texts.es: Alba de 51 años de edad que habita en vivienda propia en compañía de su esposo y su nieta de 6 años de edad. Ella es una mujer trabajadora que se gana la vida atendiendo una tienda propia en la que vende productos de primera necesidad como arroz, azúcar, frijoles, maíz, etc., además su compañero de vida presta sus servicios de seguridad, por lo que le permite brindar un pequeño aporte económico familiar. Ella gracias a su esfuerzo atendiendo su negocio ha logrado mantener una estabilidad económica por lo que desea reparar uno de los muros de retención ya que se encuentra en malas condiciones por eso solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: cemento, arena, grava, ladrillos, etc., para reparar un muro en malas condiciones en su vivienda.
texts.en: Alba is 51 years old and lives in her own home accompanied by her husband and their 6 year old granddaughter. She is a hard-working woman who earns a living running her own small store in which she sells basic need products such as rice, sugar, beans, corn etc. Additionally, her life partner works in security which allows him to offer a small economic support for the family. Thanks to her efforts running her business, Alba has been able to maintain some economic stability which is why she wants to repair one of the outer walls of her home which is not in great shape. This goal has led her to request a credit from FUSAI to invest in: cement, sand, gravel, bricks etc. to repair the wall of her home which is in poor conditions.

loans.use: invest in: cement, sand, gravel, bricks etc., to repair a wall of her home which is in poor condition

loans.name: Nhom 11 - Dinh Hoa Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Tho is a member of Nhom 11 - Dinh Hoa Group. She is pictured first on the right, in the first row. She is 40 years old and works in agricultural production, with a monthly income of $21. She is married and has three children. She is currently pregnant, and her husband just passed away.

Due to economic hardship, Tho's family has not yet been able to build a septic-tank latrine and is using a double-pit latrine, which is now degraded. A portion of Nhom 11 - Dinh Hoa Group's loan will help Tho, as well as other group members, purchase sand, cement, and bricks to build a septic-tank latrine to improve her family's living conditions and contribute to sanitary improvement in their community.

loans.use: to pay for the construction of a sanitary latrine, with a device for hand washing with soap

loans.name: Mary Rose

texts.en:
Mary Rose is 30 years old, is married, and has two children, both of whom are in school.

Mary Rose is in agriculture, raising livestock in the Philippines. She requested a loan of 10,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) through NWTF to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her livestock. She has been raising livestock for 1 year now and has borrowed 3 times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

In the future, Mary Rose would like to save enough money to afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her livestock

loans.name: Estrella

texts.en:
Estrella is 59 years old and married with five children. She is in agriculture, raising pigs in the Philippines. She requested a loan of 10,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) through NWTF to buy feeds and vitamins  for her pigs. See has been raising pigs for 30 years now and has borrowed 4 times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

Estrella would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy feeds and vitamins  for her pigs

loans.name: Katerin

texts.es:
Katerin está cursando el 4to año de la carrera de Administración de Empresas, específicamente preparando su tesis. 
Comenta que le costó mucho seguir sus estudios ya que tiene una hija de seis años.
Pide este préstamo para poder pagar los gastos de su tesis, y de esa forma poder cubrir ese gasto que tiene.
texts.en: Katerin is in her fourth year of study for a degree in Business Administration, specifically, she is preparing her thesis. She comments that it cost her very much to continue with her studies, as she has a six-year-old daughter.  She is requesting this loan in order to be able to pay her thesis expenses, and in this way, cover this expense.

loans.use: to pay thesis expenses.

loans.name: Ali

texts.en:
Ali is a 45-year-old married man from Rafah city, which is located in the Gaza Strip and suffers from power outages 12-16 hours a day regularly. He lives with his family in a small house. As an employee in the public sector, he earns a low income. This income barely covers all the family's needs.

Because he is not able to save enough money, Ali took a USD loan from FATEN. With this loan, he will buy a solar system for heating water for the family house. Palestinians use water boilers that use either gas or gasoline to heat the water before a shower, which can be dangerous, expensive and inefficient. This will help him to provide hot water without using electricity, which is much more expensive.

loans.use: he will buy a solar system for heating water for the family house

loans.name: Samer

texts.en:
Samer is a 31-year-old, married man from Rafah city, which is located in the Gaza Strip.
He works as an employee in the public sector, where he gets a low income. This income barely covers all the family needs, but he wants to make his family more comfortable and improve their standard of living.

So, Samer  took a USD loan from FATEN, which will enable him to buy a solar system for heating water for his family home. By taking this loan, Samer  will be able to decrease the electricity expenses, while using a cleaner form of energy (rather than gas). Samer ’s family will have an easier time heating water for showers, cooking, and also washing clothes and dishes. 

Samer  appears in the photo.

loans.use: to buy a solar system to heat water for his family home.

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en:
Marilyn is married and works hard to support her family. She has a fishing business in the Philippines. She requested a loan of 15,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) through NWTF to purchase additional fishing net for her business. She has been in this business for 10 years now.

In the future, Marilyn would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional fishing net for her business

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy more rice, sugar, biscuits and juice for sale.

loans.name: Vien

texts.en:
Ms. Vien is a single, 38 years old. She lives with her mother and young brother. 

She would like to improve her living standard, especially her family’s member but has a lack of capital. The loan can help her to build a hygienic latrine and she is able to repay the loan from a small business.

loans.use: To build a new latrine to improve the health of her family

loans.name: Abdullahi

texts.en:
Abdullahi is a Babban Gona farmer from Bakutaje Village. Abdullahi joined Babban Gona to become a better farmer. Through Babban Gona’s input loan, Abdullahi will have access to top-of-the-range farm inputs such as fertilizers, herbicides, and improved seeds. 

This loan will help him earn yields of up to 30 bags of maize per hectare, double the 14 bags per hectare earned by the average Nigerian smallholder maize farmer. With the opportunity to earn high yields and increase his net income, Abdullahi would like to use his extra earnings to ensure that all his children get a post secondary education.

loans.use: To purchase improved farm inputs that will increase farmer’s yields

loans.name: Nhom 10 - Dinh Hoa Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Mai, pictured first on the left in the second row, is a 32-year-old farmer. She has been an active member of the Women's Union since 2005. Her family is listed as a low-income family with three little children. They don't have a sanitary latrine at home due to a lack of funds and are using a double-pit latrine that is now degraded.

With a portion of the group loan, Mai will be able to gain access to latrine hardware facilities that include a hygienic septic-tank latrine and a hand-washing device with soap. These facilities will help her family improve their health, living conditions, and personal safety while contributing to the environmental health of their community.

loans.use: To pay for the construction of a sanitary latrine with a device for hand washing with soap

loans.name: Deilhen Group

texts.en:
“Work security is the most important to me. I was a daily labourer with so much insecurity about whether I may get to work tomorrow and earn my wages to support my family. That’s when I decided to start weaving at home,” says Hechong, who got married at a young age.

Hechong, a 34-year-old woman, is the featured borrower of the group “Deilhen”. She is pictured with her hand raised with the group members. Hechong lives with her children in their village, while her husband works in a private company at a different place. She has three school-going children whom she dearly supports.

Hechong has been weaving around ten years now and considers herself the best weaver in her village. She learnt weaving from her friends and neighbours. She weaves different designs of Thadou tribe traditional wraparound skirts, namely Khamtang - Saipikhup jem, Lengte jem, Aikeng jem, and Thangnang jem (local names). She can weave two skirts in a month. It is her only source of income, and she supports her family through this.

The Kiva loan will be used to buy five varieties of yarn. She will use the yarn to weave beautiful traditional wraparound skirts that will be sold once she completes the weaving. The profit will be used to pay for her children’s school fees and other family necessities. She says, “Thank you Kiva.”

The other group members will use the loan in their business endeavours. They are all very happy and excited to get a loan. They extend their heartfelt thanks to the lenders. They all strive forward to financial independence.

loans.use: to buy yarn to weave and make a profit to pay for her children’s school fees.

loans.name: Adurahaman

texts.en:
Adurahaman is a Babban Gona maize farmer from Wambai Village. Adurahaman joined Babban Gona to create a better life for his children. In the past, Adurahaman suffered from poor yields that crippled his ability to pay his children's school fees. Through Babban Gona’s input loan,

 Adurahaman will have access to the best farm inputs in the market such as fertilizers, herbicides and improved seeds that will help him earn yields of up to 30 bags of maize/ hectare, double the Nigerian national average of 14 bags. This will see him increase his household income considerably. Thanks to Babban Gona's support, Adurahaman now has the opportunity to increase his yields and income and use his additional earnings to ensure that his children get a post secondary education.

loans.use: To purchase improved farm inputs that will increase farmer’s yields

loans.name: Kieu

texts.en:
Mrs. Kieu  is a hardworking woman, 30 years old. She is married and has two children. Her family’s income is mainly from cultivation. 

She would like to borrow the loan to build a latrine, which can help to improve the health of her family’s member. With support from her husband, she is able to repay the loan monthly.

loans.use: To build a latrine to improve the health of her family

loans.name: Arlene

texts.en:
Arlene is 38 years old and married with five children.

She earns a living by raising livestock in the Philippines. Arlene is borrowing PHP 9,000 through NWTF to buy feed and other supplies to raise her livestock.

Arlene has been raising livestock for one year and also earns additional income from fruit vending.

She is working tirelessly towards the attainment of her dream: to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed and other supplies to raise her livestock.

loans.name: Ailyn

texts.en:
Ailyn is a married woman with three children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Ailyn is 39 years old, and her three children are in school.

Ailyn has a general store business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 11,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to purchase additional stock of groceries to sell.

Ailyn has been in this business for 17 years. In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business and continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock of groceries to sell.

loans.name: Emelda

texts.en:
Emelda is 47 years old and married with five children.

She earns a living by farming corn in the Philippines. Emelda is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to purchase fertilizers and other supplies for her business.

Emelda has been farming corn for one year and also earns additional income from raising chickens.

She is working tirelessly towards the attainment of her dream: to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and other supplies for her business.

loans.name: Irenia

texts.en:
Irenia is 50 years old and married with five children. 

Irenia is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. Irenia requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Irenia has been raising pigs for 26 years now, and has borrowed four times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

Irenia would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Merly

texts.en:
Merly works hard to support her family. Merly is married and has a furniture-making business in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to purchase wood, nails, paint,  etc for her furniture business.

Merly has been in this business for nine years now.

She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase wood, nails, paint, etc for her furniture business

loans.name: Nora

texts.en:
Nora works hard to support her family. Nora is married and has a buy-and-sell rice business in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional sacks of rice to sell.

Nora has been in this business for nine years now.

In the future, Nora would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional sacks of rice to sell

loans.name: Jercita

texts.en:
As a married parent of three children, Jercita works hard to support her family.

She has a restaurant business in the Philippines and earns additional income from raising pigs. Jercita is borrowing PHP 20,000 through NWTF to purchase additional ingredients like canned goods, fish, meat, and vegetables for her restaurant.

Jercita has been sustaining her business activities through her past 14 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional ingredients like canned goods, fish, meat, and vegetables.

loans.name: Liezl

texts.en:
Liezl is a 31-year-old married mother of three children, two in school. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur.

She has a buy-and-sell used clothing business in the Philippines. Liezl requested a PHP 30,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional sacks of used clothes to sell.

Liezl has been in this business for five years. In the future, Liezl would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional sacks of used clothes to sell

loans.name: Maricel

texts.en:
Maricel is 33 years old and married, with one child. 

Maricel is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 12,000 loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to buy feed and other supplies to raise her pigs.

Maricel has been raising pigs for two years now and has borrowed five times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

In the future, Maricel would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feed and other supplies to raise her pigs.

loans.name: Phuoc

texts.en:
Mrs. Phuoc is 43 years old, she is a hardworking woman. She is married and has three children, two of them have jobs. 

The loan can help her to build a sanitatary latrine, which can contribute to improve the health of her family as well as environment protection.She is able to pay the loan monthly from a small business.

loans.use: To build a latrine to improve the health of her family

loans.name: Josie

texts.en:
Josie is married and she works hard to support her family.

She has a buy and sell salt business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from selling vegetables and spices. Josie is borrowing PHP 23,000 through NWTF in order to buy additional stocks of salt to re-sell.

Josie has been sustaining her business activities through her past 5 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional stocks of salt to re-sell.

loans.name: Marta

texts.es:
Marta es de la ciudad de Concepción, comenta que su meta es ayudar a su familia en especial a sus hermanos para que puedan estudiar también y tener una profesión como ella está luchando.
Ella está estudiando la carrera de enfermería y quiere poder ayudar a las demás personas.
Pide este préstamo para poder pagar sus gastos de tesis y de esa forma poder cubrir ese gasto que tiene.
texts.en:
Marta is from the city of Concepción. She comments that her goal is to help her family, especially her brothers, so that they may also study and have a profession like the one that she is striving for. 

She is studying in the nursing program, and she wants to be able to help other people. She is requesting this loan in order to be able to pay her thesis expenses.

loans.use: to pay thesis expenses.

loans.name: Juan

texts.es:
El Sr Juan está estudiando  el segundo año de la carrera Ingeniera Civil, comenta que viene de una familia muy humilde donde todas se ayudan para poder crecer y salir adelante.
El pide este préstamo para poder pagar sus cuotas de la universidad y de esa forma poder seguir con sus estudios como lo viene haciendo.
texts.en:
Juan is in his second year of studying Civil Engineering. He says that he comes from a very modest family where everyone helps one another to be able to grow and get ahead. 

He is requesting this loan to be able to pay his university fees, and in this way, to be able to continue with his studies as he has been doing.

loans.use: to pay for university fees.

loans.name: Nuvia Gloribel

texts.es:
Nuvia, d 38 años de edad, está acompañada y tiene 2 hijos de 4 y 6 años de edad.

Nuvia, es una persona muy trabajadora, su labor a diario es ordeñar una vaca para vender la leche; también trabaja con especies menores.- Su esposo se dedica al trabajo agrícola. 

Ella, necesita el dinero del préstamo para construir un corral donde pueda encerrar gallinas de engorde, para cuidarlas, alimentarlas y venderlas para la época de Diciembre, que es cuando más demanda tienen las gallinas. 

Su principal sueño es ir implementando micro proyectos que ayuden al sustento de sus gatos familiares y así estar preparada para cuando sus hijas crezcan para ayudarles en sus estudios.
texts.en:
Nuvia, 38 years old, is in a relationship and has 2 children, 4 and 6 years old. Nuvia is a very hardworking person. Her daily task is to milk a cow in order to sell the milk. She also works with small animals. Her husband makes his living in agricultural work.

She needs the loan money to build a corral where she can keep broiler chickens in order to care for them, feed them, and sell them during the December season, which is when chickens are in highest demand.

Her main dream is to implement micro projects that help cover family expenses, so that she can be prepared to help with her children's education when they grow up.

loans.use: to build a corral where she can keep broiler chickens.

loans.name: Fotu

texts.en:
Fotu is a 28-year-old unmarried mother of 2 children. 

Fotu runs a small business selling BBQ in her community, which she has been doing for 2 years. She has requested a loan to buy chicken, sausages, ketchup, soy sauce, mayonnaise, etc. 

Fotu joined South Pacific Business Development in 2012 to gain access to capital. With her earnings, she hopes to both expand her business and start a flea market.

loans.use: to buy chicken, sausages, tomato sauce, soy sauce, mayonnaise, etc.

loans.name: Sandra Del Carmen

texts.es: Sandra de 32 años de edad que habita en vivienda propia con su compañero de vida y sus dos hijos de 13 y 15 años de edad. Ella es una mujer trabajadora que vende de lunes a viernes insumos básicos como huevos, chorizos, verduras, además los fines de semana elabora pupusas para la venta. Sandra anteriormente realizo algunas reparaciones en su vivienda como la instalación de la energía eléctrica. Ella desea continuar haciendo mejoras a su vivienda como la ampliación de su corredor y la instalación de alambre de protección para el cerco periférico de la vivienda, para así poder brindarle mayor seguridad y comodidad a su familia. Es por eso que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: lamina, polines, clavos, ángulos, alambre, etc., para la construcción de un corredor e instalación de un cerco en su vivienda.
texts.en:
Sandra is 32 years old and lives in her own home with her partner and her two children ages 13 and 15. She is a hardworking woman who sells basic goods like eggs, chorizo, and vegetables Monday through Friday. On the weekends, she makes "pupusas" (stuffed tortillas) to sell. 

Previously, Sandra made some repairs to her home like installing electricity. She hopes to continue improving her home by expanding her hallway and by installing wire protection for the enclosed area of her home. This way she can provide better security and comfort for her family. 

Because of this, she is requesting a loan from FUSAI to invest in: metal sheets, poles, nails, angle irons, wires, etc., for the construction of a hallway and the installation of a fence for her home.

loans.use: to invest in: metal sheets, poles, nails, angle irons, wires, etc., for the construction of a hallway and the installation of a fence for her home.

loans.name: Miguel Angel

texts.es: Miguel de 49 años de edad vive en casa propia con su grupo familiar, el posee una tienda ubicada en su lugar de residencia desde hace mas de 22 años, comercializa una variedad de productos y tiene muchos clientes con lo que obtiene de sus ventas logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, el está solicitando un crédito para la compra de pan dulce, azúcar, frijoles, aceite, margarina, café, huevos, gaseosa, jugos, golosinas, etc.  y asi poder continuar con sus ventas para tener mejores ingresos económicos.
texts.en:
Miguel, 49, lives in his own home with his family. For the past 22 years, he has owned a store located in his home. He sells a variety of products and he has a lot of customers. The money he earns from his sales help to pay for some of the household expenses. 

He is requesting a loan to buy baked goods, sugar, beans, oil, margarine, coffee, eggs, soft drinks, juice, candy, etc. This will allow him to continue with his sales in order to generate a better income.

loans.use: to buy baked goods, sugar, beans, oil, margarine, coffee, eggs, soft drinks, juice, candy, etc.

loans.name: Rosalin

texts.en:
Rosalin 57, is married with four children, two of whom are in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. 

She has a handicraft business in the Philippines and has been in this business for over five years. Susana has requested a loan from GDMPC micro credit. She will use the loan to purchase more materials to expand her business. In the future, she would like to save enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: To purchase more materials for nipa making.

location.town: Sapang Ama, Sapang Dala, Misamis Occidental

loans.name: Ma. Lourdes Pearl

texts.en:
Her name is Ma. Lourdes Pearl. She is 43 years old and a resident of General Trias, Cavite, Philippines. She is married to Fernando, a seafarer, and has three children. The couple work hard to provide for their children and send them to good schools. Education is a great equalizer among the rich and the poor, and Filipino parents put it at top priority in their budget. This led Ma. Lourdes to do business to fully meet the high cost of education in the Philippines.

Ma. Lourdes Pearl started her direct-selling business just eight months ago, but she is encouraged that her sales are doing well. She buys beauty products from licensed dermatologists and sells them either by sets or individually.

To help her buy more beauty products, she is asking for your help of a PHP 15,000 loan. She will use the proceeds of her loan to pay for whitening soaps, cleanser, toner, moisturizer, sunblock, and some bags and wallets as well. Filipinos are crazy about having a fair and smooth skin. Most Filipina girls have "morena" skin tone, so they want to regularly use whitening products to achieve a fair and clearer complexion. She is thanking God and you in advance for granting her request, for it will surely help grow her business and assist her husband in making a living.

Ma. Lourdes Pearl dreams to become a big distributor of beauty products someday. She aims to give her children the best college education. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members every week to share stories of her work and to also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for several sets of beauty products and some bags and wallets as well to sell.

loans.name: Sros

texts.en:
Sros, 28, lives in a community of Kampong Cham Province, Cambodia. She has one child. To make a living and support the family, she manages and operates a farming business, primarily grows rice and sells her agricultural product to the local dealers and customers in market. So far, she has been in this business around ten years. 

On average, she is able to make an earning of USD 5.00 a day.In this farming season, but she is lacking money to buy some farm supplies for her farming. To continue her farming, she is borrowing some money from Kiva now to buy farm supplies like fertilizers, seeds and insecticides.  She is thankful to lenders for the financial support. She is awaiting your kindness.

loans.use: to buy farm supplies like fertilizers, seeds and insecticides

loans.name: Carolina

texts.en:
As a married parent of twelve children, Carolina works hard to support her family.

She has a fish vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from raising pigs. Carolina is borrowing PHP 8,000 through NWTF to purchase more fish to sell to her customers for her fish vending business.

Carolina has been sustaining her business activities through her past nine loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more fish to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Emily

texts.en:
Emily is 54 years old and married with four children.

Emily works hard to provide for her family. She has a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 30,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell.

Emily has borrowed and paid 12 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for five years and also earns an income from selling vegetables and spices.

Emily aspires to save enough money to expand her business and repair her family's home.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Leonardo

texts.es:
Leonardo de 40 años de edad,  se dedica a la agricultura y ganadería  vive con su familia que está formada por su esposa y cuatro hijos, el creció con sus padres quienes se dedicaban a la agricultura como principal fuente de ingresos.

Leonardo tiene una experiencia de 20 años en los trabajos de agricultura,  actividad que aprendió de sus padres quienes lo educaron y lo crecieron con amor y sabiduría  y es lo que lo ha llevado ser una persona de éxito en su vida y ser un ejemplo para su familia. 


El dinero será utilizado para pagar el alquiler de sus terrenos agrícolas y para comenzar a preparar el terreno donde cultivara sus granos básicos.


Las proyecciones que tiene para un futuro son las de apoyar en la educación de sus hijos también pagar en crédito y adquirir un nuevo crédito para comenzar a cultivar hortalizas pues cuenta con un terreno adecuado para el trabajo de las hortalizas y crianza de ganado.
texts.en:
Leonardo is 40 years old. He makes his living in farming and ranching. He lives with his family, which is comprised of his wife and four children. He grew up with his parents who made their living with farming being their primary source of income.

Leonardo has 20 years experience working in farming, an activity he learned from his parents, who educated and raised him with love and good sense. That is what has made him a person who is successful in his life and an example for his family.

The money will be used to pay for the lease on his farm lands and to begin preparing the land where he will plant his basic grains.

His future plans are to support his children's education and also to repay the loan and get a new loan to begin growing vegetables, because he has enough land to grow vegetables and raise cattle.

loans.use: to pay the lease on his farm lands and to begin preparing the land where he will plant his basic grains.

loans.name: Huong

texts.en: Mrs. Huong is 58 years old, a single mother with three children. The loan can help her to build a sanitatay latrine, which can contribute to improve the health for her family as well as environment protection. Fishing is the main income source of her family, so she is able to pay the loan monthly from chicken raising activity and selling fish, which her son caught.

loans.use: To build a latrine to improve the health of her family

loans.name: Pele

texts.en: Pele is 22 years old and married with two children. She runs a small business selling fish in her community and has been doing this for two years. Pele has requested a loan to buy goggles, torches, a spear, fishing net, etc. She joined SPBD in 2013 to gain access to capital. With her earnings, Pele hopes to buy a new boat for her business and to support her family financially.

loans.use: to buy goggles, torches, a spear, fishing net, etc.

loans.name: Mary Ann

texts.en:
Mary Ann is a married woman from Trinidad, Bohol. She is 25 years old and has two children ages four and two years old. She has been working hard for a better living. 

With that she is engaged in various businesses like car washing, water refiling, vulcanizing and loader. To continue running this business she needs fund to buy gadgets for her car washing business like a car wash timer and car wash engine. 

Mary Ann’s dream is to send her children to school and for them to get a degree in the future.

loans.use: to buy car wash timer and car wash engine

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: buy a solar system for heating water for the family house.

loans.name: Mary Grace

texts.en:
Mary Grace is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a general store business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 12,000 through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell for her general store business.

Mary Grace successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

NWTF is re-listing Mary Grace's business profile again in support of her efforts to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Rosemarie

texts.en:
Rosemarie is 51 years old and has six children.  Rosemarie is married and has three children who are in school.

She is in the agricultural business raising pigs in the Philippines. Rosemarie requested a PHP 15000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pigs.

Rosemarie has been raising pigs for 10 years now, and has borrowed 13 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Rosemarie would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pigs

loans.name: Umusingi Group

texts.en:
Claudine is a group leader; aged 31 years. She is married with 1 child who has 4 years. The group is called UMUSINGI means “The foundation” in English. They sell different products and they wish to expand their business for changing their better future. 

She owns a bar and has been running in a business for 3 years. With the loan, she would like to buy more beer for sale. The profits from the business will be used to buy a piece of land and renovate her house.

loans.use: to buy more beer for sale.

loans.name: Jona

texts.en:
Jona is a married woman with eleven children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Jona is 44 years old and seven of her children are currently in school.

Jona has a buy and sell dry goods business in the Philippines. Jona requested a PHP 15,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more stock of goods like slippers, blouses, etc. to sell.

Jona has been in this business for six years. In the future, Jona would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more stock of goods like slippers, blouses, etc. to sell

loans.name: Malak

texts.en:
Malak is a young married woman with one children.  She carries the responsible early, as Malak`s husband is working in the army with a low income and she is working hard to help him in the household expenses.

She is very ambitious and strong willed woman who wants to improve the standards of living for her family,.  Therefore she started sells ready-made clothes in her home and after she become known in this field and has gained some experience, she decided to expand and develop her business.

She decided to take a loan to help her buy more clothes and products to sell and increase her income, to become able to help her husband more and more.

loans.use: to help her buy more clothes and products to sell which will help her family

loans.name: Gregorio

texts.en:
Gregorio is a weaver from Mexico who specializes in Zapotec wool rugs. He would like to invest in new equipment, including wood pedals, a loom comb and spinning wheels and purchase raw materials in bulk, such as wool, natural dyes and firewood. He also plans to increase the physical space of his workshop and bring on additional weavers.

Gregorio has been selling through NOVICA since 2004. This is his story:

"I am the youngest son in a family of weavers from Teotitlan del Valle, and I learned from my parents and brothers how to weave. I would watch them prepare the yarn, how they dyed them with natural colors, and thread them on the loom. I feel very proud to preserve this art, which my parents learned from my grandparents. I began weaving my own Zapotec wool rugs when I finished middle school and since then I've been in different exhibitions and art fairs in Oaxaca and throughout the country. The recognition and congratulations I have received from clients and friends has been amazing! What I enjoy most about weaving is the creative aspect: from designing a rug to weaving it. I wove my first rug when I was 13 years old and I remember my father being so pleased with it that he didn't hesitate taking it with him to sell. Ever since, I've been making rugs and now my sons have also learned our craft. In 1966 I started my own workshop and my wool products have traveled beyond Mexico's frontiers. I love what I do! The culture and natural environment of Oaxaca inspire me."

"I know that with your support I can achieve everything I want, and do so with enthusiasm and faith. Gracias!"

Use the link below to view Gregorio's Zapotec wool rugs on the NOVICA site
<a href="http://www.novica.com/kiva/4534">http://www.novica.com/kiva/4534

loans.use: to invest in new equipment and purchase raw materials in bulk and also to increase the physical space of his workshop to bring on additional weavers

loans.name: Batool

texts.en:
Batool is 21-year-old single lady, living with her family in Salt. She is second year to get a bachelor's degree majoring in graphic design.

Batool`s father is retired from the army, but his pension is not enough to meet all of the education fees of his children.  Because of that she requested an education loan to cover her semester fees.

She hopes to find a job immediately after she graduates, to help her family in household expense.

loans.use: to cover her 2nd year semester fees in Graphic Design

loans.name: Veli

texts.en:
Veli is 45 years old and married woman with 7 children. She runs a small business selling ice cakes in her community and has been doing this for 2 years. 

Veli has requested a loan to buy plastic cups,sack of sugar, Chinese candy, freezer etc. She joined SPBD in 2015 to gain access to capital. With her earnings, Veli will hope to start a new business and to support her family living.

loans.use: to buy plastic cups, sack of sugar, Chinese candy, freezer and etc..

loans.name: Roque

texts.es:
Roque vive en la ciudad de Itá, con sus padres y hermanos, su madre es Docente y su padre es chofer.
Estudia Ingeniería Informática y tiene como objetivo recibirse el próximo año y ejercer como todo un profesional para ayudar a su familia y cubrir los gastos de sus hijos.
Pide este préstamo para poder pagar gastos de titulación y de esa forma poder cubrir ese gasto que tiene.
texts.en:
Roque lives in the city of Itá with his parents and siblings. His mother is a teacher and his father is a driver. 

He is studying Computer Engineering, and his goal is to receive his degree next year and practice as a complete professional in order to help his family and cover his children’s expenses.

He is requesting this loan so that he can pay for his degree expenses.  In this way, he will be able to cover that expense.

loans.use: to pay his degree expenses.

loans.name: Monica

texts.es:
Monica es estudiante de la carrera de Contabilidad Pública,  tiene 20 años, es soltera vive con sus padres y hermanos, quienes también estudian, trabaja como cajera en un comedor, su aspiración es terminar la carrera y ayudar a su familia.
Pide este préstamo para poder pagar las cuotas de su carrera, y de esa forma poder seguir con su trabajo como lo viene haciendo.
texts.en:
Monica is studying for a degree in Public Accounting. She is 20 years old, single, and lives with her parents and her siblings, who also go to school. She works as a cashier at a eatery and hopes to complete her degree and help her family.

She is asking for this loan to be able to pay her university fees, and this way she can continue working, just as she has been.

loans.use: to pay university fees

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita wants to head-up for the next cropping period. She owns and operates her own corn field at Mahayag-Molave, Zamboanga del Sur. Her corn production business existed for 20 years that supported the studies of her 6 children. Teresita learns about Paglaum MPC and sign up for membership. 

She had nurtured her membership with the cooperative and had enjoyed the financial assistance whenever she need it. Recently, she availed a loan of PHP 50,000.00 to pay for land preparation and purchase bags of fertilizers and chemicals.

loans.use: to pay for land preparation and purchase bags of fertilizers and chemicals

loans.name: Chona

texts.en:
Chona landed at a right place for her needed capital when she joined PMPC. She knew this would be her last chance to get back on her feet when went broke after her first business went bad. PMPC to Chona came as a rescue for lending her money when she needed it the most. 

Now, she availed another loan for the next cropping season. She loaned an amount for land preparation and purchase of bags of fertilizers.

loans.use: to pay for land preparation and purchase of bags of fertilizers

loans.name: Letecia

texts.en:
Letecia works hard to support her family. Letecia is married and has a vegetable vending business in the Philippines.

Letecia requested a PHP 10000 loan through NWTF to buy more vegetables to sell to her customers.

Letecia has been in this business for 5 years now.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

Letecia would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more vegetables to sell to her customers

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more cassava and other ingredients to make her crispy chips

loans.name: Noor-Han

texts.en:
Noor-han is a 29-year-old single woman from Deir-Albalah city, which is located in the Gaza Strip and suffers from power outages 12-16 hours a day regularly.  She lives with her family in a small house. As an employee in the public sector, her father earns a low income. This income barely covers all the family's needs.

Because she is not able to save enough money, Noor took a USD loan from FATEN. With this loan, she will buy a solar system for heating water for the family house. Palestinians use water boilers that use either gas or gasoline to heat the water before a shower, which can be dangerous, expensive and inefficient. This will help her to provide hot water without using electricity, which is much more expensive.

loans.use: he will buy a solar system for heating water for the family house.

loans.name: Gracinda

texts.en:
A $800.00 is offered to Gracinda to improve her business.  She has a kiosk where many people come to buy every day.She will buy some additional supplies such as noodles, shampoo, coffee, sugar, salt, milk, water and bread.She has been involving herself in business activities since 2010. She feels so comfortable to run her business because she can earn money every day.

Running a business has made Gracinda independent because she can be responsible for herself and also helping her family. She hopes to run a bigger business in the future.

loans.use: To buy noodles, shampoo, coffee, sugar, salt, milk, water and bread

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy supplies and staple grains for her store.

loans.name: Amani

texts.en:
Amani is a 21 years old single lady living with her family in a sector in Jordan called Ramtha. She is a university student majoring in Teaching Children and she is in her second year. 

Amani is aiming to also find a job in her study field after graduating. She is now asking for your help to pay for her upcoming semester fees by applying for this loan.

loans.use: to pay for her 2nd year fees for a BA in Teaching Children

loans.name: Bebie

texts.en:
Bebie  is 63 years old and married. He resides in Bulalo, Tugas,Balingao Misamis Occidental with his family. 

To make a living, Bebie is peddling fresh fish in the local community, in addition to his retail store. For over 15 years, it sustained and provided for his family and home improvements. 

He successfully repaid his previous loan, used for buying goods to sell. 

Bebie is now taking a new loan to buy new fishing nets, to be used for his fishing activity. He is hopeful of earning more income and being able to safely operate his business.

loans.use: to purchase additional fishing net for fishing.

loans.name: Ashraf

texts.en:
Ashraf is a 31-year-old married man from Rafah city, which is located in the Gaza Strip and suffers from power outages 12-16 hours a day regularly. He lives with his family in a small house. As an employee in the public sector, he earns a low income. This income barely covers all the family's needs.

Because he is not able to save enough money, Ashraf took a USD loan from FATEN. With this loan, he will buy a solar system for heating water for the family house. Palestinians use water boilers that use either gas or gasoline to heat the water before a shower, which can be dangerous, expensive and inefficient. 

This will help him to provide hot water without using electricity, which is much more expensive.

loans.use: he will buy a solar system for heating water for the family house.

loans.name: Idaliana

texts.en:
A $800.00 loan is offered to Idaliana to improve her business. She is living in a town with her family and opened her second hand in 2011 with her own capital . She will use the loan to buy shirts, trousers, shorts, long sleeve and short sleeve. Idaliana is generating a good income from selling.

She has been thinking of running a big business after years of involving herself in doing business.She is happy whit this loan because to improving her living condition in the future.And her husband is a driver.

loans.use: To buy shirts, trousers, shorts, long sleeve and short sleeve

loans.name: Mwanasiti

texts.en:
Mwanasiti is a married woman and has been blessed with two kids who attend school. She lives at her own house that  neither has electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food and school fees. 

Mwanasiti has operated a fish selling business, which has been operational for over ten years. She mentioned seasonality as a challenge in the business. Mwanasiti dreams of becoming a wholesaler of fish in the future. 

With the Kshs 70,000 she wants to purchase sacks of fish for resale. She joined Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of fish for resale

loans.name: Magdaline

texts.en:
Magdaline is a single woman who has no children. She lives at a rental house that has electricity but no piped water.

She has operated a retail shop business for the past five years, selling household consumables like wheat flour, maize flour, and sugar. She faces a major challenge of creditors staying for long to repay for goods taken on credit. 

With the loan, she is requesting she wants to purchase stock of sugar, rice, maize flour and wheat flour. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business

loans.use: to purchase stock of sugar, rice, maize flour and wheat flour

loans.name: Alma

texts.en:
Alma is a hard-working entrepreneur who has a buy-and-sell fish business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 13,000 through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to buy additional boxes of fish to sell through her buy-and-sell fish business.

Alma has been in this business for four years. She earns additional income from fishing.

Alma has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts, with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save enough money, so she could afford to send her children to college in the future.

loans.use: to buy additional boxes of fish to sell.

loans.name: Chau

texts.en:
Mrs. Chau is 31 years old, married and has three children, two of them are in school. She would like to improve her family’s living standard, especially for her children but has a lack of capital. 

The loan can help her to build a sanitatary latrine and she is able to repay the loan from fishing and selling chickens from her garden.

loans.use: To build a latrine to improve the health of her family

loans.name: Mafutaga

texts.en:
Mafutaga is 48 years old and a widow with 5 children. She runs a small business selling pancakes in her community and has been doing this for 2 years. 

Mafutaga has requested a loan to buy sack of flour, yeast, cooking oil, fry pan and etc. She joined SPBD in 2013 to gain access to capital. 

With her earnings, Mafutaga will hope to support her family financially and to pay for her children's education.

loans.use: to buy sack of flour, sugar, yeast, cooking oil, fry pan and etc...

loans.name: Foilagi

texts.en:
Foilagi is 62 years old and married woman with 7 children. She runs a small business selling tomatoes, beans, cucumber and etc in her community and has been doing this for 5 years. 

Foilagi has requested a loan to buy plant seeds,spade, rake, chemicals, fertilizer and etc. She joined SPBD in 2012 to gain access to capital. 

With her earnings, Foilagi will hope to extend her business and to support her family as well.

loans.use: to buy seeds, rake, chemicals, spade, fertiliser and etc…

loans.name: Mona

texts.en:
