Mona is 23 years old and a single woman with 1 child. She runs a small business selling chicken & chips in her community and has been doing this for 3 years. 

Mona has requested a loan to buy boxes of chicken, sack of fries, cooking oil, fry pan and etc. She joined SPBD in 2012 to gain access to capital. 

With her earnings, Mona will extend her business and to support her family financially.

loans.use: to buy boxes of chicken, sack of fries, cooking oil, fry pan, tomato sauce etc..

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn is a hard-working entrepreneur who has a motorcycle transport business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 15,000 through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to buy spare parts for the maintenance of her motorcycle transport business.

Jocelyn has been in this business for five years. She earns additional income from farming bananas.

She has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts, with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy spare parts for the maintenance of her motorcycle.

loans.name: Graciana

texts.es:
Graciana de 70 años de edad, es una persona muy dedicada a realizar los oficios domésticos de su casa, al cuido de su familia y al servicio a los demás, ella creció con sus padres quienes le apoyaron e inculcaron buenos principios los que la señora ha puesto en práctica y es lo que le ha ayudado a salir adelante en la vida. Su familia está formada por su esposo y sus dos hijas  las cuales se encuentran estudiando en la escuela de su comunidad 


Graciana se dedica a la crianza de cerdos que luego son puestos a la venta, también al cuido de ganado, estas actividades las aprendió de su abuela quien dedicó toda su vida a la crianza de animales domésticos actividad que le sirvió para conseguir los recursos necesarios y poder satisfacer las necesidades básicas de su familia, sus nietos son los que le ayudan a Graciana en los trabajos que realiza.


El crédito será utilizado para comprar materiales para el mejoramiento de la granja donde cuida a los cerdos, también comprará vitaminas para los mismos.


Las proyecciones que la señora tiene para un futuro son las de establecer una granja de cerdos más formal ya que planea construir instalaciones más adecuadas para el cuido de los cerdos  y adquirir otro préstamo para la compra de ganado lechero
texts.en:
Graciana is 70 years old. She is a person very dedicated to carrying out the domestic role of her home, caring for her family and the less fortunate. She was raised by parents who were supportive and instilled good principals in her which she has put into practice and has help her to come out ahead in life. Her family is comprised of her husband and two children who are currently enrolled in the community school. 

Graciana makes a living raising pigs who are then sold, as well as taking care of cattle. She learned this work from her grandmother who dedicated her entire life to raising domesticated animals, work that served to provide the family's basic necessities. Graciana's grandchildren are the ones who help her with the work she does. 

The loan would be used to purchase materials for the improvement of the farm where the pigs are cared for, also to buy vitamins for them. The projections she has for the future are to establish the pig farm more formally with the construction of facilities more adequately suited for the care of the pigs and acquiring another loan for the purchase of milk cows.

loans.use: to purchase materials for the improvement of the farm where the pigs are cared for, also to buy vitamins for them.

loans.name: Raquel

texts.es:
La Sra. Raquel es estudiante de la carrera de Administración de Empresas, actualmente está cursando el cuarto año de la carrera, la misma se dedica a la reparación de arpas y guitarras, trabaja de manera independiente, tiene casa propia en la ciudad de Luque. 
Pide este préstamo para poder pagar las cuotas de su carrera y de esa forma poder seguir con sus estudios como lo viene haciendo.
texts.en:
Señora Raquel is a student in the Business Administration degree program, and she is currently in her fourth year.  She also works freelance repairing harps and guitars. She has her own house in the city of Luque.

She is requesting this loan so that she can pay her university fees, and can thus continue with her studies as she has been doing.

loans.use: to pay her university fees.

loans.name: Raji

texts.en:
Raji is a 21-year-old, single man who started a few months ago, working as a rescuer in a swimming pool to cover his needs and expenses. Due to the low financial situation of his family, he took the responsibility to work and satisfy his needs. 

Raji is a hard worker, full of spirit and ambition. Today, he is acquiring a Youth loan from Kiva's field partner, Al Majmoua Lebanese Association for Development, to open his own entertainment shop and buy a billiard table, which will help him attract customers. 

Raji hopes to succeed in this business, to increase his income, and to improve his living conditions.

loans.use: to open his own entertainment shop and buy a billiard table.

loans.name: Marilou

texts.en:
Marilou is a married woman with five children, selling seafood products like fish in the market earning a good living. For five years she has been able to support her children's education through running the business. 

She used her previous loan from GDMPC micro credit for her business and it was successfully repaid. Recently, she borrowed a new loan to purchase additional sea food to resell. Marilou is hopeful to generate more profit from her business to improve the general living of her family.

loans.use: To buy parts for her fishing boat repair.

loans.name: Cecilia

texts.en:
Cecilia works hard to support her family. Cecilia is married and has a buy and sell frozen foods business in the Philippines.

Cecilia requested a PHP 15000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stocks of frozen foods to sell to her customers.

Cecilia has been in this business for 10 years now.

In the future, Cecilia would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks of frozen foods to sell to her customers

loans.name: Marites

texts.en:
Marites works hard to support her family. Marites is married and has a food vending business in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy ingredients like rice, meat and other frozen products to sell.

Marites has been in this business for 12 years now.

In the future, Marites would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy ingredients like rice, meat and other frozen products to sell

loans.name: Charlyn

texts.en:
Charlyn is 36 years old and has four children. Charlyn is married and has four children who are in school.

Charlyn is in the agricultural business, pig fattening in the Philippines. Charlyn requested a PHP 13000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pigs.

Charlyn has been in pig fattening for 7 years now, and has borrowed 8 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Charlyn would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pigs

loans.name: Hong

texts.en:
Mrs. Hong is a hardworking woman, 24 years old. She is married and has a baby. Her family’s income is mainly from fishing and animal husbandry. 

She would like to borrow the loan to build a latrine, which can help to improve the health of her family’s member. With support from her husband, she is able to repay the loan monthly.

loans.use: To build a latrine to improve the health of her family

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita is 59 years old and a very hard working entrepreneur.

Teresita has a fish vending business in the Philippines. Teresita requested a PHP 11000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more fish to sell to her customers.

Teresita has been in this business for 5 years. In the future, Teresita would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell to her customers

loans.name: Wilber Alfredo

texts.es: Wilber de 35 años de edad que habita en vivienda propia con sus dos hijos de 7 y 13 años de edad. Él es un hombre trabajador que se dedica a la venta de tostadas de yuca, plátanos y papas, dicha venta la realiza de manera ambulante, es así como genera sus ingresos con los que brinda todos los insumos necesarios del hogar y además ha sacado adelante a sus hijos. Wilber desea realizar unas reparaciones en su vivienda en la parte de la cocina por lo que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: lámina, cemento, ladrillos, arena, etc., para el mejoramiento de la cocina de la vivienda.
texts.en:
Wilber is 35 years old and lives in his own home with his children, ages 7 and 13. He is a hardworking man who works selling yucca chips, plantains, and potatoes as a street vendor. This way he generates income with which he provides for all basic household needs, in addition to getting his children ahead. 

Wilber hopes to do some repairs on home in the area of his kitchen. For this reason he is requesting a loan from FUSAI to invest in:  metal sheets, cement, bricks, sand, etc., to improve his home's kitchen.

loans.use: to invest in: metal sheets, cement, bricks, sand, etc., to improve his home's kitchen

loans.name: Narissa

texts.en:
Narissa is a married woman with three children. She is 32 years old and two of her children are currently in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur.

Narissa has a fish vending business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 5 years. Narissa requested a PHP 12,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more fish to sell to her customers.

In the future, Narissa would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell to her customers

loans.name: Eduarda

texts.en:
Eduarda is a married woman with eight children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Eduarda is 52 years old, and three of her children are still in school.

Eduarda has a buy-and-sell herbal medicine business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 12,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase more herbal medicines to sell.

Eduarda has been in this business for six years. In the future, she would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more herbal medicines to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy cattle and pigs for breeding and then sell them at the street markets

loans.name: Merry Shg-A Group

texts.en:
Bibina, 23 years old, is courageous and ambitious. She is living with her parents, husband and children. Bibina is standing on the right hand side in the photograph. She owns and manages a Ladies Novelty Store where she sells bangles, bindis (forehead stickers), nail colors, lip colors, hair accessories, ready-made garments and other fashion accessories. She earns 4,000 INR per month from this activity but this is not sufficient for her to run her family. Her husband is a fisherman. She has a plan to enhance her Ladies Novelty Corner by adding more products like cosmetics, hair oil, shampoo, body talc, body deodorant, and other fashion accessories.

She says that doing so will improve her earnings and her family’s status. She, along with her group member, has requested a loan of 36,000 INR. She will use her portion of the loan amount for purchasing the above items for her Ladies Novelty Corner.

She has a dream of educating her children and helping her husband financially to manage the family.

loans.use: to add more stocks like cosmetics, hair oil, shampoo, body talc, body deodorant, and other fashion accessories.

loans.name: Danilo

texts.en:
Danilo is 47 years old, married and lives in Amulung with his family. He is a farmer and a hog raiser. He had three children and wants to increase his earning due to increasing expenses of his family. 

He is now asking for additional capital of P50,000 to invest in his rice-field. He will buy fertilizers and insecticides used in farming. He will also pay labor cost for farming. This additional capital will help sustain his crops for good nutrition. 

He hopes to harvest fruitful crops someday. He will pay back his loan in full.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and insecticides use in farming. He will also pay labor cost

loans.name: Teresa

texts.en:
Teresa is a 43-year-old woman from Trinidad, Bohol. She is married and has four children. To earn a living, she and her husband are engaged in making furniture. They have been doing this for 16 years.

Teresa wants to increase their livelihood for a better living. She dreams of sending all her children to school and and for them to finish their degrees. With this in mind, she is requesting funds to buy new materials for making furniture such as a drill and a blade for their planer.

loans.use: to buy a drill and a blade for her planer.

loans.name: Marcianita

texts.en:
Marcianita is 56 years old and married with five children. With one child still in school, Marcianita works very hard to provide for them.

Marcianita runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional items like canned goods, snack foods, soft-drinks, coffee, sugar, etc. to sell.

Marcianita has been in this business for 4 years and sells a variety of items such as canned goods, snack foods, soft-drinks, coffee, sugar, etc.

Marcianita would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional items like canned goods, snack foods, soft-drinks, coffee, sugar, etc. to sell.

loans.name: Ibtisam

texts.en:
Ibtisam is a wife who has a lot of will power and can overcome all the obstacles in her life,
Her husband retired after he suffered a serious illness and it has become necessary for her to care for him and help him to take treatment.  She decided to do her best and by working hard to be able to help her husband and to ensure a living for her children.

Ibtisam is 41 years old married woman and lives in Irbid with her five children and her husband. She opened her small business which selling ready- clothes at her home to stay near her husband and her children and she is working hard to provide a living for her family.

She is a very ambitious and patient woman, so now she wants to buy more clothes and new products to sell but she does not has enough money. Therefore she decided to apply for a loan to increase her income and to be able to cover the treatment expenses for her husband and also to improve the standards of living for her children, to help her buy what she needs and to achieve her dreams.

loans.use: to buy more clothes and new products to sell, to help her sick husband

loans.name: Merry Shg-C Group

texts.en:
Sara is 44 years old and married with two children. She hails from a small village in Koraput district, Odisha, India.She is the one standing on the extreme left in the photo. Sara is a part of a self help group that exists in her village. Sara works in agriculture, raising poultry. Sara has been involved in this business for 12 years. She is a very hardworking woman, as she works from 6 a.m. to 8 p.m. daily to care for her poultry business. However, the thing that she lacks is access to clean water.

She says, "we drink well water, we wash our clothes with contaminated river water, and we are sick all the time because we drink dirty water...". The advantage of this town is that the goverment has granted them the right to use drinking water; the disadvantage is the lack of capital to install a drinking water system in her kitchen, bathroom and laundry room. Her dream is to use drinking water. She wants to install this system in the kitchen, bathroom and laundry room so her family can stop drinking dirty water.

For this reason, Sara, along with her group members, is asking for a loan of 45,000 INR. She will use her portion of the loan amount to install a drinking water system in her kitchen, bathroom and laundry room so that she can stop drinking dirty water.

loans.use: to install a drinking water system in her kitchen, bathroom and laundry room so that she can stop drinking dirty water.

loans.name: Merry Shg-B Group

texts.en:
Mebebis, a 27-year-old woman from a village in Koraput district, Odisha, is a an agricultural laborer and a successful micro-entrepreneur. The lady standing to the right in the photo is Mebebis. She toils hard in the fields to earn a minimal daily-wage income. She concurrently runs her animal husbandry business, which allows her to use the little time she has left after her full-time work. Presently she has two cows. With a household size of six, her family struggles to meet the expenses, let alone save some money for the future. They earn a monthly income of 4,000 INR, out of which 3,000 INR goes out as expenses. This means savings of 1,000 INR, if they don't have any unexpected expenses for the month.

Mebebis is not a woman who will sit back and accept the circumstances. She doesn't want to leave a stone unturned to ensure that her family is headed towards a reliable future. She wants to expand her business by buying a cow. She expects to increase her monthly income by 2,000 INR with this investment. She, along with her group member, is seeking a loan of 36,000 INR. Mebebis will use her portion of the loan amount to buy a cow.

She hopes to have a good amount of savings and have her own house.

loans.use: to buy a cow

loans.name: Leonia

texts.en:
Leonia is applying for a loan of $ 1.000.00 from TRM (TubaRaiMetin). She is 38 years old. She runs a kiosk in front of her house and she will use the loan to buy stock to keep in her store such as  Noodles,cigarettes, sugar, salt, milk, water, a refrigerator, fanta, cocacola, sagiko, sprite, beer and eggs. She is making good money from selling and she wants to apply for bigger loan in the future. 
Leonia is living in a town near by the school; her kiosk is located in a strategic place where many people come to buy including students.

loans.use: To buy Noodles, cigarettes,sugar, salt, milk, water, a refrigerator, fanta, cocacola, sagiko, sprite, beer, eggs

loans.name: Canh

texts.en:
Mrs. Canh, age 62, has three children. She lives in a rural area. She raises and sells small animals like pigs, chickens, hens, and ducks, among others. Her business is located at her house. She has 20 years of experience in the business, and she has very good personal and work references in the area.

The loan she is requesting will be used to buy more animals like hens, ducks, and chickens, among others. She will also buy balanced feed for them. By doing so, she hopes to offer her customers a better product.

loans.use: to buy more animals like pigs, hens, ducks, and chickens, among others, to generate greater income.

loans.name: Nyamvula

texts.en:
Nyamvula is a married woman with five children, all of whom attend school. She lives at her own  house that neither has electricity nor piped water.

She has operated a retail shop business for the past six years, selling household consumables like wheat flour, maize flour, bar soap,cooking fat and sugar. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her place of operation.

With the loan, she is requesting she wants to purchase stock of sugar, rice, maize flour,bar soaps ,cooking fat and wheat flour. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business

loans.use: to purchase stock of sugar, rice, maize flour, bar soaps, cooking fat and wheat flour

loans.name: Mohammad

texts.en:
Mohammad is Syrian and a 42-year-old married father of five children. Thirteen years ago, he started repairing laptops to cover the needs and expenses of his family. He started repairs as a hobby, but his professional skills pushed him to open his own business.

Mohammad is a hard worker who has a good reputation in his area. He is trying desperately to develop his business, so today he is acquiring a loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua. He will use it to buy the necessary spare parts and tools to facilitate his work and allow him to provide his customers with a better service.

Mohammad hopes to expand his business more in the future to increase his income and improve his living conditions.

loans.use: to buy the necessary spare parts and tools for his laptop repair business.

loans.name: Rasha

texts.en:
Rasha is 44-year-old divorced woman with one child. She is working in a public sector with low income and she always wanted to provide the good life to her child, she likes her job so much because she likes to feel her independence. 

She inspired the idea of her business from her child who likes sports, so she opened a shop for selling the sports supplies and clothes. And she is now adding more variety to the shop to attract more customers.

Rasha wants to expand her work to increase her incomes, and to cover her child`s education fees, therefore she applied for a loan to help her buy more clothes and sports supplies to sell.

loans.use: to add more variety of clothes for sale in her sports shop

loans.name: Umaza

texts.en:
Umaza is married and has four children all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

For the past four years, she has owned a food stall business, where neighbours and town dwellers come to shop. She faces a major challenge of fluctuations in the number of clients hence perishable goods can lead to losses.

With the KES 40,000 she wants to purchase stocks of goods like sugar, rice, maize and wheat flour, cooking fat and oil. She dreams of expanding her business into a modern café.

loans.use: to purchase stocks of goods like sugar, rice, maize and wheat flour, cooking fat and oil.

loans.name: Emmanuel

texts.en:
Emmanuel is married and has been blessed with four school going children. He owns a house that has electricity and piped water. His greatest monthly expenses are for food and school fees.

For the past six years, he has operated a dairy farming business, selling as retail at the market and to his local residents and restaurant operators. He faces a major challenge of seasonality in his place of operation. He dreams of adding more dairy cows and expand to a motorcycle business. 

With the Kshs 50,000 he wants to purchase medicine for his livestock and cow feed. He decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost his business.

loans.use: to purchase medicine for livestock and cow feed

loans.name: Amina

texts.en:
Amina is a married woman with six children, all of whom attend school. She lives in her own house that has no electricity, but  has piped water.

She has operated a retail shop business for the past three years, selling household consumables like wheat flour, maize flour, and sugar. She faces a major challenge of creditors taking too long to repay for goods taken on credit. 

With the loan she is requesting she wants to purchase stocks of sugar, rice, maize flour and wheat flour. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business

loans.use: to purchase stocks of sugar, rice, maize flour and wheat flour

loans.name: Andrés Bladimir

texts.es:
Andrés de 21 años de edad, es un joven muy laborioso conocido en su comunidad por ser honesto  y trabajador, desde los 16 años que terminó de estudiar el bachillerato se ha dedicado  a trabajar como árbitro, actualmente vive en la casa de sus padres pero les ayuda en los gastos del hogar.


Andrés trabaja de árbitro desde hace 3 años, y esta iniciativa fue porque vio una gran necesidad en su familia ya que no progresaba y decidió buscar una fuente de ingresos para ayudarles a sus padres.

Andrés necesita este crédito para comprar unos banderines y ropa para ejercer su trabajo como árbitro ya que son requisitos indispensables para su trabajo y además quiere ayudar a comprar  fertilizantes para la siembra de su padre.

En el futuro planea conformar una familia, y tener su casa propia.
texts.en: Andrés is 21 years old. He is a very hardworking young man, well-known in his community for his honesty and work ethic. When he was 16 he ended his high school studies. He makes a living working as a referee. He now lives in his parents' house but helps them with the household costs. Andrés has worked as a referee for 3 years, and took this initiative because he saw a great need in his family and no progress. He decided to seek a source of income to help his parents. Andrés needs this loan to buy pennants and clothing which are essential requirements for his work as a referee. Also, he wants to help buy fertilizer for his father's plants. In future he plans to have a family and his own home.

loans.use: to buy pennants and clothing to practice his work as a referee and also he wants to help his father buy fertilizers for his plants

loans.name: Sabrine

texts.en:
Sabrine is a 33-year-old married mother of two children. Almost three years ago, she started renting bicycles in a park to help her husband in covering the needs and expenses of their family. She is well-known among her customers and has a good reputation in this park.

Today, Sabrine is acquiring a loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua to repair her bicycles which will help her provide her customers with safe rides.

Sabrine hopes to expand her business more in the future to increase her income and improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to repair her bicycles to provide her customers with safe rides.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more vegetables such as tomatoes, spinach, water spinach, cabbage and chili.

loans.name: Luisa

texts.en: Luisa is taking a loan of $800.00 to improve her business. She is running a kiosk that helps her to generate income for her family. She will use the loan to buy stock to keep in her store such asfish, cigarettes, sugar, salt, milk, water, soap, noodles, eggs and coffee. She opened her kiosk a year ago with her own working capital of $600.00.  She is a hardworking woman and she hopes to run a bigger business in the future.

loans.use: To buy fish, cigarettes, sugar, salt, milk, water, soap, noodles, eggs and coffee.

loans.name: Pilar

texts.en:
Pilar works hard to support her family. Pilar is married and has a buy-and-sell rice business in the Philippines.

Pilar requested a PHP 11,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional sacks of rice to sell.

Pilar has been in this business for four years now.

Pilar would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional sacks of rice to sell.

loans.name: Samah

texts.en:
Samah is a 35-year-old married woman from Dier-Albalah city, which is located in the Gaza Strip and suffers from power outages 12-16 hours a day regularly. she lives with her husband and four children in a small house. As an employee in the public sector, her husband earns a low income. This income barely covers all the family's needs. 

Because he is not able to save enough money, Samar took a USD loan from FATEN.  With this loan, she will buy a solar system for heating water for the family house.  Palestinians use water boilers that use either gas or gasoline to heat the water before a shower, which can be dangerous, expensive and inefficient.  This will help her to provide hot water without using electricity, which is much more expensive.

loans.use: to buy a solar system for heating water for the family house.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase pig's fodder

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: purchase many kind of vegetables such as; water spinach, cabbage, chili; tomato; eggplant; spinach, etc

loans.name: Erna

texts.en:
Erna works hard to support her family. Erna is widowed and has a fishing business in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 25000 loan through NWTF to buy additional fishing net for her business.

Erna has been in this business for 24 years now, and also earns additional income from buy and sell fish.

In the future, Erna would like to build and expand her business to secure the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional fishing nets for her business

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en:
Gloria works hard to support her family. Gloria is married and has a native mats making business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 3 years now.

Gloria requested a PHP 5,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional raw materials for her business.

In the future, Gloria would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional raw materials for her mat making business.

loans.name: Iman

texts.en:
Iman is 41-year-old lives in Wihdat and a married woman. Iman is a responsible, welcoming and pleasant woman. She opened her business where she sews and does embroidery on women's clothes and coats from individual orders that she receives at her home. 

She has applied for a loan in order to improve her shop and buy more sewing machines and to buy fabrics, so that she can sew a greater variety of clothes. This loan will allow her to purchase more fabrics and attract a larger number of customers. Please help Iman to meet her goals.  She needs your support.

loans.use: to purchase more fabrics for her embroidery business

loans.name: Chizi

texts.en:
Chizi is a married and has been blessed with six children. She owns a house that neither has electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

For the past ten years, she has operated a dairy farming business, selling milk as retail and at the market to local residents and restaurant operators. She faces the major challenge of seasonality in her place of operation. She dreams of adding more dairy cows.
With the Kshs. 30,000 she wants to purchase medicine for livestock and cow feed. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase medicine for livestock and cow feed.

loans.name: Sonia Maristela

texts.es:
Sonia de 32 años de edad, se dedica a los oficios domésticos también se dedica a la ganadería, ella se creció con su abuela quien se dedicaba al cuido de ganado y  oficios domésticos,  es una mujer muy educada y trabajadora. 
Su abuela fue la encargada de inculcar principios morales y son los que la han llevado a salir adelante en la vida, es una persona muy reconocida por sus actividades productivas también por pertenecer a la asociación de desarrollo comunal.

Sonia tiene una experiencia de 5 años en realizar trabajos de ganadería, actividad que aprendió de su abuela quien se dedicó toda su vida a lo mismo, y fue quien le inculcó buenas ideas y principios para poder salir adelante.



El dinero será utilizado para comprar concentrado para el ganado ya que tiene dos vacas recién paridas y  es necesario que prepare el alimento para el transcurso del periodo de lactancia. 


Sus metas para un futuro son haber cancelado el crédito y adquirir otro para el mejoramiento de las instalaciones donde reposa el ganado también pretende invertir en una picadora de zacate para dar alimento fresco a los animales.
texts.en:
Sonia is 32 years old. She works doing household chores and has 5 years of experience working in the animal husbandry field. She grew up with her grandmother, who worked doing the same her entire life. She is a very well educated and hard-working woman.

Her grandmother was also the one in charge of instilling moral values in her, and these have led her to get ahead in life. Sonia is well known for her productive activities as well as for being a part of the Communal Development Asociation.

She will use the loan money to buy feed for cattle, as she has 2 recently born calves and she needs to have the food ready for the duration of the lactation period.

Her goals for the future are to liquidate her loan and to get another one so she can improve the place where she keeps her cattle as well as to invest in a grass grinder so she can give fresh food to her animals.

loans.use: to buy feed for her cattle, as she has 2 recently born calves and she needs to have the food ready for the duration of the lactation period.

loans.name: Janeth

texts.en:
Janeth is 36 years old and married with five children.  

Janeth is in the agricultural business, raising livestock in the Philippines. Janeth requested a PHP 5000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and other supplies to raise her livestock.

Janeth has been raising livestock for 15 years and has borrowed 2 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

Janeth would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy feed and other supplies to raise her livestock

loans.name: Myagmar

texts.en:
Mr. Myagmar, 30 years old, lives with his wife and daughter in Ulaanbaatar, capital city of Mongolia. He has been transporting people between districts since 2012. His wife helps him by working as cash collector at his microbus. Their daughter stays at kindergarten during day time. 

Using his previous loan he has insulated his Mongolian traditional ger, creating a comfortable and warm place for his family.  

Now he is requesting a loan of 800 USD to buy spare parts in order to repair his microbus, which is the main income source of his family. The borrower is very hardworking person who strives for a better future.

loans.use: to repair his microbus

loans.name: Razan Group

texts.en:
Ghada is the featured borrower for Razan Group. She got together with her other group members to take this Al Majmoua loan because they have always been neighbors and friends. They are working hard to develop their businesses and living at the same time.
Ghada is a 53-year-old married mother who has been selling clothes for the past 22 years to help her husband cover their family’s needs and living expenses. She is a hard worker and ambitious woman who has a good reputation among her region. Today, she is acquiring a loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua to increase her business merchandise with a new collection of summer clothes to satisfy her customers' needs. Ghada is the lady in the middle. 
With respect to the other group members, Mariam is the first lady on the right, and Manal is the first lady on the left of the photo.

loans.use: to increase her merchandise with a new collection of summer clothes.

loans.name: Reem

texts.en:
Reem is a 45-year-old married mother of four children and a Palestinian refugee who live in a Palestinian refugee camp. Due to the low financial and social situations of Palestinians in Lebanon, she opened almost a year ago a grocery shop to help her husband in covering the needs and expenses of their family.

Reem is a hard worker and ambitious woman who is trying desperately to develop her business, thus today she is acquiring a loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua to increase her business merchandise with newly requested items and products to satisfy her customers' needs. 

Reem hopes to develop her business more in the future to increase her income and improve her family's living conditions inside the camp.

loans.use: to increase her merchandise with newly requested items and products

loans.name: Eunice

texts.en:
Eunice is 44 years old. She is married and they have three children. She sells goats as well as operating a beauty salon and has been in business for  years. This is her first loan from VisionFund Kenya. 

She will use the loan to buy goats for sale and shampoos, soap, lotions and weaves for the beauty salon. She will use profits from the business to expand her beauty salon.Her hopes and dreams for the future are to have a successful business.

loans.use: to buy more goats and also shampoos, soap, lotions and treatment chemicals for her beauty salon

loans.name: Soledad

texts.en:
Soledad is 62 years old and married with six children, one of whom is in school.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a buy-and-sell dry goods business in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stock to sell.

Soledad has borrowed and repaid 5 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the buy-and-sell dry goods business for 5 years and also earns an income from buying and selling dried fish and sea cucumbers. She successfully paid back her previous loan, and now she has requested an additional loan to further build her business.

She aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks to sell

loans.name: Terina

texts.en:
Terina is a hardworking entrepreneur.  She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 50000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, noodles, milk, soft drinks, etc.

She industriously earns additional income through other business ventures like buy and sell hard woods and raising pigs.

She successfully paid back her previous loan, and now she has requested an additional loan to further build her business.

Terina dreams that one day she will be able to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, noodles, milk, soft drinks, etc

loans.name: Chanda

texts.en:
Chanda is 38 years old and married with three children, who are in school.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 45,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stock of canned goods, soft drinks, eggs, milk, soaps, shampoos, etc.

Chanda has borrowed and repaid 22 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 16 years and also earns an income from buying and selling charcoal and hardwoods.

She aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock of canned goods, soft drinks, eggs, milk, soaps, shampoos, etc.

loans.name: Merlita

texts.en:
Merlita is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a fishing business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 12,000 through NWTF to buy fishing materials like fishing net, gasoline and bamboo for her fishing business.

Merlita has been in this business for eight years. Merlita earns more income from tailoring.

She has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts and with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving money to expand her business and saving enough money so she can afford to send her children to college in the future.

loans.use: to buy fishing materials like fishing net, gasoline and bamboo.

loans.name: Adriana Nohemy

texts.es:
Adriana de 46 años de edad, logró culminar sus estudios  superiores de periodismo en la universidad, gracias  al  esfuerzo y sacrificio de sus padres que  ella  supo  compensar  triunfando  en su carrera, estuvo casada y procreó 3 hijos de los cuales dos viven con ella y estudian en la escuela de la comunidad.

Adriana se dedica a administrar su negocio de foto estudio, ya  tiene  más  de  10 años  en esto, ella  toma videos con efectos especiales, ampliación de  fotografías, enmarcado de  títulos, fotos digitales, etc. también  en su negocio vende  teléfonos, accesorios y chips. Ella sale a tomar  videos para  todo evento social, también  con su hija tienen negocio de  venta  de  banquetes  y pasteles personalizados para toda celebración.


Ella necesita el crédito para comprar materiales para  su  negocio  de la  foto estudio, y comprar insumos para invertir en el negocio de banquetes.

Ella sueña con darle  el acceso al estudio  a  sus  hijos  y  que  puedan ser  personas  de  bien, también  desea  que   su negocio  siga creciendo  y  a futuro  poder ampliarlo.
texts.en:
Adriana, who is 46 years old, finished her studies in Journalism at the university. It was thanks to the effort and sacrifice of her parents that she was able to reward them by finishing her studies. She was married and gave birth to 3 children, 2 of which still live with her and study at the neighborhood school.

Adriana works administrating her photo studio business and has been doing so for over 10 years. She takes videos with special effects, enlarges photographs, and provides frames for digital pictures, degrees, etc. She also sells phones, accessories and telephone chips at her business. She goes out to record videos for all types of social events, and with her daughter she has a business of catering and personalized cakes for all occasions.

She needs this loan to buy materials for her photo studio, and to invest in the purchase of ingredients for her catering business.

She dreams of giving her children the opportunity to study so that they can become upstanding people, and also wishes for her business to continue growing and to be able to expand it.

loans.use: to buy materials for her photo studio, and to invest in the purchase of ingredients for her catering business.

loans.name: Mbeyu

texts.en:
Mbeyu is a married woman with five children, all of whom attend school. She lives at her own house that has neither electricity nor piped water.

She has operated a retail shop business for the past four years, selling household consumables like wheat flour, maize flour, and sugar. She faces a major challenge of creditors taking too long to repay for goods taken on credit.

With the loan she is requesting, she wants to purchase stocks of sugar, rice, maize flour and wheat flour. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase stocks of sugar, rice, maize flour and wheat flour.

loans.name: Fátima Del Rosario

texts.es:
Fátima de 30 años de edad, es un mujer que se desempeña como promotora de salud, ademas es comerciante de  ropa, está casada y solo tiene un hijo.

Fátima   tiene mas de 5 años de experiencia en el comercio  de ropa, sale  vende casa por casa, esto lo hace después que termina su trabajo como promotora de salud.



Ella solicita este crédito para comprar en ropa para  vender y cubrir la demanda de clientes. 

Fátima tiene  planeado para un futuro poner un local para establecer un bazar de ropa, donde pueda mostrar de mejor forma al público sus productos.
texts.en:
30-year-old Fátima is a woman who makes a living as a health worker, and she also sells clothes, she is married and has only one son.

Fátima has more than 5 years’ experience in the clothes business, she sells from door to door, which she does after finishing her work as a health worker.

She is requesting this loan to buy clothes to sell, and cover her customers’ demands.

Fátima has plans to find a premises where she can establish a clothes store, where she will be able to better display her products to the public.

loans.use: to buy clothes to sell, to cover her customers' demands.

loans.name: Donika

texts.en: Donika wants your financial help again to stock up her food store with inventory items that are needed.  He shop is located in a village.

loans.use: to stock up on inventory items in her food store

loans.name: Liza

texts.es:
Con 21 años Liza está cursando el 5to año de la carrera de derecho, trabajo desde los 14 años, vendiendo cajas por la calle, luego de vendedora, en boutique, atención al cliente toda mi carrera.
Ella es una señora muy trabajadora que lucha por poder ser alguien en la vida.
Pide este préstamo para poder pagar sus cuotas y de esa forma poder seguir con sus estudios.
texts.en:
At twenty-one years old, Liza is studying in her fifth year of the Law degree program. "I've worked since I was fourteen years old: as a street vendor, selling boxes, and later as a salesgirl in a boutique, serving the customer throughout my career".  She is a hardworking young lady who fights to be able to be someone in life.

She is requesting this loan so that she will be able to pay her university fees, and thus be able to continue with her studies.

loans.use: to pay her university fees.

loans.name: Ibtissam

texts.en:
Ibtissam is a 32-year-old married mother of three children and a Palestinian refugee who lives in a Palestinian refugee camp. She sells clothes and shoes to help her husband in covering the needs and expenses of their family. At the beginning, She was employed in an ice cream shop with a limited low daily salary, but with her hard work and ambition she owned a clothing shop and lately she opened a grocery shop.
Today Ibtissam is acquiring loan from Kiva partner Al Majmoua to develop her new grocery shop business and increase her business merchandise with more requested items and products to satisfy her customers' needs inside the camp.
Ibtissam is working towards expanding her business and increasing her income so as to improve her family's socioeconomic situation.

loans.use: to develop her new grocery shop business and increase her merchandise with more requested items and products.

loans.name: Purity

texts.en:
Purity is 26 years old single and blessed with two children of ages between five to seven years old.She has been selling milk for the last two years earning a monthly income of KES.15,000.

She has borrowed a loan of KES.30,000 which she will the entire loan amount to purchase milk containers  and add more stock of milk from producers to sell to her customers. 

She plans to use the anticipated profits to pay fees for her children.

loans.use: to purchase milk containers and add more stock of milk from producers

loans.name: Teresa

texts.en:
Teresa is a married woman with six children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Teresa is 55 years old and has one child who is still in school.

Teresa has a general store business in the Philippines. Teresa requested a PHP 10,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell in her general store.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

Teresa has been in this business for three years. Teresa would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Lorna

texts.en:
Lorna is a hardworking woman entrepreneur with five children. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stocks of can goods, egg, milk, soap, shampoo, etc.

She industriously earns additional income through other business ventures like farming rice and raising pigs.

Lorna dreams that one day she will be able to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks of canned goods, eggs, milk, soap, shampoo, etc

loans.name: Tsovinar

texts.en: This nice woman is 38 years old and she lives with her son and daughter in Sevan city of the Gegharkunik region. Her name is Tsovinar and she is a widow. Tsovinar’s son is going into the army and her daughter is a student now. Tsovinar for many years worked at the kindergarten and now she works at the railway station as a dispatcher. Tsovinar is very fragile and at the same time very strong and laborious woman and since her husband died she accepted all difficulties of the life and solved each of them patiently and also managed to bring up perfect children. Now this woman needs some financial support as her salary does not allow her to solve her dental problems with her own income. With this Kiva loan she wants to solve her dental problems, which disturb her very much, and are a great discomfort for her every day.

loans.use: to solve her dental problems, which disturb her very much, and are a great discomfort for her every day

loans.name: Melanie

texts.en:
Melanie is a 25-year-old married mother of three children who are all in school. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. 

Melanie has a pig-fattening business in the Philippines. Melanie requested a PHP 6,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Melanie has been in this business for two years. In the future, Melanie would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Jira

texts.en:
Jira is a married man and has been blessed with four school-going children. He owns a house that neither has electricity nor piped water. His greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

For the past ten years, he has operated a dairy farming business, selling milk as retail and at the market to his local residents and restaurant operators. He faces a major challenge of seasonality in his place of operation. He dreams of adding more dairy cows.
With the Kshs. 40,000 he wants to purchase medicine for livestock and cow feed. He decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost his business.

loans.use: to purchase medicine for livestock and cow feed.

loans.name: Umazi

texts.en:
Umazi is a married woman with three children, all of whom attend school. She lives at her own house that neither has electricity nor piped water.

She has operated a retail shop business for the past two years, selling household consumables like wheat flour, maize flour, and sugar. She faces a major challenge of creditors staying for long to repay for goods taken on credit. 

With the loan, she is requesting she wants to purchase stock of sugar, rice, maize flour and wheat flour. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase stock of sugar, rice, maize flour and wheat flour

loans.name: Angelina

texts.es:
Angelina de 50 años de edad, está casada y su esposo es agricultor, tiene 4 hijos los cuales ya son mayores de edad.

Angelina junto a su familia realizan actividades agrícolas desde su niñez, además ella se dedica a la crianza de gallinas y cerdos para luego venderlos en las comunidades.

Ella necesita el crédito para comprar insumos agrícolas para realizar la siembra y para preparar la tierra.

Ella sueña con trabajar duro para conseguir sus metas con la ayuda de esta institución que le tiende la mano en todo momento.
texts.en:
Angelina is 50 years old and is married. Her husband is a farmer. They have 4 children, all of which are adults now.

Angelina and her family work in farming since they were children. She also works in the raising of pigs and chicken for their sale in the neighboring communities.

She needs the loan so she can purchase farming supplies and be able to sow and prepare the land for it.

She dreams of working hard so she can accomplish her goals with the help of this institution, which has supported her at all times.

loans.use: to buy farming supplies so she can sow and prepare the land for it.

loans.name: Muhamet

texts.en:
Muhamet is not done yet with improvement of his old and poorly built home and for this he needs your compassion and understanding this time again. 
Kindly note that Muhamet is member of the Egyptian Albanian community and is indeed very vulnerable.

loans.use: to continue repairing his home.

loans.name: José Pascual

texts.es:
José de 25 años de edad, es un agricultor que vive con su mujer y su hijo, y siempre ha tratado de sacar adelante su familia mediante el trabajo agrícola.

José  tiene 12 años  de experiencia en la actividad agrícola, junto a sus padre  siembran frijol y maíz, como parte del sostenimiento de la familia.


Con el crédito se le estará ayudando a José  a comprar todos los materiales agrícolas para proteger a la cosecha de las malezas, necesita el préstamo para comprarlos en el tiempo indicado, ya que las sequías dañaron parte de la primer siembra por lo que tendrá que sembrar más para salvar la cosecha.

José  planea en el futuro comprar un molino a su mujer para que obtenga ingresos adicionales y pueda ayudarle con los gastos del hogar.
texts.en:
25-year-old José is a farmer who lives with his wife and their son, and he has always tried to do the best for his family through agricultural work.

José has 12 years’ experience in farming, along with his father he plans corn and beans, as their way of supporting the family.

The loan will help José to buy all the agricultural materials to protect his crops from weeds, he needs the loan to buy them now because a drought damaged part of the first crop, meaning he will have to plant more to save the harvest. 

José has plans in the future to buy a mill for his wife, so that he can increase income and she can help him with the household costs.

loans.use: to buy all the farming materials to protect his crops from weeds.

loans.name: Raphael

texts.en:
Raphael is a trained electrician and holds a craft apprentice certificate in electrical engineering. He is also licensed by the energy regulatory commission of Kenya as an electrician. He is now 45 years old.

He has been working for a long time as an electrician despite many challenges and lack of equipment. He would like to overcome those challenges and run a successful electrical contracting company.

He is applying for a loan to acquire the different tools necessary to run his business and become a successful electrical contractor. He will be able to employ young people from his community in order to empower them economically and help them realize their goals too.

loans.use: to purchase tools and equipment for his electrician business.

loans.name: Annastacia

texts.en:
Annastacia is 28 years old, married and blessed with two school-going children. She operates a beauty salon and has been in business for three years. 


This is her first loan from VisionFund Kenya. Annastacia will use the loan to buy shampoo, soap, lotion and weaves for the beauty salon. 


She will use profits from the business to expand her beauty salon and pay school fees for her children.  Her hope for the future is to have a successful business.

loans.use: to buy shampoo, soap, lotion and weaves for the beauty salon.

loans.name: Sonia

texts.en:
It was Sonia's privilege to be helped by Kiva to acquire her previous loan she used to buy equipment, supplies, and materials for her rental housing business. Because of that, there was great improvement in her apartments that attracted more tenants and most importantly, increased her profit. 

She wants to continue improving her rental units so she's requesting a new loan of PHP 35,000. She will use this loan for room extensions and repairs.

She wants to be successful in her business and build an affordable life for her family. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week, as well as to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay micro-finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for the repair and maintenance of her apartment units and to buy sacks of rice

loans.name: Paul

texts.en:
Paul is 22 years old. He is married and has no children. He has had a motorcycle business for five years. 

He will be using the loan to complete payment of another motorcycle and hopes this will help him open another business. His hopes and dreams for the future are to own a company and to live a better life.

loans.use: to complete payment of another motorcycle to help him open another business

loans.name: Natividad

texts.en:
Natividad is 56 years old and a very hard working entrepreneur. 

She has a business buying and selling assorted candies in the Philippines. Natividad requested a PHP 14,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more packs of assorted candies to sell to her customers. She earns additional income from a general store.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

Natividad has been in this business for six years. In the future, Natividad would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more packs of assorted candies to sell

loans.name: Helen

texts.en:
Helen works hard to support her family. Helen is married and has a food-production business in the Philippines.

Helen requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to buy ingredients like vegetables, meat, spices, and fish for her food-production business.

Helen has been in this business for three years now.

Helen would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy ingredients like vegetables, meat, spices, and fish,for her food-production business

loans.name: Raymonda

texts.en:
Raymonda works hard to support her family. Raymonda is married and has a buy-and-sell brooms business in the Philippines.

Raymonda requested a PHP 11,000 loan through NWTF to buy more brooms to sell to her customers.

Raymonda has been in this business for 16 years now.

Raymonda would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more brooms to sell to her customers

loans.name: Klodiana

texts.en: Klodiana bought a milk cow with the previous loan and now she wants to add another one. Her goal is to expand her livestock. The family's income includes two retirement pensions of her parents-in-law (249 USD/month) and her disability income (97 USD/month). All in all, she makes a little cash from her rural activities. At the moment, she has one cow. She also plants wheat and beans, lucerne and vetch, and fodder for the animals.

loans.use: to buy another milk cow

loans.name: Mnyazi

texts.en:
Mnyazi is a married woman with seven children. She lives in her own house that has neither electricity nor piped water.

Mnyazi has operated a retail shop business for the past six years, selling household consumables, like wheat flour, maize flour, and sugar. She faces a major challenge of creditors taking too long to pay for goods taken on credit. 

With the loan Mnyazi is requesting, she wants to purchase stocks of sugar, rice, maize flour, and wheat flour. She decided to join Yehu Microfinance Trust to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase stocks of sugar, rice, maize flour, and wheat flour.

loans.name: Liz

texts.es:
Liz hoy vive con sus padres, es de la ciudad de coronel Oviedo, y comenta que estudia la carrera de enfermería, a través de la cual quiere abrirse camino al mundo laboral.
Ella es una persona que pone todo de sí para poder ser una profesional útil a la sociedad.
Pide este préstamo para poder pagar las cuotas de su carrera, y de esa forma poder seguir con sus estudios.
texts.en:
Liz lives today with her parents in the city of Coronel Oviedo. She comments that she is studying Nursing and she wants to pave her way into the labor world doing this.

She is a person who is putting all her efforts into becoming a useful professional in her society.

She is requesting this loan to be able to pay the fees for her studies and in this way continue with her studies.

loans.use: to pay university fees.

loans.name: Leticia

texts.es:
Leticia proviene de una familia humilde y trabajadora que lucha por poder crecer y salir adelante.
Ella estudia la carrera de enfermería y por medio de su carrera quiere abrirse camino para poder ayudar a las demás personas.
Pide este préstamo para poder pagar las cuotas de su carrera y de esa forma poder seguir con sus estudios.
texts.en: Leticia comes from a humble and hardworking family that fights to be able to grow and get ahead. She studies nursing and through her career she wants to make her way to be able to help others. She is asking for this loan to be able to pay the fees for her career and thus be able to continue with her studies.

loans.use: to pay university fees

loans.name: Florence

texts.en:
Florence is 48 years old, a widow and has four children. She sells chicken and has been in business for the last 21 years. This is her third loan from VisionFund Kenya. 

She will use the loan to buy a water tank for water storage. She will use the profit from the business to expand the business to increase her income. Her dream is to have a well-established business.

loans.use: to buy a water tank

loans.name: Simeona

texts.en:
As a widowed parent of five children, Simeona works hard to support her family.

She has a general store business in the Philippines and earns additional income from raising pigs. Simeona is borrowing PHP 27,000 through NWTF to buy additional items like shampoo, noodles, cereals, milk, beers, and canned goods for her general store business.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

Simeona has been sustaining her business activities through her past 15 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional items to sell like shampoo, noodles, cereals, milk, beers, and canned goods.

loans.name: Arben

texts.en: Arben wants to buy more sheep with your loan. "Livestock is something that I want to expand on. It can be profitable, should things go all right," Arben said to the loan officer. Arben is holding the lamb in the photograph. He raises only sheep and owns some agricultural land where he plants mostly wheat and fodder.

loans.use: to add more sheep to his existing herd

loans.name: José Alexander

texts.es:
José es un joven muy trabajador de 25 años de edad, ya que busca opciones de trabajo para sacar adelante su familia, actualmente vive en la casa de su madre con su compañera de vida quien se dedica a los oficios domésticos, y su hija de tan solo 2 años de edad.

José es un hombre muy responsable  y dedicado totalmente a su familia, se dedica a la agricultura desde que tenía 10 años trabajando al lado de su padre que fue quien le enseñó a cultivar la tierra, José también trabaja en una horno de construcción de teja.

El préstamo será utilizado para comprar abonos y venenos para aplicarlos a sus cultivos de maíz pues tiene problema de plagas.
 
José en un futuro quiere construir una casa nueva para que sus hijos tengan un lugar más sano donde divertirse y sus futuras generaciones tengan mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
José is a hard-working young man of 25 years of age. He is looking for work opportunities so that he can provide for his family. He currently lives in his mother's house with his life partner, who tends to their home and to their daughter, who is only 2 years old. 

José is a very responsible man who is completely dedicated to his family. He has worked in agriculture since he was 10 years old, working alongside his father, who taught him how to tend the land. José also works at a furnace for making tiles.

This loan will be used to buy fertilizers and poisons to apply to his crops because he has an infestation problem.
 
In the future, José wants to build a new house so his children can have a better home to play in and so that future generations can have a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and poison to apply to his crops because he has an infestation problem

loans.name: Alhaji Usaini

texts.en: Alhaji Usaini is a Babban Gona farmer from Badamasi Village. He joined Babban Gona so that he could realize better yields on his farm. Since joining Babban Gona, Alhaji Usaini no longer has to worry about having inadequate income to increase his farmland. Through Babban Gona’s input loan he will have access to top-of-the-range farm inputs such as fertilizer, herbicide and improved seeds that will help him earn yields of up to 30 bags of maize/ hectare, double the national average in Nigeria.  This will see him increase his income considerably. Thanks to Babban Gona’s support, Alhaji Usaini now has the opportunity to acquire more land to put into the Babban Gona program.

loans.use: To purchase improved farm inputs that will increase yields

loans.name: Ley

texts.en:
Ley is a 50-year-old widowed mother with three children. She is a vegetable seller and has been in this selling business since 2005. She resides in a village in the Takeo Province in Cambodia. One of her children is a factory worker and two are the drivers. Ley and her children can earn approximately $22 per day. 

Ley is requesting a loan because she wants to buy a motorcycle for her children for commuting to work and family’s use. With this loan, she will have enough money to buy a motorcycle and improve her children's traveling conditions. In the future, Ley wants to expand her business and build a new proper house.

loans.use: to buy a motorcycle for her children for commuting to work and family’s use

loans.name: Marta

texts.es:
Marta esta poniendo lo mejor de si para poder ser una buena docente, y poder ayudar a las demás personas por medio de sus estudios, comenta que ella esta esforzándose cada día para poder lograr sus metas. Comenta que su préstamo anterior lo uso en poder pagar sus cuotas y lo cual le fue de mucha ayuda.
Hoy pide este nuevo préstamo para poder pagar nuevamente sus cuotas y de esa forma poder seguir con sus estudios.
texts.en:
Marta is doing her best to become a good teacher in order to put her studies to good use by helping others. She says she is working hard every day in order to achieve her goals. She used her previous loan to pay her fees, so it was of great help to her.

Today she is requesting a new loan to again pay her fees so that she can continue to work towards earning her degree.

loans.use: to pay college fees.

loans.name: Ricardo Antonio

texts.es: Luis de 35 años de edad vive en casa propia con sus dos hijos, el se dedica al cultivo de maíz y yuca desde hace mas de 6 años, guarda sus cosechas en sacos así como muestra la fotografía, vende sus productos en los alrededores de la zona donde el reside, el está solicitando un crédito para la compra de semillas, sulfatos, formula, herbicidas, foliares, entre otras cosas y así poder tener un buen cultivo para obtener mejores ganancias.
texts.en: Luis is 35 years old and he lives in his own house with his two children. He has worked growing corn and yucca for more than 6 years. He stores his harvest in sacks as shown in the photograph and sells his products in the area surrounding where he lives. He is requesting a loan to buy seeds, sulfates, fertilizer, herbicides and foliar sprays amongst others and in this way have a good harvest and obtain greater profits.

loans.use: to buy seeds, sulfates, fertilizer, herbicides and foliar sprays amongst others.

loans.name: Helmer Edgardo

texts.es: Helmer de 29 años de edad es un hombre trabajador que vive junto a su esposa desde hace ya varios años. Él desde muy temprano se despierta para prestar sus servicios de motorista en un microbús del transporte colectivo, actividad que le permite llevar el sustento a su hogar, además su esposa le apoya con su pequeño negocio de venta de productos de belleza por catálogo. Helmer se encuentra preocupado, ya que el techo de su vivienda se encuentra deteriorado, y ahora que empieza el invierno el agua ingresa a su vivienda, además una puerta de su vivienda se encuentra deteriorada, por lo que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: lámina galvanizada, madera, clavos y una puerta para mejorar el techo e instalar una puerta para proteger su hogar.
texts.en:
Helmer is 29 years old and is a hardworking man who has lived with his wife for many years. He wakes up very early to provide his services as a public transport minibus driver. This job provides him with a way to support his household. In addition to this, his wife helps out with her own small business selling beauty products from a catalogue. 

Helmer is worried because the roof of his house has deteriorated and now that winter has arrived the rain is getting into the house. As well as this, the door to his house has also deteriorated. This is the reason why he is applying for a loan from FUSAI to buy tin sheeting, wood, nails and a door to improve his roof and install a door to protect his home.

loans.use: to buy tin sheeting, wood, nails and a door to improve his roof and install a door to protect his home.

loans.name: Juliah

texts.en:
Juliah, 47 years old, is married and supports two children. She has been a small scale farmer for the last 14 years. 

She has applied for her first loan of KES 25,000 from VisionFund Kenya to buy a dairy cow in order to increase milk production for supply. 


She plans to use the anticipated profits to repay the loan and educate her children to higher levels of learning. Her hope is to improve family living standards.

loans.use: to  buy a dairy cow in order to increase milk production for supply.

loans.name: Deolinda

texts.en:
Deolinda is 52 years old and has six children. Deolinda is married and has one child who is still in school. Deolinda is in the agricultural business, raising livestock in the Philippines. Deolinda requested a PHP 11000 loan through NWTF to purchase feeds and other supplies to raise her livestock.

Deolinda has been raising livestock for 4 years now, and has borrowed 6 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

Deolinda would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase feeds and other supplies to raise her livestock

loans.name: Lilia

texts.en:
Lilia is 61 years old and has nine children. Lilia is married and has one child who is still in school.

Lilia is in the agricultural business, pig fattening in the Philippines. Lilia requested a PHP 10000 loan through NWTF to purchase piglets, feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

Lilia has been in pig fattening for 20 years now, and has borrowed 6 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

Lilia would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase piglets, feeds and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Kwekwe

texts.en:
Kwekwe is a married woman with six children. She lives at her own house that has neither electricity nor piped water.

She has operated a retail shop business for the past seven years, selling household consumables like wheat flour, maize flour and sugar. She faces a major challenge of creditors waitinging for a long time to repay for goods taken on credit. 

With the loan, she is requesting she wants to purchase stock of sugar, rice, maize flour and wheat flour. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase stocks of sugar, rice, maize flour and wheat flour.

loans.name: Nyamvula

texts.en:
Nyamvula is a married woman and staying together with her husband and six children. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees. 

For the past six years, she has operated a charcoal selling business. She sells from home to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of high cost of transportation. 

With the 30,000 KES, she wants to purchase bundles of charcoal for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of charcoal for resale

loans.name: Satya's Group

texts.en:
A young woman is 24 years old living in a remote village of Kampong Cham province, Satya is a married mother of two dependent children, one of whom is in school and another one is too young to attend school. To support her living condition, she sells vegetable for six years and it earns her about 26,000KHR per day and she is able to save around 17,000KHR each day after her family’s expenses. Due to lack of funds, Satya decided to lead a group, which contains five members, to take a Kiva loan via VisionFund and this is the first loan for her group. 

As the group leader, she is going to spend her entire loan portion to buy more kind of vegetables to attract her customers and increase the number of sales. She hopes that this loan will help her to earn more income in order to improve her family’s living condition.

loans.use: to buy more kind of vegetables to attract her customers and increase the number of sales.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Kang Meas District

loans.name: Theoun

texts.en:
A mother of four dependent children living in Kampong Cham province, Theoun is 42 years old. Nowadays, she can earn income to support her living condition via working in construction labor. Moreover, she plows rice for others for a fee to get extra income. 

For Theoun, she works in a higher altitude of the construction, so it is the main talent for her. This is her fifth cycle with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner), and she has repaid her past loans successfully. 

Like her past loans, it can help her get more income to improve her lifestyle. She will use her loan portion to buy a decent motorbike to get to work on time. She hopes that she can save time and get more income from her work to make her family’s living better than before.

loans.use: to buy a decent motorbike to get to work on time.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Kampong Siem district

loans.name: Farzana

texts.en: Farzana is a housewife and a mother of three children; She requires funds to buy a new rickshaw for her husband. The family's income is generated through the transportation business and they barely make ends meet. Farzana's husband is the main earner of the family and generates all his the income from driving the rickshaw. Unfortunately the current rickshaw has completely broken down, halting the inflow of income. This has resulted in Farzana's children skipping school due to lack of resources at their mother's disposal. Hence, Farzana wants a loan to help her husband to buy a new rickshaw and start generating income once again which would streamline all her activities and thus send her children back to school to get an education.

loans.use: to buy a new rickshaw for her husband's transportation services.

loans.name: Nathmiya

texts.en:
Nathmiya is a 42 year-old married woman that lives in Marka. 
Nathmiya sells accessories in her home,Her project started many years ago. Her husband works for a low income and because she is very helpful woman and believes that she has to help her husband in the household expense, she also added selling some cosmetic products and kids toys to have more variety to serve the neighborhood, Nathmiya`s problem was promotion and marketing. Now she is applying for a loan to support her project and expand it and increase the quantity of accessories with more variety to sell. This will help her to increase her income and improve it.

loans.use: increase the quantity of accessories with more variety to sell,

loans.name: Phi

texts.en: Mrs. Phi is a hardworking woman, 51 years old . She lives with her husband and three children in a small house and without a hygienic latrine. Her family’s income is mainly from animal husbandry and fishing. She would like to borrow a loan to build a latrine, which can help to improve the health of her family’s member. With support from her husband, she is able to repay the loan monthly.

loans.use: To build a latrine to improve the health of her family

loans.name: Karen

texts.es:
Karen continua con sus estudios de contabilidad, quiere poder ser una buena profesional y por medio de sus estudios poder abrirse camino al mundo profesional para poder ayudar a sus seres queridos, comenta que su préstamo anterior lo uso en poder pagar las cuotas de su carrera, lo que le fue de mucha ayuda.
Hoy pide de vuelta este préstamo para poder pagar de vuelta sus cuotas, y de esa forma poder seguir con sus estudios.
texts.en:
Karen continues with her accounting studies. She wants to be a good professional, and through her studies, carve a path into the professional world so that she will be able help her loved ones. She comments that she used her previous loan to pay her university fees, which was a great help to her.

Today she is returning to request a loan so that she will be able pay her university fees, and thus be able to continue with her studies.

loans.use: to pay her university fees.

loans.name: Flavio

texts.es:
Flavio es de la ciudad de Villarrica, está estudiando la carrera de ingeniería en informática, y comenta que por medio de su carrera quiere poder hacerse conocido y poder ayudar a las demás personas.
Él se esfuerza para poder salir adelante y comenta que pide este préstamo para poder pagar las cuotas de su carrera y de esa forma poder seguir con sus estudios.
texts.en: Flavio is from the city of Villarrica, is studying computer engineering, and says that through his career he wants to be known and to help other people. He strives to get ahead and says that he is asking for this loan to pay for university fees and thus continue with his studies.

loans.use: to pay university fees.

loans.name: Marco

texts.es:
Marco es de la ciudad de San Pedro, el esta estudiando la carrera de Derecho, por medio de sus estudios quiere abrirse camino para poder ayudar a su familia y a sus seres queridos. Comenta que por medio de su préstamo anterior pudo comprar sus materiales de estudios y pagó sus cuotas, lo cual le fue muy útil.
Hoy pide este nuevo préstamo para poder pagar de vuelta sus cuotas, y de esa forma poder seguir con sus estudios como lo viene haciendo. Agradece por la nueva oportunidad que recibe de poder continuar con sus estudios.
texts.en:
Marco is from the city of San Pedro. He is in law school, and wants to be able to make his way and help his family and loved ones by getting a college education. He says his previous loan allowed him to buy his study materials and pay his school fees, which was very useful.

Today he is requesting a new loan in order to pay new fees so that he can keep up the good work. He is thankful for this new chance to further his education.

loans.use: to pay college fees.

loans.name: Jelat

texts.en:
Jelagat is 56 years old and married to Kibiego and blessed with five children of whom two are below 18 years old. She is a livestock farmer in Kamatargui village and has been farming for three years earning a monthly income of KES.34,000.

This is her first loan with VFK and she intends to buy a dairy cow for milk production, which will help her increase her income.

The expanded profits shall be used to repay back the loan and she dreams of having a grazing unit in the future.

loans.use: to buy a dairy cow

loans.name: Him

texts.en:
HIM, 46, lives in Kompong Cham Province of Cambodia. He has three children. To make a living, he manages and operates a farming business, primarily grows rice and cassava and sells his agricultural product to local dealers. So far, he has been in this type of business for around twenty years. On average, he is able to make an income of 2.50 USD a day. 

In this farming season, he is lacking money to buy some farm supplies. To continue her farming, he is borrowing some money from Kiva now to buy farm supplies like fertilizers, seeds and insecticides.  He is thankful to lenders for the financial support. He is awaiting your kindness.

loans.use: to buy farm supplies like fertilizers, seeds and insecticides

loans.name: Fahid

texts.en:
Fahid is a 31-year-old married man from Rafah city, which is located in the Gaza Strip and suffers from power outages 12-16 hours a day regularly. He lives with his family in a small house. As an employee in the public sector, he earns a low income. This income barely covers all the family's needs.

Because he is not able to save enough money, Fahid took a USD loan from FATEN. With this loan, he will buy a solar system for heating water for the family house.
