Palestinians use water boilers that use either gas or gasoline to heat the water before a shower, which can be dangerous, expensive and inefficient. This will help him to provide hot water without using electricity, which is much more expensive.

loans.use: he will buy a solar system for heating water for the family house.

loans.name: Macrina

texts.en:
Macrina is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a general store business in the Philippines.  She is borrowing PHP 15000 through NWTF to purchase additional stocks of household goods to sell for her general store business.

Macrina has been in this business for 2 years. Macrina earns more income from selling vegetables and buy and sell used clothing.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and now she has requested an additional loan to further build her business.

Macrina has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college in the future.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks of household goods to sell

loans.name: Mkawadigo

texts.en:
Mkawadigo is a married woman with three children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that  has no electricity, but has piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family and school fees.
Mkawadigo operates a vegetable stall. She sells at the market to town dwellers and neighbors. She faces a challenge of high cost of transportation to her place of operation. She dreams of expanding and establishing a wholesale business in the future. 



With the Kshs 50,000 she wants to purchase Irish potatoes, onions, cabbage and tomatoes for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase Irish potatoes, onions, cabbage and tomatoes for resale

loans.name: Marcita

texts.en:
Marcita is 50 years old and has four children.  Marcita is married and has three children who are in school.

She is in the agricultural business farming banana in the Philippines. Marcita requested a PHP 15000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Marcita has been farming banana for 4 years now, and has borrowed 8 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Marcita would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional fertilizers and other farm supplies

loans.name: Saran's Group

texts.en: Residing in Kratie province, Soran is 42 years old and a mother of one schoolchild. To support on her family’s living, she earns income by selling grocery items and making wine to get more income. For Saron, this is her second cycle with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) and she has fully repaid her past loan as well. Her previous loan has helped her to improve her living conditions. In a group of three, she is the group leader. She will spend her entire loan portion to buy more grocery items to attract more customers and increase sales. She hopes that she can get more income from her business to upgrade her standard of living.

loans.use: to buy more grocery items to attract more customers and increase sales.

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John is 51s years old, a carpenter and a father of 5 sons and 3 daughters. He owns a workshop in Dagoretti near Nairobi and spends most of his time in the workshop with two of his sons making furniture. The other children are still learning, from university to primary school. Whenever there is higher demand for furniture he employs other carpenters to meet the increased demand and satisfy his clients.
His aim is to expand his workshop and be able to meet the demands of clients. He also wants to support his sons to be independent too. Through this loan he will be able to employ more youth and teach them skills in carpentry through apprenticeship. However, this has been a challenge because of lack of enough tools for woodwork.
He is requesting Kiva for a loan to purchase tools. This will help him realize his goals.

loans.use: to purchase tools for carpentry and woodwork

loans.name: Tabu

texts.en:
Tabu  is a married woman with six kids. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food for the family and school fees.

Tabu operates a grocery and vegetable stall, and she sells at the market to town dwellers and neighbors. She faces a challenge of high cost of transportation to her place of operation. 


With the KES 20,000, she wants to purchase a crate of tomatoes, onions and vegetables for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase a crate of tomatoes, onions and vegetables for resale.

loans.name: Mahmoud

texts.en:
Mahmmoud is a 21-year-old student.  A single man, he lives in Marka. 

Mahmmoud is studying in his second year in the university majoring in accounting. He is living a difficult financial situation, as he has another brother studying at the same time. 

The purpose of applying to the loan is to finish paying his university fees and to help him graduate in his advanced studies.

loans.use: to finish paying his university fees.

loans.name: Jameela's Group

texts.en:
Jameela, aged 50, is a married woman. She is a hardworking and brave mother who is helping her family by providing tailoring services in her community. Being a mother, she wants to provide better conditions for her children, and this is the reason she is working extremely hard--to keep her children smiling.

When she observed that her husband couldn't provide everything necessary for them, she decided to start tailoring work at home. Since then she has been sewing clothes for her community. She wants to enhance the beauty of her craft so she would like to buy a Juki sewing machine. The professionals use this machine for tailoring because of its speed and fine performance.

She knows the techniques of tailoring very well. Her regular customers are mostly her neighbors, relatives and the local community. She has requested a loan to buy a new Juki sewing machine and some packs of zippers and buttons to meet the increasing demand. 

Jameela is very thankful to Kiva and its field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy a new Juki sewing machine and some packs of zippers and buttons to meet increasing customer demand.

loans.name: Marcos

texts.es:
El Sr. Marcos trabaja en una empresa de fabricación de plásticos y por la noche estudia la carrera de ingeniería en informática, para el próximo año tiene proyectado en trabajar en su profesión.
Es una persona muy responsable y dedicada a sus estudios y a su familia.
Pide este préstamo para poder pagar las cuotas de su carrera, y de esa forma poder continuar con sus estudios como lo viene haciendo.
texts.en:
Marcos works in a plastics factory, and at night he studies computer engineering. He expects to be working in his profession by next year. 

He is a very responsible person, and he is devoted to his studies and his family. He is seeking this loan to be able to pay his tuition, and by doing so be able to continue with his studies.

loans.use: to pay university tuition.

loans.name: Juán Bautista

texts.es: Júan Bautista, tiene la edad  de 45 años, está casado, vive con su esposa y hijos,  los cuales son su mayor prioridad. Con su crédito pretende hacer la compra  semilla de frijol de buena calidad y que tenga una buena germinación y de fertilizantes orgánicos que le ayuden a mejorar las condiciones del suelo y otros productos para aplicarle a la siembra, además pagar mano de obra en trabajos de preparación del terreno y de labores que le ayuden a que el agua de lluvia no cause daños por la erosión, y también para la aplicación de los productos y asistencia de la plantación una vez que tenga desarrollo, y de esta manera asegurarse de realizar un buen trabajo. Lo que pretende es aprovechar las buenas condiciones de clima y suelo que cuenta la zona para este cultivo, y también poner en práctica la experiencia de varios años en el manejo de granos básicos. Además de poder comprar los mejores productos y de mejor calidad para que su plantación tenga un buen desarrollo y sanidad al igual que una cosecha adecuada, y tener a corto plazo una producción importante. Con el ingreso de la cosecha que espera obtener quiere utilizarla en el bienestar y estudio de su familia y cumplir con algunas metas familiares y seguir invirtiendo más en los cultivos. Es el primer  préstamo que  ha recibido de FUDECOSUR. Él no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en:
Juan Bautista is 45 years of age, married, and lives with his wife and children who are his biggest priority. With his loan he hopes to buy bean seeds that are good quality and that germinate well, organic fertilizers that help improve the condition of the land, as well as other products to apply to the cultivation. In addition, he wants to pay for labor for the land preparation jobs, for help to prevent rain water from causing erosion damage, for the application of the products, and help with the field once there is growth. This is how he can make sure a good job is done.

He hopes to take advantage of the good climate and land conditions that the area counts on for this cultivation, and also put into practice the many years of experience he has in handling basic grains. In addition, he hopes to be able to buy the best products of the best quality so that his field grows well and healthily, as well as have a sufficient harvest and an important production in the near future.

He wants to use the income that he hopes to obtain from the harvest for his family's well being and education, achieve some family goals, and continue to invest in the cultivation.

This is the first loan he received from FUDECOSUR. He hasn't received any other loans from state-owned banks, but FUDECOSUR has provided him with the loan with ease and a much lower interest rate.

loans.use: to cultivate beans.

loans.name: Rehan

texts.en:
Rehan is 24 years old and married. She lives in Jinen city with her family and she has two children. In 2011 Rehan started raising chickens in her own yard to sell as meat in the local market. It is a good business, but still needs a lot of improvement. 

She has applied for this loan to buy more sheep and feed; this will help her a lot to improve her business and take steps forward in this field. 

Rehan is very grateful to everyone who helps her achieve success in her business with this loan. The person in the photo is her husband; for cultural reasons she can’t publish her photos online, so she apologizes.

loans.use: to buy more sheep and feed

loans.name: Reina Isabel

texts.es:
Reina, de 55 años de edad, es una mujer luchadora, con un pasado muy triste, ella tuvo que trabajar muy fuerte desde que estaba pequeña, más sin embargo y con ayuda de su hermana mayor logró estudiar educación básica, es madre de 4 hijos y viuda porque su esposo falleció seis meses atrás.- Ella vive sola con uno de sus hijos, que es empleado en la ciudad y es quien le ayuda en los gastos del hogar.

Reina, se dedica a la venta de carne de res y de cerdo, también vende leche, cuajada, queso fresco y crema, todos los insumos los adquiere de su pequeña ganadería.- También tiene un pequeño horno de barro en donde hace pan dulce para vender y aveces también hace sopa para vender.- Sus dos hijos se levantan en la madrugada, para ordeñar las vacas y tres veces por semana destazan algún animal, el negocio lo inicio desde que tuvo su primer hija y por gracia de Dios le ha ido muy bien.

El préstamo solicitado es para comprar insumos agrícolas y pagar para arar la tierra con bueyes, para sembrar maíz y maicillo, pues ya se acerca la siembra y quieren estar preparados.

Reina, sueña con ver a sus hijos triunfar en cada uno de sus hogares y también le gustaría que su negocio siempre continuara y heredarlo a sus hijas.
texts.en:
Reina is 55 years old and is a courageous woman with a very sad past. She had to work very hard at a young age, but nevertheless with the help of her sister she was able to go to primary school. She is the mother of four children and was widowed when her husband passed away six months ago. She lives alone with one of her children who works as a maid in the city and helps her with the household bills.  

Reina sells beef and pork and also sells milk, cottage cheese, fresh cheese and cream, all of which she gets from her small herd of cattle. She also has a small mud brick oven where she makes sweet bread to sell and sometimes she also makes soup to sell. Her two children get up at dawn to attend to the cows and three times a week they butcher an animal. Reina began this business when she had her first daughter and she thanks God that it has gone very well. 

The loan Reina is applying for will be used to buy agricultural supplies and pay to have her land plowed with oxen to plant corn and sorghum since the sowing season is coming and they want to be prepared.

Reina dreams of seeing her children succeed in every one of their households and she also hopes that her business continues forever so that she can leave it to her daughters.

loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies and pay to have her land plowed with oxen to plant corn and sorghum

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: La joven a quien se le ha pixeleado la cara por tener 26 años de edad y vivir en zona de alto riesgo, ella se dedica a la venta de ropa desde hace 6 años e inicio con capital propio, la joven vive en casa propia con su esposo y sus dos hijo, ella está solicitando un crédito para la compra de blusas, licras, papalones para damas y caballeros, faldas, ropa interior, etc. todo por mayor y así poder seguir con sus ventas para tener mejores ganancias.
texts.en: This 26 year old young woman’s face has been blurred because lives in a high-risk zone. She has been selling clothes for 6 years, and began with her own investment. She lives in her own home with her husband and her two sons. She is seeking a loan to buy blouses, leggings, women’s and men’s pants, skirts, underwear etc., all at wholesale so that she can generate better earnings.

loans.use: to buy blouses, leggings, women's and men's pants, skirts,underwear, etc., all at wholesale.

loans.name: Nancy Lorena

texts.es: Nancy tiene 36 años, es casada, tiene un hijo pequeño  y vive en el Estado de México, ella estudió administración de empresas y actualmente tiene un trabajo estable en esta área. Nancy es una mujer emprendedora con muchas ganas de salir adelante, con un carácter apasionado, que siempre deja lo mejor de sí en todo lo que hace. Desde hace más de dos años ella inició un negocio de venta de artículos para regalo (peluches, bolsas, chocolates, etc.) por internet y actualmente su negocio se encuentra en su casa, ella planea en un futuro cercano hacer crecer su negocio y abrir algún otro en una plaza comercial.  Con un préstamo de MXN 10,000 Nancy podrá reabastecer completamente su negocio, además de que podrá adquirir nuevos artículos, ella agradece mucho a todas las personas que harán crecer su negocio, asegura que no les fallara y que será muy responsable con sus pagos. Cabe recalcar que Nancy está muy orgullosa de sus logros y este será uno más que cumplirá.
texts.en:
Nancy is 36 years old.  She lives in the State of Mexico, is married and has a small child.  She studied business administration and now has stable work is this area.  Nancy is an entrepreneurial woman with much desire to move forward.  She has an enthusiastic personality and always gives her best in everything that she does.

More than two years ago she began a business of selling gift articles (stuffed toys, bags, chocolates etc.) on the internet and now her business is located in her home.  She plans in the near future to make her business grow and open another one in a commercial plaza.

With a loan of MXN 10,000 Nancy will be able to completely re-stock her business and also acquire new items.  She is very grateful to all the people who will be making her business grow. She assures them that she will not let them down and that she will be very responsible with her payments.  It should be stressed that Nancy is very proud of her achievements and this will be one more thing that she accomplishes.

loans.use: to re-stock her business and acquire new items

loans.name: Panny's Group

texts.en:
A young woman living in Kampong Cham province, Panny is 22 years old. She grows cassava as her main source of income and grows rice to supplement her income. She has been involved in her farm for four years. This year, the price of cassava is lower than last year, so her income has decreased. 

For Panny, this is her first time with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). She leads a group of two in applying for a loan. As the group leader, she will use her share to buy more seed and organic pesticide and to expand her farmland to support her farming. She hopes that her cassava grows well and she can earn more income to expand her farmland to grow cassava next year.

loans.use: to buy more seed and organic pesticide and to expand her farmland to support her farming.

loans.name: Boen's Group

texts.en:
Boen is a 61-year-old woman living in Kampong Cham province, and is a mother of eight children. She earns income to improve her condition via rice crops on a two hectare area. Moreover, she can earn more income via working for others for a fee. 

She has been involved her farming for 43 years, and she has also been faced with some problems of insects destroying her rice. This is the sixth cycle for Boen with VisionFund, Kiva’s partner, and she has fully repaid her past loans completely.  Because of the past loans, she can earn more income than before to upgrade her living conditions. 

In a group of three members, she is the group leader. She will manage her entire loan to buy fertilizer and expand her farmland to support her rice farming. She hopes that her rice can grow to a high yield, and that she earns a good income.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and expand her farmland to support her rice farming.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Prey Chhor district

loans.name: Eva

texts.es:
Eva continua con sus estudios es enfermería, es una persona muy luchadora, ya que a la vez que estudia también esta trabajando para poder tener los ingresos que necesita para poder cubrir los gastos de sus estudios. Comenta que a través de su anterior préstamo pudo pagar las cuotas de su carrera, lo cual le fue de mucha ayuda.
Pide este nuevo préstamo para poder invertirlo en la compra de materiales de estudios, para poder continuar con sus estudios como lo viene haciendo.
texts.en:
Eva is continuing with her nursing studies. She is a very driven person, since she is not only studying but also working in order to be able to have the income she needs to cover the costs of her studies. She says that with her previous loan she was able to pay her tuition installments, which was a great help.

She is seeking this new loan in order to invest it in the purchase of study materials, so she can continue with her studies.

loans.use: to buy supplies for university.

loans.name: Cristina

texts.es:
Cristina es una mujer de 39 años de edad, vive con su pareja, tiene un hijo de 11 años y una hija de 8 años, y su negocio es el tejido de mantas y prendas de vestir para señoras tradicionales.
Ella es buena madre, emprendedora, independiete, constante, responsable y muy trabajadora. Su negocio lo realiza en su domicilio ubicado en la zona ‘valle metropolitano’ sitio caracterizado por encontrarse sobre una ladera de la ciudad, donde las calles son pendientes y empinadas. De clima frio y seco con una temperatura que varía durante el día entre 0-12 grados centígrados.
Cristina es de tez morena, ojos pardos, cabello negro largo lo usa trenzado, baja estatura, complexión física mediana, su forma de vestir es tradicional (sombrero, manta y pollera), y su lengua materna es el Aymará que se habla en el lugar y habla español por cultura general y por el negocio que realiza. Su vida la comparte con su pareja que trabaja en construcción y con sus hijos que estudian en la escuela, viven en una casa propia construida de ladrillo y cemento con techo de calamina y piso de cemento que cuenta con energía eléctrica, agua potable, gas domiciliario y alcantarillado. Su negocio es la confección de mantas y prendas para mujer de vestir tradicional, como; mantas, chalecos, guantes, polainas, etc., “no produzco en gran cantidad debido a que mi trabajo es netamente manual y no cuento con máquinas…” comenta. La venta de su negocio es que sus clientes valoran el trabajo hecho a mano, la desventaja es la falta de capital para la compra de una máquina tejedora para mejorar su producción. Su sueño es abrir un taller de tejidos propio, ella desea realizar la compra de una máquina tejedora de 100 agujas para mejorar su producción y sus ventas. Esta es la 1 secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 13 años que se dedica a esta actividad.
Es por esos motivos que Cristina solicita un préstamo para la compra de una máquina de tejer industrial para mejorar su producción y sus ventas.
texts.en:
Cristina is a 39-year-old woman and lives with her partner. She has an 11-year-old son and an 8-year-old daughter. Her business is weaving blankets and traditional women's clothing. She is a good mother, enterprising, independent, consistent, responsible and hard working. She has her business in her home  located in the "Valle Metropolitano" area which is characterized by being on a hillside in the city, where the streets are on steep slopes. It has a cold and dry climate and temperatures vary during the day between zero and 12 degrees Celsius. 

Cristina has a dark complexion, brown eyes, long black hair she wears braided, short height and a medium physique. Her clothing style is traditional (hat, blanket and skirt) and her native language is Aymara which is spoken in the area. She speaks Spanish for the general culture and for her business. She shares her life with her partner who works in construction and with her children who are in school. They live in their own home which is made of bricks and cement, with a tin roof and cement floors. They have electricity, water, gas and sewer services. 

Her business is making blankets and traditional women's clothing like blankets, vests, gloves, leggings, etc. "I don't produce in large quantities because my work is purely manual, and I don't have machines," she says. The advantage of her business is that her customers value hand-made work, the disadvantage is that she is lacking the capital to buy a weaving machine to improve her production. 

Her dream is to open her own fabric workshop, own a car and to manage to have her children study in college. She wants to buy a weaving machine with 100 needles to improve her production and her sales. This is her first loan with this institution in the 13 years that she has been in this business. For these reasons, Cristina is requesting a loan to buy an industrial weaving machine to improve her production and her sales.

loans.use: to buy an industrial weaving machine.

loans.name: Concepcion

texts.es: Concepción es un hombre de 68 años de edad que siempre se ha esforzado por sacar adelante a su familia, por lo que hace muchos años construyo una pequeña vivienda en la que habita junto a su grupo familiar. Concepción buscando la manera de salir adelante se gana la vida desde hace 8 años prestando sus servicios de albañil independiente, por lo que gracias a su experiencia cuenta con una gran cantidad de clientes, además anteriormente Concepción solicito un crédito con el cual encemento el piso del corredor el mismo. Concepción ha tomado la decisión de solicitar un crédito a FUSAI el cual utilizara para instalar el techo del corredor, por lo que desea invertir en: lámina galvanizada, madera, clavos y alambre para instalar el techo del corredor para que la lluvia no ingrese a su vivienda y de esta manera proteger a su familia.
texts.en:
Concepción, 68, has always tried hard to support his family. In order to do so he built a small home many years ago in which he and his family unit live. Looking for a way to move forward, Concepción has made a living offering his services as an independent brick-layer for the last eight years. Thanks to his experience he has a large number of customers. Concepción has asked for a loan previously which he used to cement the floor of the same corridor. 

Concepción has decided to ask FUSAI for a loan which he will use to fit a roof in his corridor. This is why he wants to invest in: galvanised sheeting, wood, nails and wire, so that he can build a roof for his corridor and stop water from coming into his home and, in doing so, protect his family.

loans.use: to invest in: galvanised sheeting, wood, nails and wire so that he can fit a roof on his corridor and stop rainwater from coming into his home

loans.name: Velika

texts.en:
In the photograph is Velika and her husband Arben along with their two adorable little ones, who are two and three years old. They are Egyptians, and they are very poor, as someone might tell from the photograph. 

They are seeking your compassion and financial help again to buy three pigs and three calves, and also to repair a stable for the animals.

loans.use: to buy three pigs and three calves, and also to repair the animal stable.

loans.name: Ana Celia

texts.es:
Ana Celia siempre se ha caracterizado por ser una mujer activa, se despierta muy temprano para realizar el quehacer de su hogar y preparar el desayuno para su familia. Sin embargo, esto no era suficiente para ella, por esto decidió emprender una pulpería con ayuda de su esposo, pues de esta forma podrían aumentar los ingresos económicos y cultivar ese espíritu de superación y pro actividad característico de ella. 
Con el tiempo la calidad y la buena atención que ofrece Ana Celia, ha logrado conquistar muchos clientes, logrando así ampliar su negocio. Por esta razón, solicita un crédito para comprar arroz, frijoles, golosinas, gaseosas, galletas, carnes, embutidos y demás productos que le ayuden a ofrecer variedad en su pulpería. De esta forma podrá duplicar sus ingresos y con esas ganancias ampliar su vivienda.
texts.en:
Ana Celia has always been known for being an active woman. She gets up very early to do the household chores and prepare breakfast for her family. However, this was not enough for her, which is why she decided to open a grocery store with the help of her husband. In this way they would increase their income and cultivate the indomitable and pro-active spirit that is characteristic of Ana Celia.

With time, quality and good service, Ana Celia has been able to garner many customers and expand her business as a result. This is why she is applying for a loan to buy rice, beans, lollies, soft drink, meat, cold meats and other products which will help her to offer more variety in her grocery store. This way she will be able to double her income and expand her home with the profits.

loans.use: to buy rice, beans, lollies, soft drink, meat, cold meats and other products

loans.name: Ricardo

texts.es:
El Sr. Ricardo es estudiante de la carrera Administración de Empresas, en unos años se ve como profesional, es empleado, trabaja en una playa de autos.
Quiere ser un profesional para mejorar su calidad de vida, y también poder ayudar a las demás personas.
Pide este préstamo para poder pagar las cuotas de su carrera, y de esa forma poder seguir con sus estudios.
texts.en:
Ricardo is a Business Administration student. In a few years he will be a professional, but for the moment he is employed and works for a rental car company. He wants to be a professional to improve his quality of life and also to help other people. 

Ricardo is applying for a loan to pay his university fees so he can continue studying.

loans.use: to pay his university fees

loans.name: Santiago

texts.es: Don Santiago de 55 años de edad vive en casa propia con su compañero de vida y sus cinco hijos, el se dedica al cultivo de granos básicos y a la crianza de ganado desde hace 38 años, vende sus cultivos en los pueblos aledaños, con lo que obtiene de sus ventas logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, el está solicitando un crédito para la compra de semillas, sulfato, fertilizantes, abonos,  controles de plagas, etc. y así seguir con su trabajo.
texts.en:
Santiago is 55 years old and lives in his own home with his life partner and their five children. He has been working growing basic grains and raising livestock for the past 38 years. He sells his crops in the nearby villages, and what he makes off his sales allows him to cover some of his household expenses. 

He is requesting this loan to buy seeds, sulfate, fertilizer, pest-control products, etc. in order to keep on working.

loans.use: to buy seeds, sulfate, fertilizer, pest-control products, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase sweets, vegetables, meat, cooking oil, cassava and different flavoured icecreams.

loans.name: Bethel Group

texts.es: El grupo solidario Bethel está conformado por tres mujeres emprendedoras de éxito coordinado por Silvia de 22 años de edad una joven laboriosa, acompañada y madre de dos hijos, ella se dedica a la venta de ropa y cosméticos desde hace cinco años, el crédito lo solicita para la compra de blusas, pantalones, camisetas y trajecitos de niños. Con el crédito anterior logró comprar una refrigeradora y un televisor, actualmente su meta es prosperar el negocio para ofertar una mayor cantidad de productos. La segunda socia es Ana de 28 años propietaria de una pulpería y Ana julia de 27 años quien se dedica a la venta de comida.
texts.en:
Bethel solidarity group is made up of three successful business women. The coordinator is Silvia, 22 years of age, an industrious young woman who is in a relationship and is the mother of two children.

She has been selling clothes and cosmetics for five years. She is requesting a loan to buy blouses, pants, t-shirts and children's outfits. With the last loan she was able to buy a refrigerator and a television, now her goal is to grow her business by offering a larger range of products. 
 
The second member is Ana, 28, owner of a small grocery store, and Ana Julia, 27, who sells food.

loans.use: to buy blouses, pants, t-shirts and children's outfits.

loans.name: Everline

texts.en:
Everline is 26 years old, single and blessed with three school age children.  She is in the grocery business, and has been selling fruits and vegetables for the last two years, earning a monthly income of KES 18,000.

She has applied for her first loan of KES. 20,000, with which she intends to buy oranges, mangoes, cabbages and sukuma wiki.  The anticipated profits from her business will be used to pay back the loan.

She has a dream of becoming one of the richest members of her family.

loans.use: to buy fruits and vegetables for her kiosk.

loans.name: Tha

texts.en:
Tha, 50, lives in a community of Pursat Province, Cambodia. She is a lovely mother of five children. To make a living and support her family, she manages and operates a farming business on a small rice farmland which is located near her house. So far, she has been in his types of business for around twenty years. On average, she is able to make an income of USD 3.00 a day.

She wants to improve the general living conditions of the entire family by having a latrine to use, because there is no latrine in her house now. Therefore, she is borrowing a loan from KIVA to build a latrine. By doing this, she can help her family members gain access to sanitation, promote their health, and help to lessen environmental deterioration. She is thankful for the loan granted through HKL with a much lower interest rate than other general loan products.

loans.use: to build a latrine for the health of her family

loans.name: Abizeranye Sub Group A

texts.en:
Eugenie is a group leader; aged 30 years.She is married with 4 children aged between 1 and 10 years.2 of them go to school. The group is called Abizeranye means “the trusted people” in English. They sell different products and they wish to expand their business for changing their better future. 

She has owned a salon and has been running in a business for 10 years. With the loan, she would like to buy artificial hair for sale. The profits from the business will be used to pay school fees of her children and increase her savings.

loans.use: to buy artificial hair for sale in her beauty salon.

loans.name: Benicia

texts.es:
Benicia, de 60 años de edad, es viuda, sus hijos ya están acompañados pero el último todavía está en casa, con ella también vive uno de sus nietos.

Benicia, desde que se casó, se dedicó al cuidado del hogar, limpiaba su casa y cuidaba de sus hijos e hijas, siempre ha estado pendiente de ellos, luego trabajo en el cafetin de la escuela de su comunidad, es una mujer muy espiritual y muy apegada a las cosas de Dios.

El préstamo lo necesita para comprar medicinas y pagar algunos gastos médicos que tiene, con este apoyo ella lograra solventar este tipo de necesidad y mejorara su salud.  

Benicia, desea seguir trabajando y ayudar a su nieto para que se supere.
texts.en:
Benicia is 60 years old and a widow. Her children now have partners but the youngest still lives at home. One of her grandchildren also lives with Benicia.

Since marrying, Benicia has looked after the household, cleaning the house and looking after her sons and daughters. She has always taken care of them. She later worked in the local school cafeteria. Benicia is a very spiritual woman, and very attached to things to do with God.

Benicia needs this loan in order to buy medicine and to cover some personal medical expenses. She hopes to be able to pay for necessities and improve her health with this loan.

Benicia wants to continue working and to help her grandson to do better in life.

loans.use: To buy medicine and pay some outstanding medical bills

loans.name: Abdul

texts.en:
Abdul is an artisan from Ghana who specializes in hand-carved African masks. He would like to invest in a bulk purchase raw materials, including wood, beads, brass plates, and stains, as well as an increase in the physical space of his workshop.

Abdul has been selling through NOVICA since 2010. This is his story:

"I always knew I wanted to paint, but wasn't sure I could make a living out of it, so I looked into other fields too. I observed master carver Musa at his workshop for a period of time, then I picked up a log of wood and started carving out a mask as I had observed him doing. This surprised Musa and he was willing to help me perfect the skill. I developed a love for this new art, and that's how I eventually became a master carver too!"

"Many thanks for being there for me in this time of need." 

Use the link below to view Abdul's hand-carved African masks on the NOVICA site:
<a href="http://www.novica.com/kiva/7253">http://www.novica.com/kiva/7253

loans.use: to invest in a bulk purchase raw materials, including wood, beads, brass plates, and stains, as well as an increase in the physical space of his workshop

loans.name: Chhorn's Group

texts.en:
Chhorn, 32, lives with his family members in a rural village of Kampong Cham province. He is a father of 2 children, one of whom attends school, while the other is still too young. 

Nowadays, Chhorn can earn income to support his family via teaching in primary school. As well, he grows rice and raises pigs to earn extra income. He is earning a lower income this year because his cassava crop has not grown well. 

Chhorn has been involved in this business for 12 years, and he can save from his income about 30,500 KHR per day. This is his 7th cycle with Kiva's partner VisionFund, and he has fully repaid his past loans. His previous loans helped him earn more income and helped improve his living even more than before. 

Chhorn leads a group of 4 to take a new loan. As the group leader, he will use his loan portion to both buy pig feed and organic pesticide as well as pay for the labor to increase crop productivity. He hopes that his pigs will grow well and his cassava crop will provide him with more yields than last year.

loans.use: to both buy pig feed and organic pesticide and pay for the labor to increase his crop productivity.

loans.name: Norma

texts.es:
Norma es de la ciudad de Caaguazú, está estudiando la carrera de contabilidad,  y por medio de su carrera quiere abrirse camino para poder ayudar a sus seres queridos.
Norma está luchando para poder ser alguien en la vida y de esa forma poder abrirse camino al mundo laboral.
Pide este préstamo para poder pagarlas cuotas de su carrera, y de esa forma poder continuar con sus estudios.
texts.en:
Norma is from the city of Caaguazú. She is studying Accounting and with this degree she hopes to be able to open doors to help her loved ones. She is fighting to be someone in life so that she can break into the workforce. 

Norma is applying for a loan to pay her university fees so that she can continue studying.

loans.use: to pay her university fees

loans.name: Jeremias

texts.es:
Jeremias continua sus estudios en administración de empresas, es un joven que esta poniendo todo su esfuerzo para poder convertirse en un buen profesional y de esa forma poder ayudar a sus seres queridos. Comenta que por medio de su préstamo anterior pudo pagar las cuotas de su carrera.
Pide este préstamo nuevo para poder pagar de vuelta las cuotas de su carrera y de esa forma seguir esforzándose por sus estudios.
texts.en: Jeremias is still studying Business Administration. This young man is working hard in order to become a successful businessman so that he can help his loved ones. He says his previous loan allowed him to pay school fees. He is requesting this new loan in order to again pay his fees so that he can keep studying and earn his degree.

loans.use: to pay college fees.

loans.name: Victoria

texts.es: Victoria de 30 años de edad junto a su compañero de vida y sus 3 hijos de 14, 11 y 3 años de edad es muy humilde pero propia. Ella es una mujer trabajadora que todos los días busca la manera de sacar adelante a su familia, apoyada en su negocio de venta de productos básicos, actividad que realiza en su vivienda, por lo que logra también estar pendiente de sus hijos. Victoria desea mejorar el techo del corredor, ya que este le sirve para que los clientes de su tienda se protejan de la lluvia y el sol, además de proteger de la lluvia la entrada de su vivienda. Victoria ha decidido solicitar un crédito a FUSAI para comprar: lámina, polines, tornillos y pines para mejorar el corredor y proteger su vivienda y sus clientes.
texts.en:
Victoria, who is 30 years old, lives with her partner and their 3 children, ages 14, 11, and 3. She is very humble but correct. She is a very hard-working woman who seeks ways to help her family get ahead every day. She is supported by her business selling basic products from her home, which enables her to be available for her children. 

Victoria hopes to improve the roof over her patio, since is protects her customers from the rain and the sun and also protects the entrance to her home from the rain. 

Victoria has decided to seek a loan from FUSAI to by sheet metal, beams, screws and pins to improve the patio and protect her home and her customers.

loans.use: to buy sheet metal, beams, screws and pins to improve her patio and protect her home and her customers.

loans.name: Dora Delmi

texts.es: Dora vive en casa propia con su hija quien trabaja y le ayuda económicamente, ella se dedica al cultivo de maíz desde hace varios años, gracias a su trabajo es como ha podido salir adelante, vende sus productos en los diferentes mercados que están cerca de su casa, con lo que obtiene de sus ventas logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, ella esta solicitando un crédito para la compra de semillas, fertilizantes, abonos, controles de plagas y mejorar el terreno donde desea hacer la siembra que es el que muestra la fotografía para poder tener mejores ingresos económicos.
texts.en: Dora lives in her own house with her daughter who works and helps her economically. She has worked growing corn for a number of years. Thanks to her work, she has been able to get ahead. She sells her products in the different markets that are near her house. With what she earns, she manages to cover some of the household expenses. She is asking for a loan to purchase seeds, fertilizers, manure, and pesticides and to improve the land where she wants to plant, which is shown in the photo, to be able to have more income.

loans.use: to purchase seeds, fertilizers, manure, and pesticides and to improve the land.

loans.name: Myrna

texts.en:
As a married parent of seven children, Myrna works hard to support her family.

She has a vegetable vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from food vending. Myrna is borrowing PHP 20,000 through NWTF to purchase additional vegetables to sell in her vegetable vending business.

Myrna has been sustaining her business activities through her past seven loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Keyla Michell

texts.es:
Estudiar y trabajar a la vez es difícil, pero estudiar y ser mamá es aún más difícil, Keyla lo sabe pues hace un par de meses dio a luz a su bebé aun cuando estudio tercer año de ingeniería industrial. Sin embargo, no ha sido motivo para que ella abandone sus estudios pues su niña es su motivación para ofrecerle un mejor futuro.

Sin embargo, debido al parto se vio obligada a ausentarse por un semestre, atrasándose  en unas materias. Por ello, solicita un crédito para pagar 4 clases que llevara por tutorías. Esto le permitirá nivelarse y obtener su título en tiempo y forma.  Keyla planea estudiar otra carrera y ahorrar para una vivienda.
texts.en:
Studying and working at the same time is difficult, but studying and being a mother is even more difficult. Keyla knows this since a couple of months ago she gave birth to her baby while she studied her third year of industrial engineering. Nevertheless, this has not been a reason for her to abandon her studies since her daughter is her motivation to offer her a better future. 

However, due to the birth she was forced to miss a semester, getting behind in some subjects.Thus, she is asking for a loan to pay for four classes that she will take from a tutor. This will allow her to catch up and get her degree in a timely manner. Keyla plans to study something else and save for an apartment.

loans.use: to pay for four classes from a tutor.

loans.name: Sanglin's Group

texts.en:
Living in a rural area of the Kampong Cham province, Sanglin is 28 years old. He is a father of two dependent children, one of whom is in school and other one is too young.  In struggling to make his living, he can earn income via cassava growing. Also, he grows rice and works for others for a fee to earn more income. 

His rice has been destroyed by insects, so this is the main problem for his farming that he has faced every year. For Sanglin, this is his second cycle with VisionFund, Kiva’s partner, and he has fully repaid his past loan successfully. He has increased his income from his previous loan to improve his living condition as well. 

In a group of two, he is the group leader. He will spend his loan portion to buy fertilizer, seed and organic pesticide to support his farmland. He hopes that his farming can provide him with a good income to upgrade his lifestyle and support his children’s education well.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, seed and organic pesticide to support his farmland.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Ponhea Krek district

loans.name: Ihbol

texts.en:
Ihbol is a generous woman who was born in the northern part of Tajikistan to a family of workers. A mother of four children, she is hardworking and honest. 

In 2007 her husband went to Russia to earn money to help their family but he remained there, abandoned his family and remarried.  Now the sole support of her family, Ihbol got a loan from her neighbors and started a business buying and selling fruits and vegetables, an enterprise she has operated for the past six years.

Ihbol is now requesting a loan from Kiva members and IMON to support her treatment in hospital and widen her business. She hopes that her enterprise will be efficient and she can work safely.

loans.use: to be treated at hospital and to widen her business

loans.name: Maria De Los Angeles

texts.es: Con 23 años de edad María muestra toda su tenacidad ganándose la vida con su negocio de venta de ropa, actividad que le permite sacar adelante a su familia, y apoyar a su esposo con los gastos de su hogar. María ha procreado junto a su compañero de vida una hija de 5 años de edad con la que viven en casa de su propiedad desde hace varios años, ella desea mejorar su vivienda y para ello necesita construir un pasamanos en el corredor de su vivienda, ya que cuando llueve el agua ingresa a su vivienda, por lo que ha colocado unas láminas pero teme que su hija pueda tener un accidente en estas, por lo que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: cemento, arena, grava, ladrillo y hierro para construir un pasamano y proteger a su hija.
texts.en:
At 23 years of age, María demonstrates all of her tenacity by earning a living with her clothing store business, a job that allows her to bring up her family and help her husband with the household bills. 

María and her life partner have a daughter who is five years old. They have lived in their own home for some years now but María would like to make some home improvements and build a banister in the corridor of their home. When it rains, water leaks into their house and to combat this they have put down some sheeting, however María worries that her daughter could hurt herself on the sheeting. This is why she is applying for a loan from FUSAI to buy cement, sand, arena, gravel, bricks and iron to build a banister and protect her daughter.

loans.use: to buy cement, sand, arena, gravel, bricks and iron to build a banister and protect her daughter

loans.name: Liliana

texts.es:
Liliana es una joven que a la vez que trabaja  y también está estudiando, por medio de su carrera de enfermería quiere abrirse camino para poder ser una buena profesional.
Ella está poniendo su mejor esfuerzo para poder crecer y salir adelante. Pide este préstamo para poder pagar las cuotas de su carrera y de esa forma poder seguir con sus estudios como lo viene haciendo.
texts.en:
Liliana is a young woman who works and studies at the same time.  She hopes that her studies in nursing will open the way for her to become a good professional.
Liliana is doing her very best to grow and succeed. She is requesting this loan to pay her tuition in order to keep studying as she has been.

loans.use: to pay university tuition.

loans.name: Erwin

texts.en:
Sometimes it’s the husband-and-wife’s partnership that sustains a business. Erwin of Tigbauan, Iloilo, finds this to be true. He and his wife, Elena, work hand-in-hand to enhance their fish and pork vending business. Elena sells at her rented space in the market, while Erwin goes house-to-house with the aid of his tricycle. They toil hard to supply their family’s daily needs and support their children’s education until completion. They dream of a happy and sufficient life someday.

At present, it’s rainy season in the Philippines, a time that brings difficulty to fishermen and fish vendors. The price of fish is getting high, so Erwin is requesting a loan worth PHP 50,000 to buy a variety of fish and more pork meat to ensure their livelihood. If God permits, Erwin wishes to become a wholesaler of fish and meat in their community. 

Erwin is committed to CCT Credit Cooperative’s vision to alleviate poverty, and he regularly meets with his co-fellowship* members every week to share stories of his life and business and to draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God. 

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners who gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay micro finance loans.

loans.use: to buy varieties of fish and more pork meat

loans.name: Araceli

texts.en:
Araceli is 37 years old, and is from the province of Gen. Trias,  Cavite, Philippines. She is happily married to Roel, a family driver, and has one child. The couple help each other make a living. A family driver's salary is not enough to raise a family.

Araceli thought of putting up a small general store to augment their income.  She buys vegetables from a wholesaler and beauty products as well to sell at retail prices. It has helped to support their daily needs. 

Vegetables are a staple ingredient in most Filipino dishes, and beauty products are a fast moving item in stores along with food. She already has regular customers and her business is growing.  Since most Filipina women are of "morena" skin, they are crazy about having a fairer and whiter complexion. 

To help her expand operations of her store, she is requesting a PHP 15,000 loan to fill her store with vegetables such as cabbage, potatoes, carrots, string beans and ginger. She will also use part of the loan to buy beauty products such as whitening soap, cleanser, toner, moisturizer and sunblock to sell at retail prices. 

Although there are times that it's difficult to collect payment from those who buy on credit, she is still encouraged that her sales are good and have increased this year. She values her business, since this is the source of funds to pay for the daily food and other household essentials. She saves her husband's salary for emergency needs.

Araceli hopes to grow her and expand her store. She wants all her children to get a college education to allow them better opportunities in life. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

 * All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for vegetables and beauty products to sell.

loans.name: Maria Liza

texts.en:
Maria Liza is married and lives in Tugas, Balingao with her family. She has been selling grocery items to make a living. She had successfully repaid her previous loan, used to buy more good items to sell in her store. 

To meet the current demands, Maria Liza recently took a new loan to buy additional good items to sell to increase her income. She was happy to say that, with this loan, she can rest assured of meeting her desired income and saving more money for the future education of her children.

loans.use: to buy more good items to sell.

loans.name: Alegre Group

texts.es:
Está conformado por 4 mujeres emprendedoras SONIA, ETELDINA, ISOLDA y MEDOLINA, viven en la ciudad de Bilwi; se unieron hace 10 meses con el propósito de trabajar de manera solidaria para poder tener acceso a préstamos en Pana Pana, que les permitiera incrementar el inventario de sus pequeños negocios, mejorar sus ingresos y así mejorar poco a poco las condiciones de vida de sus familias. Decidieron nombrar al grupo solidario alegre, porque son mujeres emprendedoras, optimistas y con buen sentido del humor.

Sonia: Es integrante del grupo solidario, tiene 34 años de edad, casada. Su esposo trabaja como buzo, tiene 4 hijos: 3 adolescentes que estudian su primaria y un pequeño de 3 años de edad. Desde hace 02 años se dedica a la venta de pescado y mariscos de esta manera genera ingresos propios y contribuye con los gastos del hogar y de los estudios de su hijo. Está solicitando préstamo para poder comprar más productos de mariscos y pescados para vender e incrementar sus ingresos y atender a más personas que demandan este producto que constituye uno de los alimentos básicos en Bilwi. Ella sueña con vender ropa usada y chiverías.
texts.en:
This is made up of 4 entrepreneurs Sonia, Eteldina, Isolda and Medolina. They live in the city of Bilwi. They joined together 10 months ago with the goal of working together in order to access loans from Pana Pana. This would allow them to increase the inventory of their small businesses, to improve their income and in that way, little by little, to improve their family’s standard of living. They decided to give the solidarity group a name 'Solidario Alegre" (supportive joy), because they are women entrepreneurs, optimistic and with a good sense of humour.

Sonia is a member of the solidarity group. She is 34 years old and married. Her husband works as a diver and they have 4 children. 3 are adolescents studying in primary school and one is a young 3 year old.

She has worked selling fish and seafood for 2 years and in this way generates her own income and contributes to the household costs and those of her child’s studies.

She is requesting this loan in order to buy more fish and seafood to sell, to increase her income and to serve more people who demand this product, which is a food staple in Bilwi. She dreams of selling used clothing and snack foods.

loans.use: to buy more fish and seafood.

loans.name: Jocelyn Alejandra

texts.es: Jocelyn tiene 36 años, es soltera y vive en la ciudad de México. Ella estudió una licenciatura en letras clásicas  en la facultad de filosofía y letras de una de las universidades más prestigiadas de México. Desde hace 4 años ella junto con un grupo de amigos se dedicaban a hacer libros por gusto y decidieron que sería buena idea prestar servicios editoriales, de modo que así surgió su empresa.  Además de ser emprendedora con su editorial también labora para una asociación civil de escritores buscando financiamiento. Ella con su editorial quiere ser una empresa líder en la prestación de servicios editoriales, que pueda tener una amplia gama de clientes y que colabore a la difusión del conocimiento científico, artístico y cultural. Su principal dificultad es la falta de capital financiero para resolver cuestiones operativas, porque sus clientes tardan en hacer sus proyectos y por ende en pagar. Por este motivo ella solicita un préstamo de MXN 15,000 para poder pagar por adelantado a sus proveedores y no generar cargos extras. Una de sus principales motivaciones como emprendedora es la de generar empleos y ser productiva para la sociedad. Ella comenta que es muy importante este apoyo porque resuelve pequeñas necesidades, que es muy importante tener acceso a capital de trabajo que pueda reinvertirse y que generé sinergia positiva en las cadenas productivas.
texts.en:
Jocelyn is 36, single, and lives in Mexico city. She studied classics in the faculty of arts of one of Mexico's most prestigious universities. Four years ago, she and a group of friends started working on books for the joy of it. They decided that it would be a good idea to start offering editorial services, and their business was born.
On top of being an entrepreneur with her editing business, Jocelyn also works for a civil society organization of authors in search of financing. She wants to be a leader in editing services, to have a large range of clients, and to work on a range of scientific, artistic, and cultural works. Her main challenge is a lack of capital for operating costs. Her clients take a long time to do their projects and, thus, to pay. For this reason, she is requesting a loan of 15,000 MXN in order to pay her providers in advance and avoid extra costs.
One of her main motivations as an entrepreneur is to generate employment and to be productive for society. She says that this support is very important because it covers basic needs. It is very important to have access to working capital so that she can reinvest and generate positive synergy in the production chain.

loans.use: to pay her providers in advance in order to avoid extra charges.

loans.name: Jesus

texts.es:
Jesús, de 57 años de edad, es un hombre que vive solo y ha tratado de salir adelante a pesar de las adversidades.

Jesús, tiene más de 5 años de tener una tienda en el centro de la comunidad, donde ofrece productos de primera necesidad y por su carisma y amabilidad tiene muchos clientes.

Él necesita el crédito para comprar más productos para surtir su tienda como jabón, detergentes, lejía, pan, gaseosas, etc. y poder mantener el prestigio y la capacidad de ofrecer sus productos a sus clientes.

Jesús, desea colocar un mini-super en su pueblo y seguir atendiendo con más productos a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Jesús, age 57, is a man who lives alone and who has tried to succeed despite adversity.
He has had a store in the centre of his community for five years, where he offers basic staples. Thanks to his charisma and kindness, he has many customers.
He needs a loan to purchase more products to stock his store, such as ham, detergent, lye, bread, and pop. This way, he will maintain his prestige and capacity to offer products to his clients.
Jesús wants to open a mini-market in his village and to continue serving his clients with even more products.

loans.use: to buy more products to stock his store, such as soap, detergent, lye, bread, and pop.

loans.name: Isabel

texts.es:
Isabel es una mujer luchadora que  trabaja incansablemente para alcanzar su desarrollo personal; ella vive en una comunidad de Sololá y está casada con tres hijos dos mujeres y un varón.
Ella se dedica con mucha entrega y entusiasmo a la compra y venta de variedades en la comunidad donde vive; este negocio lo realiza en una de las calles más concurridas, ella empezó a ejercer esta actividad porque le gusta y le deja una buena ganancia.

El sueño de Isabel ha sido desde siempre agrandar su negocio, pues por el tipo de negocio que tiene la gente lo busca muy constantemente porque es uno de los pocos negocios donde uno puedo encontrar de todo, ella ahora el obstáculo que tiene es que no tiene el capital suficiente para poder comprar más mercadería y surtir mejor su negocio, si embargo no se limite ante nada y tomo la decisión de solicitar un préstamo que lo invertirá en la compra de mercaderías como: cuadros, floreros, consumo diario entre otros.
Isabel guardas las esperanzas de poder conseguir su crédito para realizar la inversión y de ello obtener una buena ganancias para terminar la construcción de su casa.
texts.en:
Isabel is a determined woman who works untiringly to reach her personal potential.  She lives in the community of Solola.  She is married and has three children: two women and one son.

She works with much dedication and enthusiasm buying and selling a variety of items in the community where she lives.  She does this business on one of the most travelled streets.  She began to do this because she liked it and it gives her good earnings. 

Isabel's dream has always been to enlarge her business.  It is the type of business where people are constantly looking because it is one of the few businesses where a person can find everything.  Right now the obstacle that she has is that she does not have sufficient capital to be able to buy more merchandise and better supply her business.  However, she does not limit herself by anything and made the decision to request a loan that she will invest in the purchase of merchandise such as pictures, vases, and everyday consumer products among other items.

Isabel maintains the hope of being able to get her loan to make the investment and thus obtain better earnings so that she can finish the construction of her house.

loans.use: to buy merchandise such as pictures, vases and everyday consumer products among other items

loans.name: Sofia

texts.es:
Sofia hoy está trabajando y  estudiando, está en el segundo año de la carrera de ingeniería informática, comenta que decidió estudiar esta carrera por que tiene bastante campo laboral y le gustaría ser un gran  profesional.    
Pide este préstamo para poder pagar las cuotas de su carrera, y de esa forma poder seguir con sus estudios como lo viene haciendo.
texts.en: Sofia is working and studying. She is in her second year of a degree in information engineering. She says that she decided to study this because there are good opportunities and she would like to be a professional. She is requesting this loan to pay her tuition, in order to be able to continue with her studies as she has been.

loans.use: to pay university tuition.

loans.name: Mariano

texts.es:
Mariano vive en una comunidad de Sololá, él tiene 35 años de edad, vive feliz mente con su familia.
Para la generación de ingresos Mariano, se dedica a dos actividades, él cultiva diversidad de verduras, pero otro negocio que el realiza es la compra y venta de abarrotes, según la experiencia de Mariano esta segunda actividad es rentable ya que genera ganancias.
Mariano previo a los préstamos, solo sembraba poco, porque  no contaba con suficiente capital de trabajo, ahora su siembra ha incrementado y compra más productos de abarrotes para su tienda, para Mariano los préstamos son muy buenos ya que solo así uno puede escalar en la vida y cubrir otras necesidades.
Ahora él quiere un nuevo préstamo que lo utilizara, para comprar sus semillas y abono químico para su próximo cultivo. Y otra parte de este préstamo lo utilizara para la compra de más productos de abarrotes. El espera poder obtener una buena ganancia con esta inversión, para compra más terreno y aumentar aún más su cultivo.
texts.en:
Mariano lives in a community of Sololá. He is 35 years old and lives happily with his family. 

To generate income Mariano does two things. He grows a variety of vegetables, and his other business is buying and selling groceries. In Mariano’s experience this second business is profitable since it creates earnings.

Before the loans, Mariano only grew a little, because he didn’t have enough capital. Now his crop has grown, and he buys more grocery products for his store. The loans are good for Mariano, since it is only this way that one can get ahead in life and cover other needs. 

Now he would like a new loan, which he will use to buy seeds and chemical fertilizer for his next crop. Another portion of the loan will be used to buy more grocery products. 

He hopes to be able to make good earnings with this investment, to buy more land and increase his crops even more.

loans.use: to buy seeds and chemical fertilizer.

loans.name: Cindy Mabel

texts.es:
Cindy, de 46 años de edad, estudio hasta cuarto grado, está acompañada y tiene 4 hijos, su compañero de vida se dedica a trabajos agrícolas.

Cindy, se dedica a los oficios domésticos y cuida a sus hijos, pero ella también le ayuda a su pareja en los trabajos agrícolas.

El préstamo que está solicitando es para comprar insumos agrícolas para sembrar maíz y frijol, porque ya tienen lista la tierra donde sembraran.

Ella quiere ver crecer a sus hijos sanos y ayudarlos para que sigan estudiando y tengan mejores posibilidades.
texts.en:
Cindy is 46 years old. She studied up to the fourth grade. She has a partner and 4 children, and her life’s companion works in agriculture.

Cindy works at home and cares for her children, but she also helps her partner with the farming.

The loan she is seeking is to buy agricultural supplies to grow corn and beans, because they already have the land ready where it will be grown.

She wants to raise healthy children and help them to keep studying and have better opportunities.

loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies to grow corn and beans.

loans.name: Epenesa

texts.en:
Epenesa is a 64 year old mother with 9 children, she is still fit and strong in running her business of a small convenience store in her village to earn a living. Epenesa requested for a loan to buy a freezer, box of chicken, sack of flour, sack of rice, box of tinned fish, box of vegetable oil, box of milk, box of sausage and plastic bags, to assist her run the business. 

She has been doing this for more than 4 years. She became a member of SPBD in 2010.

loans.use: to buy a freezer, box of twistiest , box of chicken, sack of flour, sack of rice, box of tinned fish, box of vegetable oil, box of milk, box of sausage and plastic bags,

loans.name: Hugo

texts.en: Hugo is 18 years old and lives with his stepfather. Hugo works as a mechanic assistant. He needs a loan to buy a computer because he decided he will help his mother at her CD stand business. He will install a CD/DVD burner in order to help her. Hugo is healthy and he loves his mother a lot although he doesn't live with her. Hugo is single but he would like to be an independent man. He hopes you can help him.

loans.use: to buy a computer with a CD/DVD burner

loans.name: Mujeres Unidas Group

texts.es:
El comité se llama Mujeres Unidas, es un grupo nuevo con 15 integrantes, están muy entusiasmadas y confiadas con el trabajo que la fundación paraguaya esta realizando con ellas.
Entre estas señoras humildes y trabajadoras se destaca a la Sra. Zulma, quien se desempeña como costurera, hace diferentes tipos de ropas para adultos y niños de todas las edades y las vende en su propio local.
Ella pide este préstamo para poder seguir con sus confecciones y poder comprar telas, hilos, gomas y otros, de manera continuar ayudando a sus seres queridos. Agradece por esta oportunidad de continuar ayudando a su familia.
texts.en:
The committee is called Mujeres Unidas. It is a new group with 15 members. They are very enthusiastic and confident about the work that La Fundación Paraguaya is carrying out with them.

Highlighted among these humble and hardworking women is Sra. Zulma. She works as a dressmaker and makes different kinds of clothes for adults and children of all ages. She sells them in her own storefront.

She is requesting a loan to be able to continue with her dressmaking and be able to buy fabrics, thread, glue and other things. In this way she will continue to help her loved ones. She appreciates this opportunity to continue helping her family.

loans.use: to buy fabrics, thread, glue, and other things.

loans.name: Maria Yolanda

texts.es: La socia Maria Yolanda se sigue dedicando al negocio de venta y compra de quesos moraya y papa, la socia es una persona responsable y trabajadora que por medio de este negocio la socia quiere sacar adelante a su familia. La socia solicita el credito para comprar papa,moraya y quesos para su negocio.
texts.en:
Maria Yolanda is still working in her business buying and selling cheese, moraya [freeze-dried potato] and potatoes. She is a responsible and hard-working person who wants to move her family forward through this business. 

She is asking for the loan to buy potatoes, moraya and cheese for her business.

loans.use: to buy potatoes, moraya [freeze-dried potato] and cheese.

loans.name: Señor De Huanca Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “SEÑOR DE HUANCA”; Este banco se ubicada en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Guillermina ella es casada y tiene 60 años y tiene 3 hijos; La socia trabaja en su negocio de tienda de abarrotes, la socia vende productos de primera necesidad como arroz,azúcar,leche y aceite,la socia por medio de este negocio quiere sacar adelante a su familia, la socia tiene un puesto en el mercado que es una tienda de abarrotes, la socia trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 6:00 p.m,  el sueño de la socia es ampliar el negocio de tienda de abarrotes. La socia solicita el crédito para comprar leche, azúcar, aceite y arroz.


 
Los otros socios se dedican al negocio de venta de tejidos, negocio de venta de alfombras, negocio de tienda de abarrotes y negocio de venta de llantas.


La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
The members belong to the “Señor de Huanca” communal bank. This bank is located in the district of Cusco, belonging to the province of Cusco and department of Cusco.

Guillermina is married, is 60 years old, and has three children. She works in her business selling groceries; she sells staple products like rice, sugar, milk and oil. By means of this business she wants to get her family ahead; she has a post in the market that is a grocery store. She works from 8:00 a.m to 6:00 p.m. Her dream is to expand the grocery store business. She is asking for the loan to buy milk, sugar, oil and rice.

The other members make a living by a business selling woven fabric, a business selling , a business selling groceries and a business selling tires.

Guillermina thanks those who are part of this dream by this means, and she promises to make her payments in the time established

loans.use: to buy milk, sugar, oil and rice.

loans.name: Merla

texts.en:
Merla is thankful and glad that she has repeatedly received support to infuse working capital into her general store business. She continues to persevere in her business though at times she encounters difficulty in collecting her receivables.  

She trusts that you could again grant her a loan of PHP 25,000 to fill her store with all the essential food items like rice, coffee, soda, rice noodles, frozen foods. Her store means a lot to her since this helps greatly in sustaining her family's basic needs and for the education of her children. She praises God for your good heart and your tireless support of her livelihood.

Merla dreams of having a bigger General Store. She prays for God to bless their lives more abundantly. Every week, she meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God which she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay essential food items to sell.

loans.name: Ana

texts.en:
Ana, 61, is married to Benjamin, a carpenter, and lives in one of the rows of shanties in Pasay City. 

Ana would like to request a loan from Kiva today worth PHP 12,000. This would be used to improve her 5-year livelihood - a buy-and-sell business which adds additional capital. 

She has been thinking of how she could develop her business, most especially since this is other means of income for her family. She knows that saving money alone is not enough when worst-case scenarios come. Then, by an incident, she was given a chance to be introduced to CCT, where she became a member last 2007. Through this, she found hope. 

Ana believes that this is now an open door to her dream of acquiring a more affordable life for her family. She hopes to expand her business and buy additional varieties of products to offer other than what is shown in the picture. 

Someday she aspires for her youngest child to finally finish her studies. As of now, she is praying for the unity and good harmony within her household. 

Ana meets up with her co-fellowship* members weekly to share stories of her life and business, and to draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship from the Word of God she studies. 

*All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is comprised of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to buy additional varieties of products to offer in her buy-and-sell business.

loans.name: Cecilia Marbely

texts.es:
Cuando Cecilia supo que poco tiempo cerrarían la empresa a la cual trabajaba, comenzó a pensar de qué iba a sobrevivir, mientras lo meditaba se le ocurrió la idea de utilizar parte del dinero de su liquidación para emprender una pulpería en su hogar, está le permitiría obtener los ingresos necesarios para sacar adelante a sus dos hijos sin descuidarlos.  
Fue así, como Cecila inició su pulpería, con el tiempo las ganancias y la ayuda económica de su esposo, le permitieron poner un kiosko dentro de un colegio de su barrio, de esta forma  pudo generar otro ingreso extra en su hogar. Por ello, solicita un crédito para comprar golosinas, gaseosas, frutas, pan, mortadela, y demás productos que pueda comercializar en sus negocios. Cecilia planea ahorrar las ganancias para comprar un vehículo.
texts.en:
When Cecilia knew that soon would close the business which she worked in, she began to think of what she would do to survive.  While meditating on it, the idea occurred to her to use part of the liquedation money to start a small grocery store in her home.  This permitted her to obtain the income necessary to provide for her two children without neglecting them.  Thus Cecilia began her store with the time, profits, and economic assistance of her husband, they let her put a stand in a school in her neighborhood.  From this, she was able to generate other additional income in her household.

For her, she requests a loan to buy sweets, sodas, fruit, bread, bologna, and other products that she can market in her businesses.  Cecilia plans to save the earnings to buy a vehicle.

loans.use: to buy sweets, sodas, fruit, bread, bologna, and other products.

loans.name: Prima

texts.en: As the married parent of three children, Prima works hard to support her family. She earns a living by buying and selling veterinary products in the Philippines, and also earns additional income by running a general store. Prima has requested a loan for PHP 25,000 from NWTF to buy more veterinary products to sell. Prima has sustained her business activities through five prior loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of earning and saving enough money to provide a secure future to her family.

loans.use: to buy more veterinary products to sell

loans.name: Eugenia Bea

texts.en:
Eugenia Bea is 33 years old and has two children. Eugenia Bea is married, and her two children are in school.

Eugenia Bea is in the agricultural business raising cattle in the Philippines. Eugenia Bea requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her cattle.  Eugenia Bea has been farming rice for four years now, and has borrowed seven times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Eugenia Bea would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her cattle.

loans.name: Maria Catalina

texts.es:
María, de 65 años de edad, es ama de casa, no estudio debido a la falta de recursos económicos, es viuda y tiene 7 hijos, todos son mayores de edad y trabajan para sus propios gastos, actulamente ella solo vive con 4 nietos.

María, trabaja como vendedora de tortillas en la casa de una amiga, este trabajo decidió realizarlo por la necesidad de sacar a sus hijos adelante; también trabaja con ganado, los cuales compra y vende dentro de un periodo, para obtiene más ingresos y ayudar a tener una buena alimentación para ella y sus nietos.

María, está solicitando el crédito para comprar ganado para engordarlos y al año poder venderlos.

El sueño de María es, comprar una vivienda amplia, para que sus nietos puedan vivir en mejores condiciones.
texts.en:
Maria is 65 years old and is a homemaker. She didn’t go to school due to a lack of financial resources. She is a widow and has 7 children. They are all grown and supporting themselves. Currently she lives only with 4 grandchildren.

Maria works selling tortillas from a friend’s home. She decided to do this work because of her need to help her children get ahead. She also works with livestock, which she buys and sells over a period of time, in order to earn more income and have good nutrition for herself and her grandchildren.

Maria is seeking this loan to buy livestock to fatten and sell in a year.

Maria’s dream is to buy an ample home, so that her grandchildren can live in better conditions.

loans.use: to buy livestock to fatten and sell in a year.

loans.name: Naheed

texts.en:
Naheed is 30 years old woman, and mother of 1 child. She lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. Her husband is fruit seller who sells apples, bananas, grapes etc. 

Naheed's husband needs to purchase different types of fruits for reselling purpose so that he can increase the size of business, improve his sales growth and earn maximum profit. But due to an unfavorable financial position, her husband is not in condition to purchase fruits for his business purposes.

Therefore Naheed has applied for Kiva loan from its field partner BRAC Pakistan. So that she can help her husband to purchase the above items for business purpose. 
She is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to increase her husband's fruit business
